68502.name: The Embodiment of Scarlet Devil
68502.description:
User Summary
The 6th installment in the project Shrine Maiden series.

The Embodiment of Scarlet Devil is a straightforward shoot'em-up, except that the player controls a flying girl instead of the typical spacecraft. When enemies are shot down, they may drop various "items", such as Power Ups, Point items or other special items with various effects. The game consists of 6 stages, each stage having a mid-boss and an end-of-stage boss.

In Scarlet Devil, the player can choose between playing the characters Reimu Hakurei (shrine maiden) and Marisa Kirisame (witch). Both character can choose between 2 shot types, 4 combinations.

The backdrop story for Scarlet Devil is that Reimu and Marisa are investigating a strange fog that has appeared. They travel to a nearby lake and find a strange, western mansion, inhabitated by strange individuals.

68503.name: Perfect Cherry Blossom
68503.description:
User Summary
The 7th installment in the project Shrine Maiden series.

Perfect Cherry Blossom is a straightforward shoot'em-up, except that the player controls a flying girl instead of the typical spacecraft. When enemies are shot down, they may drop various "items", such as Power Ups, Point items or other special items with various effects. The game consists of 6 stages, each stage having a mid-boss and an end-of-stage boss.

In Cherry Blossom, the player can choose between playing the characters Reimu Hakurei (shrine maiden), Marisa Kirisame (witch) and Sakuya Izayoi (maid). All three character can choose between 2 shot types, creating 6 combinations.

The backdrop story for Perfect Cherry Blossom is that Reimu and Marisa are investigating why spring never comes because of the cold. They venture into a land where a cursed cherry tree stands, haunted by old ghosts.

68504.description:
From the Designer: Outrider is a game of post-apocalyptic vehicular combat that utilizes a unique blend of dice and card mechanics that create a fast-playing, highly detailed and customizable experience.

Outrider is a print-and-play game designed to use standard-sized cards and sleeves, ordinary dice and has a ready-made range of the most inexpensive miniatures around: 1/64th scale die cast cars.

Teachable in ten minutes, the focus of Outrider is to keep things fast and furious. Most games are playable in a hour. Even with six players, the rounds are quick. The movement mechanics are designed to feel more like driving and less like geometry.

Players select their vehicles from eight templates that represent a wide variety of vehicles from dune buggies and muscle cars all the way to heavy duty trucks and SUVs - each with its own unique characteristics. Players then use dice to further customize (and arm) the vehicles. The dice represent weapons, equipment and even the driver of the vehicle.

Play is centered around a maneuver deck that allows the players to 'program' their action for a turn. Programmable actions include both movement AND attacks. But players need to be careful, their drivers may not be able to handle EVERYTHING demanded of them resulting in a possible loss of control.

Games are scenario based with clear goals to keep the games shorter and focused. Scenarios include such situations as busting through a police roadblock, attacking a renegade compound, escort missions and more. Teams are used, allowing the players to be creative in their vehicle (and equipment) selections. Some vehicles may be better for certain tasks but it always handy to have someone riding backup.

Players can check here on BGG, as well as dicefestgames.com for info on development, new vehicles, new equipment and new scenarios
68504.name: Outrider

68505.name: Imperishable Night
68505.description:
User Summary
The 8th installment in the project Shrine Maiden series.

Imperishable Night is a straightforward shoot'em-up, except that the player controls a flying girl instead of the typical spacecraft. When enemies are shot down, they may drop various "items", such as Power Ups, Point items or other special items with various effects. The game consists of 6 stages, each stage having a mid-boss and an end-of-stage boss.

In Imperishable Night, the player can choose between four combinations of human/daemon, all characters from previous games: Reimu Hakurei/Yukari Yakumo, Marisa Kirisame/Alice Margatroid, Sakuya Izayoi/Remilia Scarlet and Yomu Konpaku/Yuyuko Saigyouji. A special feature of this game is that the character the player uses is switched when the "slow" button is held down.

68506.name: Phantasmagoria of Flower View
68506.description:
User Summary
The 9th installment in the Project Shrine Maiden series.

Phantasmagoria of Flower view is a "versus shmup", played against a human opponent or AI. Players play on a vertically split screen, and the goal is to survive longer than the opponent. Defeating enemies on the own screen will cause bullets to appear on the opponent's screen, not unsimilar to the Puyo Puyo (Puyo Pop) series of "vs puzzle games".

This, and its predecessor Phantasmagoria of Dimension Dream were both inspired by Twinkle Star Sprites.

Playable characters are Reimu Hakurei, Marisa Kirisame, Sakuya Izayoi, Yomu Konpaku, Reisen Udongein Inaba, Cirno, the Prismriver sisters, Mystia Lorelei, Tei Inaba, Aya Shameimaru

68507.name: Shoot the Bullet
68507.description:
Starred in between the ninth and the tenth Shrine Maiden game, in Shoot the Bullet, you're not supposed to shoot down the bosses, instead you are to take photos (screen shots) of the curtain fire by getting as many bullets as possible into the frame of the photo.

playable character is Aya Shameimaru.

68508.name: Mountain of Faith
68508.description:
The tenth game in the Shrine Maiden series. In Mountain of Faith, Reimu and Marisa have discovered something strange on top of a mountain and are investigating. The point system is based on the principle to always shoot something, and never to let time go without some enemy dying.

Playable characters are Reimu Hakurei and Marisa Kirisame. Both characters have a selection of 2 weapon types.

68509.name: Subterranean Animism
68509.description:
User Summary
The 11th installment in the project Shrine Maiden series.

Subterranean Animism is a straightforward shoot'em-up, except that the player controls a flying girl instead of the typical spacecraft. When enemies are shot down, they may drop various "items", such as Power Ups, Point items or other special items with various effects. The game consists of 6 stages, each stage having a mid-boss and an end-of-stage boss.

In Subterranean Animism, the player can choose between playing the standard characters Reimu (shrine maiden) or Marisa (witch). Both have a choice of three different sub-characters, creating 6 combinations. A special feature of this game is that pressing "slow" and "fire" at the same time will activate a special ability. For example, Reimu (with Yukari) can use this to teleport from one extreme side of the screen to the other, whereas Marisa (with Patchouli) can change her shot type mid-game.

The backdrop story for Subterranean Animism is that Reimu and Marisa are diving underground to investigate the strange sounds coming therefrom. They encounter an underground world populated by various underground daemons.

68510.name: Undefined Fantastic Object
68510.description:
The twelfth game in the Shrine Maiden series.

Playable characters are Reimu Hakurei, Marisa Kirisame and Sanae Kotiya.

68513.name: Kingmaker Player's Guide
68513.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Kingmaker Player’s Guide is intended to provide context for creating characters from the nation of Brevoy or surrounding regions who wish to play a role in the Stolen Lands’ transformation. In this campaign, your characters will explore vast wildernesses and settle them, build cities and nations, and even fight wars against opposing kingdoms. Many of these unusual campaign elements are supported by additional rules that appear in other volumes of the Kingmaker Adventure Path—your GM can provide you with the information you need to explore, build, conquer, and war as the need arises in each adventure. As a special preview, some of these elements are presented at the end of this guide so you have all of the blank forms and hex paper you need to track your adventures and achievements in the Stolen Lands.

68518.name: Breakout
videogameversion: Android (Atari Greatest Hits Atari 2600 Emulation) edition
68518.description:
"In the game, a layer of bricks lines the top third of the screen. A ball travels across the screen, bouncing off the top and side walls of the screen. When a brick is hit, the ball bounces away and the brick is destroyed. The player loses a turn when the ball touches the bottom of the screen. To prevent this from happening, the player has a movable paddle to bounce the ball upward, keeping it in play.
"

Source: Wikipedia, "Breakout_(arcade_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68522.name: The Prisoner of Skull Hill
68522.description:
Publisher blurb:

A Chelish outpost deep inside the anarchic orc-controlled Hold of Belkzen has gone silent after strange fires were seen burning in the skies above. You have been sent north to investigate the disappearance and find a lost tomb long rumored to exist beneath the outpost's timber tower. When you arrive and find the place choked with monsters and hideous plant creatures from beyond the stars, your mission of exploration quickly turns to one of survival.

68524.name: Secret of Mana
68524.description:
User summary:

The second installment in the Seiken Densetsu series, Seiken Densetsu 2 was re-named "Secret of Mana" upon the USA release.

Seiken 2 is an action-RPG, where fights are executed like a normal action game, and not via menus. The player is controlling three characters at the same time, it was also possible to play 2 or even 3 players cooperating; controlling one character each.

In the Japanese version, the preset names were Randi (main character), Prim (the girl) and Popoi (the spirit).

Individual credits:
Hiroki Kikuta: Music

68525.name: Superman (Atari 2600)
68525.description:
"The player takes control of the DC Comics hero Superman, who must repair the bridge destroyed by Lex Luthor, capture Luthor and his criminal underlings, enter a phonebooth to turn back into Clark Kent, then return to the Daily Planet in the shortest amount of time. To slow Superman's progress, Kryptonite has been released by Luthor. If hit by Kryptonite, Superman loses his abilities to capture criminals and fly. To regain them, he must find and kiss Lois Lane.

Superman was designed by John Dunn."

Source: Wikipedia, "Superman_(Atari_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogamecompilation: A Collection of Activision Classic Games for the Atari 2600
videogame: A Collection of Activision Classic Games for the Atari 2600
68526.description:
"Pitfall! is a video game released by Activision for the Atari 2600 in 1982. It is one of the best selling games ever made for the Atari 2600, with over 4 million copies sold.

The player must maneuver a character known as Harry through a maze-like jungle in an attempt to recover 32 treasures in a 20 minute period. Over the course of these 20 minutes, Pitfall Harry would have to tackle dense forests, snakes, bats and insects.

Along the way, he must negotiate numerous hazards, including tar pits, quicksand, water holes, rolling logs, rattlesnakes, scorpions, walls, fire, bats, and crocodiles. Harry may jump over or otherwise avoid these obstacles by timing his climbing, running and ducking, and in certain places he can swing on a vine to avoid them.

Pitfall! was designed and programmed by David Crane."

Source: Wikipedia, "Pitfall!," available under the CC-BY-SA License.
videogamepublisher: Pony Canyon, Inc. (株式会社ポニーキャニオン / Kabushiki kaisha Ponī Kyanion)
68526.name: Pitfall!

68527.name: Outlaw
videogameversion: Android (Atari Greatest Hits Atari 2600 Emulation) edition
68527.description:
"Outlaw is a single-player arcade game by Atari Inc., originally released in 1976. It simulates an Old West fast draw duel between the player and the computer. Outlaw was a response to Midway's Gun Fight, released the year before.

A home console port was developed for the Atari 2600 by then-Atari employee David Crane. This version is more directly comparable to Midway's Gun Fight, allowing two players to engage in a shoot-out using the 2600's joysticks. There are also multiple types of game play, that differ slightly from the arcade version, in this Atari 2600 port. Among these game types include target practice and versions with obstacles that must be shot around or shot through."

Source: Wikipedia, "Outlaw_(arcade_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68528.name: Defender (1980)
68528.description:
"Defender is a two-dimensional, side-scrolling shooting game set on the surface of an unnamed planet. The player controls a space ship as it navigates the terrain, flying either to the left or right. A joystick controls the ship's elevation, and five buttons control its horizontal direction and weapons. The object is to destroy alien invaders, while protecting astronauts on the landscape from abduction. Humans that are successfully abducted return as mutants that attack the ship. Defeating the aliens allows the player to progress to the next level. Failing to protect the astronauts, however, causes the planet to explode and the level to become populated with mutants. Surviving the waves of mutants results in the restoration of the planet. Players are allotted three chances (lives) to progress through the game and are able to earn more by reaching certain scoring benchmarks. A life is lost if the ship comes into contact with an enemy or its projectiles. After exhausting all lives, the game ends."

Source: Wikipedia, "Defender_(arcade_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68529.name: Quadrant Z
68529.description:
OBJECTIVE

The objective of the game is to conquer the galaxy - either by occupying the most stars; or by capturing the opponent's home base star, or by destroying the opponent's forces.

SET UP

Each player should draw a 10 by 10 grid. Each set of adjacent 4 squares is grouped into a quadrant, and labeled from A to Y, starting from the top, left hand side quadrant. Each square in a quadrant is numbered from 1 to 4, starting from the top, left hand side square.

One player is allocated the 6 quadrant in the top-left hand side of the board as his home sector, and the other takes the 6 quadrant in the bottom-right hand side of the board as his. The remaining 13 quadrants form the neutral sector. The corner quadrants in each player's home sector are their respective home quadrants.

Each player receives 45 points to create stars in the galaxy.

Quadrat Z is very much a game of cat-and-mouse. As in many wars, you have some idea of an opponent's strength and general location, but very little about the exact composition and location of his forces. Hence, the value of intelligence gathering should not be underrated.

Strategy will vary from game to game, but a major focus should be on the capture of stars: without them your forces will not grow, and , in the long run their lack will certainly cause you to lose. Think carefully about the initial layout of stars, and place your ships to capture the maximum number of points as soon as possible. Try and maintain a balanced force of ship sizes. Movement is hidden, and fairly rapid shifts of forces from one quadrant to another are possible. Remember that in combat the aim is to have the largest combined force - not necessarily a single, high value ship. A single, large strike ship may penetrate enemy lines and take out the opponent's home base... but if he sees it coming he may have time to regroup and knock it out. Spreading your ships out too thinly in a quadrant could also be problematic in combat.

68530.name: SNAFU
68530.description:
User Summary:

Snafu is a one- or two- player game in which players maneuver snakes around the screen. Several options are available for play. In the basic game, which is similar to the lightcycles from Tron, players try to win by eliminating opponents by running them into walls or snake paths or "tails". A second mode existed for players to go head-to-head in a battle to reduce the opponent to zero length by biting off the tail.

In the Intellivision version, players chose what game to play using the number pad. Each code designated the use of NPC snakes, obstacles, diagonal travel (instead of only orthogonal), and whether tails would disappear after a snake was eliminated.

68532.description:
Game included in Vae Victis 91
Pax Romana is a small game about the defense of Roman empire. It can be played solo or in teams of players. this game is designed to allow players to search for the best option between defending and expending the Roman Empire.

Contains:
1 A4 map
73 counter to cut and mount
2 pages rule

68537.description:

A poor innkeep has a ghastly problem on his hands. A strange man staying at the inn was found dead in his room, but when the guard arrived to claim the body, it was missing. More troubling though is his possessions and the holy symbol of an evil god found under his bed. Part Two of the “Key to Greyhawk” series, the first part of which is the Mad God’s Key found in Dungeon Magazine #114. Playing part one is recommended but not required. An adventure for PCs level 1-6 (APLs 2-6).

videogamefranchise: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)
Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

2009 D.I.C.E. Casual Game of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
68541.description:
"Patapon is a video game published for the PlayStation Portable handheld game console combining gameplay features of rhythm games, real-time tactics and God games. The game is presented in a cartoonish, silhouetted two-dimensional environment designed by Rolito, and features the player acting as a deity who commands an army of caricatured miniature tribal creatures by beating traditional talking drums.

The player is put in indirect control of a tribe of Patapon warriors; to command the warriors, the player inputs specific sequences using the face buttons on the PSP, each representing a "talking drum", in time to a drum rhythm. These sequences order the tribe to move forward on the linear battlefield, attack, defend, and other actions. If the player inputs an unknown sequence or enters them off the main rhythm, the tribe will become confused and stop whatever they are doing. However, repeatedly entering a proper sequence in sync with the rhythm will lead the tribe into a "fever" increasing their attack and defensive bonuses. The tribe will stop doing anything after performing the last entered command if the player does not enter any more commands. Some commands are square, square, square, circle (Pata, Pata, Pata, Pon.) and circle, circle, square, circle. (Pon, Pon, Pata, Pon.)"

Source: Wikipedia, "Patapon," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68542.name: Shipyard Rats
rpghonor: 2010 ENnies - Best Electronic Book - Silver Winner
68542.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

When simultaneous kidnappings of Pathfinder and Aspis Consortium agents rock Cassomir's Imperial Naval Shipyards, the Society orders you to join forces with hated Aspis agents to solve the mystery. Can you work together with the enemies of the Society to uncover the source of the kidnappings, or will you perish in the shipyards of Cassomir?

68543.name: Cassomir's Locker
68543.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

The Pathfinder Society dispatches you to the catacombs called Cassomir's Locker to find the source of a rat cult breeding monstrous vermin. After clearing Cassomir's dank sewers and delving into the dirty dungeons below, will you find the artifact that powers Cassomir's Locker or bring about the destruction of Taldor's most important port?

68547.name: Final Fantasy VIII
videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 1999 Japan Game Awards Best Game of the Year Winner
2000 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Winner (Console)
2000 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Winner
2000 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2000 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Winner (Console)
68547.description:
User Summary:

Final Fantasy VIII places the player in control of Squall, a fledgling new member of an elite military team. Through a series of shocking events (and mysterious dreams), Squall is thrust into a conflict beyond imagination. Along the way, you will be joined by 5 others who share your mission as the stakes become increasingly high.
In this game, you are given a large amount of freedom on how you want to customize your characters by using the new "draw" system. In this system, you "draw" magic power either from monsters or from "draw points" scattered around the world and then bind the magic to yourself which increases your skills in different ways. Also, the summon creatures that you capture along the way are highly customizable and you will using their experience points to augment their abilities as you see fit.

Final Fantasy VIII was released for the PS in 1999 and for the PC later that year.

videogamebg: Final Fantasy IX Tetra Master Card game

videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2001 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Winner
2001 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2001 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
2001 D.I.C.E. Best Story of the Year Nominee
2001 D.I.C.E. Console Game of the Year Nominee
2001 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Winner (Console)
68549.description:
From the game box:

Queen Brahne of Alexandria has begun using highly-advanced weapons to terrorize neighboring kingdoms. Her daughter, Princess Garnett, runs away from the castle and befriends a group of good-hearted bandits led by a skilled thief, Zidane, who intends to end the evil queen's desire to dominate the world. Soon after embarking on their quest, they discover the queen's threats merely cover a far more sinister plot. For the sake of mankind, Zidane and his friends must put and end to the Queen's reign before she and the evil forces that accompany her can carry out the deadly plan.

68551.description:
User Summary:

Final Fantasy X sets you in a world where humans are on the brink of extinction and Sin, an evil entity that destroys entire cities, is on the loose. You will command an unlikely band of heros including Tidus, a hero blitzball superstar and Yuna, a brave but young girl who is skilled in summoning. Along with 5 others, you are charged with the task of performing the Final Summoning which is the only way that Sin can be defeated and peace can return to Spira.
This is the first Final Fantasy game that uses full voiceovers for its characters. Battles are again carried out using a turn-based system. In addition to battles, you can spend time playing blitzball when you're in between important missions which is a good way to take a break from the immense main story.

Final Fantasy X was released for the PS2 in 2001.

2001–2002 Japan Game Awards Best Game of the Year Winner

2003 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Nominee

68551.name: Final Fantasy X

68552.description:
From the game box:

Last time she saved the world.
This time it's personal.

Yuna's story continues in the first true sequel in the Final Fantasy series.

New dangers threaten Spira. Familiar allies are at hand. And somewhere, somehow a friend may still be alive.

68561.description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

In Inspektor Hase, players use their rabbit inspectors to hunt down crooks – but every crook has a twin, and you can arrest a crook only when you can nab the pair of them.

How do you catch the crooks? When one of your rabbit inspectors lands in a search area, you can turn the two face-down tokens located there face up. Plop another rabbit into a second search area which turns out to have a matching crook, and you can claim the two of them. Depending on the number of players, the first person to capture three or four pairs of crooks wins.
68561.name: Inspektor Hase

68562.description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

Hasenjagd ("Rabbit Hunt" in English) has players take turns moving a rabbit through the grass, trying to avoid foxes along the way. The hare card that a player chooses uses arrows to show where the rabbit moves – and if you can't lay hare cards to move the rabbit to safety, then you're out of the round. Hop the right way, and you'll run away with the golden carrot.
68562.name: Hasenjagd

68568.description:
[From the back of the box]:

Fight monsters and mini-bosses, avoid ghosts and the burning sun. Make your way through water and quicksand. Dodge cannon balls and bullets and rescue the King's wand!

In Super Mario Bros. 3, there are more warps, more chances at extra lives, and new special suits! The raccoon suit lets you fly and knock out blocks. The frog suit helps you out-swim deadly fish. There are suits for every occasion!

Store up flowers and mushrooms to use later on. Play game-show type bonus rounds! Go back to that last screen and get a mushroom! Pause to take a break, then continue where you left off!

Super Mario Bros. 3 is fun to play alone, or team up with a buddy to prolong the adventure!
videogamehonor: 2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

videogame: Super Mario All-Stars / Super Mario World

68569.description:
[From the back of the box]:

Tackle a whole new world with Mario & Yoshi!

Mario's off on his biggest adventure ever, and this time he's brought a friend. Yoshi the dinosaur teams up with Mario to battle Bowser, who has kidnapped Princess Toadstool once again. Guide Mario and Yoshi through nine peril-filled worlds to the final showdown in Bowser's castle.

Use Mario's new powers and Yoshi's voracious monster-gobbling appetite as you explore 96 levels filled with dangerous new monsters and traps. Climb mountains and cross rivers, and descend into subterranean depths. Destroy the seven Koopa castles and find keys to gain entrance to hidden levels. Discover more warps and thrilling bonus worlds than ever before!

Mario's back, and this time he's better than ever!

68586.name: Final Cup
68586.description:
Final Cup is a simple Dice Soccer game.
There is no ball in the game, the players are moved by a single 6-sided die. Once a player reaches the other teams goal a goal is scored.
The game was published in the GDR.

68588.name: Reise zum Horizont
rpgissuearticle: Expeditionsflotille Güldenland kurz vor dem Ankerlichten
68588.description:
Translated from the back of the book:

Güldenland! The name alone reminds of ancient cultures, incredible wealth, exotic spices and weird animal species - and the fact that every journey there is connected with an unestimateable risk lures discoverers and adventures alike. Up to now the crossings were fearless single enterprises, but now the Horasreich with all its state and financial power backs the discovery of the Güldenland and supports the trade. It has entrusted its most famous and experienced captain with the task. But the Horasreich is at war with the pirates of Thorwal. These northeners are also drawn west, to their old native country Hjaldingard. The fact that the Empire and Al'Anfa want to have a piece of the cake as well spins intrigues, and the party of heroes are heavily involved...

68589.name: Der Ring der Seelenlosen
68589.description:
(from the back of the book)
Al'Anfa - black pearl of the south sea, the city of the grandee's palaces and the mighty church of Boron. Al'Anfa - the plague boil of the south, centre of the slavery, suppression, poverty and crime. Both Al'Anfas - with all their typical malices - are the destination of the heroes, on their way to find the cause of bad dreams of a trader and the track of his missing spouse - but there are powers in the shadows that seem to want to prevent the success of the heroes at all costs.

68590.name: Adventurer (Issue 7 - Feb 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Big Trouble on a Little Planet
68590.description:
Contents:


Editorial
Figures Front - Essex Miniature Fantasies.
Women in Roleplaying - Part 2: Non-human Females.
Shop Window - Games,games and more games reviewed!.
Live by the sword - It's "Editor's-back-to-the-wall" time.
Fanzines Forever - Reviews of the latest in the "amateur" world.
Town Crier - A candid look at the games business.
Black Plastic Hair - A futuristic short story.
Religion in RPGs - Articles for Cthulhu, Runequest and role-players.
Classified - New Lamps for old...
Voyages Beyond - Dr Who, Superman and more.
Big trouble on a little Planet - A generic SF adventure to give your PCs some concern!
Church of the White ZOne - Set in Scatophagium, Adventurer's campaign world.


Cover by Robin Parry

68591.name: Wie Wasser im Sand
68591.description:
Translated from the back of the book:

Mherwed: The city on the shore of the Mhanadi, seat of the caliph, squirming centre of the culture of the Novadi. HYou#ve ended up here, and now you look for a job.
You hear that soon in Unau one of the legendary camel races will be held - this is enogh reason to take on teh dangerous journey through the pitiless Khôm desert. But this desert isnt called pitiless for nothing. And thus you have to deal with sand storms, wild raiders and tribeal chiefs without remorse - if you have not died out of thirst under the glowing sun before.

68594.name: Dante's Inferno
68594.description:
From Publisher:

The Descent

Outside the city walls of Acre, Dante finds himself in a dark forest. For him, the clear path has been lost, and only the visions of slaughter and war can be seen clearly. The Bishop's promises were nothing but empty lies, words spoken without the authority of God. Lost in the madness, Dante's passions consume him as he gives into the darkness. Now, at the crossroads of this world and the next, only Dante's love for his Beatrice keeps him moving forward. The darkness however, is not done with Dante and has taken his love where no living man may go. Dante is now faced with the impossible task of reclaiming his love from the furthest reaches of Hell itself. With the help of a poet and the fire in his heart, Dante begins his descent.

68595.name: The Chronological Star of the World: An Entertaining Game
68595.description:
The gameboard showing a circle with a star pattern of 8 large points alternating with 8 small points, with crescent and star shapes. With a ribbon pattern around outer edge. No. of squares: 109, all illustrated and numbered.

The game is played anti-clockwise with No. 1 at the bottom of the point which is in the central position at the bottom of the game. The first 24 are alternately the points and the ribbon illustrations around the outer edge. Nos. 25 to 56 combine the second illustration in the large points, the first illustration in the small points and the illustrations in the stars and crescents. These two designs are in the spaces between the points and form an alternating pattern of two crescents, two stars. The rest of the numbers are shown on the points and around the central illustration which is dedicated to the Abolition of Slavery.

68596.name: The Infant's Cabinet of Fishes
68596.description: Wooden box with sliding lid that has an illustration of a fishbowl containing three fish on a table in a garden. The box contains cards and a small booklet. The booklet is titled A History of Fishes Volume II and has descriptions of 30 fish. The fish cards each have a hand coloured etching of a fish with its name and a reference to where it appears in the History of Fishes. Also on the card is the publisher's name and address and date of publication, October 3rd 1801.

68598.name: Civil War Trivia Board Game
68598.description:
A game of Civil War trivia played across a map of the U.S. and C.S.A. with lead figures. It uses a mix of wargaming and trivia to reproduce the American Civil War.

Players each have 3 armies. On a players turn they will roll the dice, march an army, and answer a question. As a bonus to answering a question correctly, an Active Move is earned. An incorrect answer always ends a players turn. Battles are fought when players end their turn with their armies in the same space as the other player. The game ends when one player holds 5 key positions in the West and Eastern theaters.

Action Moves
a) Raise the Colors
b) Travel by Rail
c) Travel by Water
d) Draw a Travel Card
e) Parole an Army

From the Creators
Civil War Trivia Board Game was produced with the Civil War enthusiast in mind. Based upon actual personalities and events of the Civil War era, it stands as a unique concept of trivia and strategy. So...make yourself Comfortable, General, and prepare to meet the enemy...

68600.name: Dragon Annual 3
rpgissuearticle: Arcane Lore - The Prayers of Stromp and Havvel
Bazaar of the Bizarre - Falcon's Bazaar
Wyrm's Turn - Save Us a Place
68600.description:
All New Material!

Vol. XXIII, No. 13
Annual #3, 1998
Cover art by D Frazier

68601.name: Battle of Anegawa
68601.description:
The issue game covers the early important battle of Oda Nobunaga against the Asano-Asakura alliance.
The game is a kind of grand tactical combat game. The characteristic mechanics is "Urakuzure" which emphasizes the army morale. Urakuzure happens when one of the side's busho (leaders) is lost. The effect is the sama as a regular morale check which usually happens on CRT.
This mechanics can accelerates the collapse of losing army dramatically. This makes the game shorter and more exciting.

68602.name: Satsuma Rebellion 1877
68602.description:
This game covers the last battle around Meiji-Ishin.
One of the important Bakumatsu people, Takamori Saigoh decided to make a revolt in his home area, Satsuma (Kagoshima) in 1877 against his old friends and partners inside Meiji government.
The map covers the whole Kyushu island and uses point to point system.
The game has only 48 counters. This is a small second game, but players can focus the important strategic decisions.
The victory is basically determined by Saigoh's end.
Historically he killed himself in the middle of his losing battle.
But, in this game, if Saigoh player cleverly play the game, there's a chance of bloody stalemate which means that he can propose some of his desire to the government for this revolt.

68603.description:
"Over all of Spain, the sky is clear."

On July 17, 1936, this phrase was broadcast throughout Spain, signaling the beginning of the Spanish Civil War, one of the bloodiest civil wars of the modern era, and what could be considered the beginning of World War II. Within a day, one third of Spain was under the control of Nationalist forces attempting to stage a military coup. Over the next three years, what began as a military rebellion evolved into the physical battle lines of the much larger ideological conflict spreading across Europe between Fascism and Communism.

Popular Front recreates this conflict in 90-minute strategy game form, leading players to compete against their ideological counterparts not only for military positioning, but for political victory. Players must be concerned about the position of their forces on the board, but the composition of a player's hand will affect their success in combat more often than not. Plays with two, four, or six players split into two teams. Players each have an identical 20-card deck (with unique, original propaganda posters actually used in the war) that results in the use of your cards being more important than the luck of the draw. Strategic thinking, trickery, teamwork, and a dash of courage are what lead to victory in Popular Front.
68603.name: Popular Front

68604.description:
From the official WarriorElite newsletter (summarized):

War Unleashed - the companion to War for Edath.

Battlefield rules - now you can battle over large battlefields for the full tabletop, battlegame experience where strategy in deployment and movement is key - many Terrain Maps (battlefields) will be available free to download online & others will be included in future expansion packs.

The Art of War - campaign rules where you'll compete over a region of Edath. Includes gaining experience and 'leveling up' troops, champions & leaders.

The Art of the Master - expanded rules for Combat & Battle Masters that unleash their true potential. Includes skills and is the basis for having characters in your games.

Background on the World of Edath is also contained within War Unleashed. A map, history, world details, Edath's species, the warring factions, countries of Edath, the Dzaa Empire & the Supernatural - including magic - are all covered.

War Unleashed comes in paperback, A5 format - 144 fully illustrated pages and an 8 page, full-colour section of artwork.
68604.name: War Unleashed: Volume 1

68605.name: Kocham Cię, Polsko!
68605.description: ("I love you, Poland!) a trivia game with questions about Polish history, culture, sport and movie celebrities, and songs. uses talisman-style roll-and-move mechanic. players need to answer correctly questions in each of 6 different categories on the way to the finish space in the center.

boardgamehonor: 2011 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
68606.description:
Siegfried, Snow White, D'Artagnan, Red Riding Hood, and the other heroes of the twelve realms are being reunited for one last great adventure. The Dark Lords have joined forces to completely conquer and subjugate all the known Lands, and only the combined efforts of all the greatest heroes can halt their nefarious plan.

12 Realms is a fast, lighthearted cooperative miniature game for 1 to 6 players. All players must band together to stop the Dark Lords' overwhelming hordes from pillaging the 12 Realms. Individual invaders can be defeated by using each hero's different talents, but to vanquish the Dark Lords you must claim a powerful artifact.

In their quest to stop the invasion, the heroes can travel together between different lands, or they can try to single-handedly defend a Realm. Each of the 12 Realms is an individual land, with different treasures and events, and populated by unique creatures.
68606.name: 12 Realms
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep 65 - How to: Gaming Groups
The Game Pit: Episode 46 - Council Chamber: Big Episode on Small Games

68607.name: SoulCalibur II
videogameversion: North American Xbox (Best of Platinum Hits) edition
videogamefranchise: Best of Platinum Hits (Select Best Selling Xbox Games, US)
Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)
videogamehonor: 2002 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2003 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Winner
2003 Golden Joystick Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
2003 Spike Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2003 Spike Most Addictive Game of the Year Winner
2004 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2004 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Winner
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Animation of the Year Winner
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
68607.description:
From the game box:

Four years have passed since the spirit sword, Soulcalibur, defeated the evil Soul Edge. At the end of that fateful battle, the shards of the shattered Soul Edge we scattered across the world and Soulcalibur was lost to the void. Now, the evil that still resides in the scattered shards of Soul Edge threatens again to engulf the world in darkness.

68608.name: SoulCalibur
videogamehonor: 1999 EGM Game of the Year Winner
1999 EGM Platinum Game Winner
1999 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Winner
2000 D.I.C.E. Console Game of the Year Winner
2000 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Winner
68608.description:
From the game box:

This is a tale of souls and swords, transcending the world and all it's history, told for all eternity...

SoulCalibur... the ultimate fighting game.

68609.name: SoulCalibur III
videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2005 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Winner
2005 Spike Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2006 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Winner
68609.description:
From the game box:

Nightmare returns to wield the evil sword Soul Edge in SoulCalibur III. This new edition to a legendary franchise pits classics and new characters in in lethal battles for the legendary swords. Continue the timeless saga of these epic battles in the "Tales of Souls" mode. Delve deeper into the world of SoulCalibur by creating your own warrior in "Character Creation" mode, and engaging in real-time strategy battles in "Chronicle of the Sword" mode.

68610.name: SoulCalibur Legends
68610.description:
From the game box:

SoulCalibur Legends, a 3rd person action adventure, exclusively for the Wii console follows the exploits of Siegfried and other SoulCalibur favorites. Fight in a new adventure set between the events of Soul Blade and the original SoulCalibur game.

68611.name: Soul Blade
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
68611.description:
From the game box:

What's next in fighting? How about a game that takes 3D movement, polygonal characters, razor sharp graphics, awe-inspiring moves and a one-of-a-kind combat system? Or, in short, Soul Blade... arguably the most innovative fighting game on the planet. It's the 15h century and ten warriors from around the world, each wielding their weapon of choice, are in pursuit of Soul Egde - the ultimate weapon.

68613.name: Heroes of Olympus
rpgissuearticle: Land of the Pharaohs - Aegytian Extension for Heroes of Olympus
Retrospective: Swordbearer and Heroes of Olympus ­Reviews and The Odyssey
Who's Who in Heroes of Olympus
68613.description:
From the back of the box:

Now you can relive and recreate the adventures of the Argonauts!

Heroes of Olympus is a heroic fantasy role-playing game for multiple players and a gamemaster. It can also be played as a conventional two player combat game or even solitaire mode.

Heroes of Olympus includes: Full colour campaign map, four scanrio maps, more than 200 playing pieces. Scenarios include The Challange of Amycus, King Phineus and the Harpies, The Clashing Rocks, The Golden Fleece and more! The game system covers Gods, Humans, Parentage, Melee and Noble Combat, Trickery, Navigation and Naval Combat, Campaign rules and much more.

68614.description:
Armored Trooper Votoms: The Battling Card Game (
装甲騎兵ボトムズ ザ バトリング カードゲーム) is a collectible card game inspired by events in the anime of the same name.

Game-play focuses on the competitors in the Astradan empire's premier bloodsport: Armored Trooper (AT) Battling.

Be the first to exhaust your opponent's deck in an effort to destroy their AT and take your place among Uoodo's finest.
68614.name: Armored Trooper Votoms: The Battling Card Game

68615.name: Hammerfast: A Dwarven Outpost Adventure Site
68615.description:
From the Back of Book:

If you're a Dungeon Master looking for an intrigue-laden adventure location that fits easily into your Dungeons and Dragons campaign, this book is for you. The dwarven town of Hammerfast holds enough mystery and peril to keep your players entertained for sessions on end.

Hammerfast presents a fully detailed, ready-to-use dwarven town built atop the ruins of an ancient necropolis, along with adventure hooks, encounters, and a full-color, double-sided battle map.

68616.name: Bigbep Hockey
68616.description:
BigBep Hockey is designed to play quickly while providing accurate statistics. But most of all, the game is designed to feel like hockey and provide the gamer with an enjoyable and immersive experience.

BigBep Hockey utilizes a Fast Action Deck and a Fast Results deck to greatly enhance the speed of play. The vast majority of all results are found without consulting outside charts. Once you have learned the rules, contests in BigBep hockey fly by.

While the game plays rapidly, this isn’t a watered down hockey game, nor is it a quick-play game. This is a full-fledged simulation of hockey. In BigBep Hockey each skater is rated for the following: Shooting from various places on the ice, Power Play ability, Penalty Killing ability, Overall Offensive contribution, Overal Defensive Contribution, shots allowed, intimidation, passing, face-offs, injury frequency, times penalized, and a clutch rating. Goalies are also rated for both home and away performance. BigBep Hockey truly captures the entire game of hockey.

The board game includes complete rules, 100 die-cut, full-color Fast Action Cards, 100 die-cut, full-color Fast Result Charts, and all charts, printed in full-color, that are needed to play the game.

68617.name: Dragon Annual 4
rpgissuearticle: Arcane Lore - Secrets of the Slime Wizard
Bazaar of the Bizarre - The Bare Necessities
Dungeon Module:  The Kindness of Strangers
Rogues Gallery - Beyond the High Road
The Wyrm's Turn - 25 Years and Counting
68617.description:
Gygax on 25 Years of D&D!

Vol. XXIV, No. 13
Annual #4, 1999
Cover art by Mark Zug

68619.name: Hegemonia
68619.description:
Roughly translated from the publisher/ partners website:

In Hegemonia it is all about being the master of the Mediterranean. Military strength and tactical nous is necessary in order to take the Greek, Persian, Roman, Carthagenian or German to glory and prominence.

The battle for the Mediterranean impresses not only through simple rules, but also through extensive armies of over 100 highly detailed miniature models.

In German:

In Hegemonia dreht sich alles um die Vorherrschaft am Mittelmeer. Militärische Stärke und taktisches Geschick werden benötigt um die Griechen, Perser, Römer, Karthager oder Germanen zu Glanz und Gloria zu führen. Der Kampf um die Macht am Mittelmeer besticht nicht nur durch seine einfachen Spielregeln, sondern auch durch die umfangreiche Ausstattung mit über 100 detailliert modellierten Miniaturen.

68620.description: The first game in the Armor Grid System is Armor Grid: Mech Attack! With an innovative game system and print and play 15mm scale Mech, Vehicle, and Infantry miniatures, this is a game of sci-fi mechanized military combat in skirmish and wargame scales. Compete against your friends in one-on-one duels or extended military campaigns.
68620.name: Armor Grid: Mech Attack!

68621.name: Die kleinen Abenteurer
68621.description:
The board game shows a map of the eastern half of the world: Europe, Asia, Africa and Australia with part of Alaska.

The game is played by following the pattern of circles numbered 2 to 50. Circles 9,11,16,19,24,40 and 45 are red and represent rewards; circles 2,3,8,13,17,18,22,29,36,37,41,42,46 and 49 are white and represent forfeits. The rest of the circles are blue. You start at Berlin.

Published in Germany.

68622.name: Adventurer (Issue 8 - Mar 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Women in Roleplaying: More Deadly Than the Male
68622.description:
Adventurer Issue 8, March 1987
The Superior Fantasy and Science Fiction Game Magazine
Cover art by Richard T Dorian

The Ladybird guide to Scatophagium.

68623.name: Ninja Gaiden
68623.description:
From the game box:

The stage is set for conspiracy, mystery and evil in America. Come with Ninja Ryu as he takes you on his fateful journey.

68624.name: Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos
68624.description:
"Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos, known in Japan as Ninja Ryukenden II: Ankoku no Jashinken and as Shadow Warriors 2 in Europe, is a side-scrolling platforming video game developed and published by Tecmo for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). It was released in Japan on April 6, 1990, in North America in May 1990, and in Europe on October 27, 1994. The game was later released for the Commodore Amiga and DOS-based PCs by GameTek in 1991. It was then released for the Wii's Virtual Console service on October 15, 2007 in North America. This game is the second installment in the Ninja Gaiden trilogy for the NES."

Source: Wikipedia, "Ninja_Gaiden_II:_The_Dark_Sword_of_Chaos," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68625.name: Ninja Gaiden II
68625.description:
From the game box:

In this action-packed sequel to Ninja Gaiden, you are Ryu Hayabusa, the ultimate ninja hero. Destroy everything in your path as you embark on a quest to avenge your clan and prevent the destruction of the human race from a brutal and relentless enemy. Armed with special moves, deadly weapons and the ruthlessness of a ninja, you shall leave a wake of death in the name of honor.

68626.name: Ninja Gaiden (Xbox)
videogamehonor: 2003 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2004 Spike Best Action Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2004 Spike Best Graphics of the Year Nominee
68626.description:
From the game box:

This time it's personal... Ryu Hayabusa, the deadly and feared ninja assassin, is out for blood after his clan is massacred y the evil Vigoor empire. Vowing to seek revenge on those that wronged him, Ryu sets off on an action-packed adventure where the lines between good and evil are blurred and all he believes in will be tested. Posses the fury of Ryu Hayabusa as you destroy your opponents using lethal ninja weapons, cunning skills and amazing acrobatic moves. You mission: to annihilate your enemies, ultimately defeating the powerful Vigoor empire.

videogamecompilation: Star Wars: The Best of PC
videogame: Star Wars: The Best of PC
68627.description:
From the game box:

It is four thousand years before the Galactic Empire and hundreds of Jedi Knights have fallen in battle against the ruthless Sith. You are the last hope of the Jedi order. Can you master the awesome power of the Force on your quest to save the Republic? Or will you fall to the lure of the dark side? Hero or villain, savior or conqueror... you alone with determine the destiny of the entire galaxy!

2003 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee

videogamehonor: 2004 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2005 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2005 Spike Best RPG of the Year Nominee
68628.description:
From the game box:

It is a time of darkness, five years after the events of the award-winning KOTOR. The Sith Lords have hunted the Jedi Order to the edge of extinction and a lone Jedi Knight remains - you. As you struggle to reconnect with the Force, your decisions will lead you to the light or dark side and will affect everyone around you. The fate of the galaxy rests in your hands.

68629.name: Mario Bros.
videogameversion: North American Atari 2600 (Large Picture Label) edition
North American Atari 2600 (Small Picture Label) edition
videogamefranchise: NES Black Box (1980s NES Games, US)
68629.description:
From the game box:

Mario the carpenter and his brother, Luigi, are at it again! This time they're battling a barrage of crawling pests in a houseful of surprises. Help Mario brave the battle alone or team up with a friend for a two-brother battle.

Trivia
There were numerous ports of this original arcade game, and two for the Commodore 64. The first of these was never commercially released (see http://www.digitpress.com/library/interviews/interview_gregg...).

68630.name: Donkey Kong
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
videogamefranchise: NES Black Box (1980s NES Games, US)
68630.description:
From the game box:

You are Mario and that big old gorilla, Donkey Kong, has run off with your girlfriend. It's up to you to struggle up those ladders and to balance on those beams to rescue your lady fair. She's held captive at the very top. But Donkey Kong is not ready to give her up so easily. He's tossing barrels and fireballs at you at every turn. It's up to you to outmaneuver that wily ape. Good luck, your lady awaits.

68631.name: Conquista la Corona
68631.description:
From box:
King Harold, had just returned to England from the Crusades, not time to declare his succession who dies suddenly.
Her 4 children are the heirs virtual, but only one can become the true king.
Each player will have to impersonate at beginning of the game the King is not entitled, to one of four colors, in defiance of all the others to become the authentic depositary of the Crown.
The achievement will not be easy!
The game features 2 decks for a total of 90 cards.
Initially will distribute 8 cards of Army to each contestant and then they draw from the deck of event cards a card which constitute the performance of the real game.
Happen so bloody battles in which you can conquer Castles, Keys or Crowns, or see your Army decimated.
The game should be played in three round. Every round ends in two ways: one player obtains a "Full Victory" (Crown, Castle, Key of his colour and the Royal Seal) or all the Event cards have been turned up without a Full Victory.
In every case every player goes to mark on a paper his or her score.
It will also depend on luck but remember that amid the storms of events is not only the fate that you should count, but especially about your strategy skills, how to field Armies and your skill in negotiation.
There will then be unexpected as considerable pestilence, tax liability and Magicians are able to perform any spells.

68632.name: GURPS WWII: Red Tide
68632.description:
From the Steve Jackson Web Site:

In the earliest days of World War II, the Soviet Union agreed to split Eastern Europe with Nazi Germany like two lions sharing a carcass. But in June 1941, Hitler turned on Stalin and launched Operation Barbarossa, a massive invasion of Russia. Long mistrusted by the other Allies, Stalin was now of necessity an ally . . . though one to keep at arm's length.

GURPS WWII: Red Tide is the definitive sourcebook on Soviet forces in World War II. From the three-year siege of Leningrad to naval encounters in the Baltic and Black Seas, from the final drive on Berlin to the invasion of Japanese-held Manchuria, Red Tide brings the horror and the bravery of the Eastern Front to your gaming table.

68633.name: Taverns
68633.description:
From the Steve Jackson Games web site:

"You meet in a tavern . . ."

Thus begins a thousand tales of dungeon-delving escapades, and once the quest is at an end, the alehouse welcomes heroes home. In worlds of Dungeon Fantasy, the tavern need not exist merely as an alcoholic alpha and omega; it can also serve as the focal point for adventure! Dungeon Fantasy 10: Taverns covers all these possibilities, including:

A description of bar life and tavern regulars, including stats for a dozen types of folks that adventurers might encounter – watch out for the thief, belligerent drunk, and young tough!
A template for Dungeon Fantasy Innkeeper PCs.
Rules and ideas for bar fights. Now a "quiet evening out" can be anything but.
Detailed write-ups of four taverns, complete with floor plans, room descriptions, inhabitant info and stats, and adventure ideas for each location.
Loot related to taverns, including magic items, treasure maps, and more.




Whether you're meeting an old man with a mysterious message in the small alehouse Pernel's, taking the "back door" to dungeon adventure in the pub aptly named The Cave, or starting a fight in the two-story Broken Oar at the end of a quest, Dungeon Fantasy 10: Taverns has the information you need on tap!

68634.name: Flippin' Dolphins
68634.description:
Flip your hoops onto dolphins to win! Be the first player to score 50 points.

An electronic base unit containing 4 colored dolphin heads is turned on and rotates around while dolphin heads bob up and down. Each player places one of his 10 rings on his seal's tail and flips the tailback to release the ring. Players keep flipping rings until all 10 have been used. This constitutes a round. AT the end of a round scores are tallied :
A ring around a large spinning dolphin of your color: 5 points
A ring around and large color spinning dolphin: 3 points
A ring around any stationary gray dolphin: 1 point

Players keep playing round until a someone reaches a total score of 50 points.

68635.name: GURPS Banestorm: Abydos
68635.description:
From the Steve Jackson Games web site:

Abydos: The merest whisper of the name sends shivers down the spines of the God-fearing people of Yrth. What lurks in the forbidden city of Abydos is so great a heresy, the Church suppresses all mention of its very existence. But such loathing has no meaning for the shambling, silent bodies who roam the streets of Abydos. The undead are the greatest resource of the necromantic priests who practice their dark heresies in that city. Their beliefs and mandates are backed by the blades of highly trained soldiers and a very silent majority.

Written by fan-favorite author David Pulver (co-author of GURPS Fourth Edition), GURPS Banestorm: Abydos gives full details on the City of the Dead. This book describes Abydos' history, its religious and temporal organizations, and key features within the city itself. It also includes descriptions of major people and beings of the city, as well as adventure ideas and plot hooks for incorporating Abydos into your campaign.

Although designed for the Banestorm setting, GURPS Banestorm: Abydos is suitable for any GURPS Fantasy campaign that needs a "realistic" city of necromancers and their minions.

68637.description:
This is a football simulation performed with the cards.
It's possible to simulate any football game, a player against the other or in teams.
Players move with the launch of one or two dice on a default path, trying to end their movement on the boxes that allow him to play cards to attack.
If your opponent has cards appropriate defense, interrupts the action of attack and can leave again becoming he attacker, otherwise the first player to draw cards that will enable him to perform actions prior to center field, then in the area up to the shot.
A goal is scored when launching the special dice, you get the symbol on.
The game ends when the entire path will be traced.
Obviously wins whoever marked the most goals.
It is possible to conclude the match in a draw.

A new take on the classic memory game, S'Match challenges young players to find matching pairs by color, number or category. Only here, it's the S'Match Spinner that decides which way to match-and every player gets a spin! Pictures and words allow pre-readers and early readers to play together and enjoy hours of memory-building fun.

68642.name: Partner
68642.description:
From Box:
Partner is a psychological game for 3,4,5 or 6 people.
Its purpose is to identify among the players, pairs of people, tastes, feelings, habits and tendencies have significant affinity.
With partners, therefore, not only form ideal couples in terms of sentiment, but their combination of persons who may have an effective agreement in other areas, such as business, entertainment, cultural interests and so on.
The game involves at any time all participants, who, responding to questions on the board should form a "chain of understanding" with another player.
Once it is formed a pair examined the psychological aspect.
Partner with discover in a fun and enjoyable nature of your relationships with others.
The results are surprising and unexpected!

68643.name: Wrap Cut Bang
68643.description:
The object of the game is to place all of your pieces onto the playing surface before your opponent can place all of theirs.

Each player receives 18 pieces in their colour. The pieces either show a 'rock', 'scissors', or 'paper' symbol. Each turn you must play your "reserve" tile that you selected the previous turn, and then select a new tile for your reserve, anticipating your opponent's next move. Placements rules are basically that your symbol must overpower at least one other symbol beside it (using standard rock-scissors-paper rules.) You lose a turn if you can't place your reserve piece onto the board, and you must then choose a new reserve piece for your next turn.

68651.name: PocketStation
68651.description:
The PocketStation is a peripheral by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation home video game console. Categorized by Sony as a miniature personal digital assistant, the device features a monochrome liquid crystal display (LCD), infrared communication capability, a real-time clock, built-in flash memory, and a sound capability. Connecting to a PlayStation through a memory card slot, the PocketStation also functions as a PlayStation memory card. It was released exclusively in Japan on January 23, 1999.

Software for the PocketStation was typically distributed as extras for PlayStation games, included in the CD-ROM, enhancing the games with added features. Stand-alone software could also be downloaded through the PlayStation console. The software is then transferred to the PocketStation for use. A built-in infrared data interface allows direct transfer of data such as game saves between PocketStation units, as well as multiplayer gaming.

The original Japanese ship date for the PocketStation was set for December 23, 1998, but it was delayed a full month. Sony only shipped an initial 60,000 units of the peripheral when it was released on January 23, 1999. It was initially available in two case colors: white and clear. It proved extremely popular, selling out all over the region. Sony planned to release the PocketStation in the United States, but cancelled the localization due to manufacturing and supply-and-demand problems. A few games, such as Final Fantasy VIII and SaGa Frontier 2, retained PocketStation functionality in their localized versions.

The PocketStation's most popular game was Dokodemo Issho, which sold over 1.5 million copies in Japan and is the first game to star Sony's mascot Toro. The PocketStation was discontinued in July 2002 after having shipped nearly five millions units.

Source: Wikipedia, "PocketStation", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68652.name: Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow
videogameversion: North American Nintendo DS (Konami's Best) edition
videogamefranchise: Konami the Best (Best Selling Konami Games, JP)
68652.description:
[From Back of Box]

Reach out and touch the magic...

A year has passed since Soma Cruz discovered the evil of Dracula hidden inside of his body. Now, a mysterious cult wants to release the power of the lord of Darkness. As Soma, you must do everything in your power to stop them before it's too late.

68653.name: Henry Hatsworth in the Puzzling Adventure
68653.description:
[From Back of the Box]

Action and Adventure with a Puzzling Twist

Battle through an action adventure while mastering the Puzzle Realm. Encounter enemies and power-ups in each world that affect the other!

68654.name: Medieval Times Game
68654.description:
From the box: "New Family Game. Official Game of Medieval Times Dinner & Tournament. The Epic Game of Tournament Competition."

From the inner box: "My noble knights, you honor me with your presence. I Don Raimundo II, Count of Perelada, welcome you to my castle for a tournament of games. Now let the tournament begin!"

From the rules: "Be the first player to obtain all four tournament Victory Cards and present them to the Count and Countess at the Victory Banquet. The four tournaments are as follows: Sword Fighting, Ring Piercing, Jousting, Javelin throwing."

User summary: The game consists of a rolled-up cloth-backed faux-leather board with all four events located around the castle along with--in each corner--the sequence of moves to participate in each event; Fate cards, Victory cards in four colors: Salmon, Blue, Yellow and Green. 4 pewter knights in each of those colors; one die and the rules.

68656.description:
Book Introduction:
"Classical Hack Scenarios is intended to provide historical miniature games interested in classical warfare with fast, playable, and entertaining scenarios. The scenarios themselves are designed to be used with the Classical Hack game system. Gamers can covert the lists to another system they wish with a little work on their part."

68659.description:
Designer Summary:

The galaxy is a busy place and no job is as busy as a taxi driver. Your job is to pilot your taxi ship through warp gates picking up and dropping off passengers. Be careful of the nexus though, should your ship stop there you never know where you will end up. Will you be the first taxi driver to deliver seven passengers before the work day is over?

Nexus Taxi is a light and chaotic two player print-and-play game. Players will need, besides printing the game board, 1 ten-sided die, 14 passenger bits (such as cubes or meeples), and 2 taxis able to hold a passenger piece.

The game board and directions for play can be found in the image and files section (pending).
