3 Leder (Editorial - Tommy Jensen)
4 Sladder Guide (Gossip Guide)
5 Nyheder & Sladder (News & Gossip - Christian Johansen & Tommy Jensen)
8 I-8-2-MUCH (Paranoia adventure - Morten Larsen)
15 CURSED (GURPS Disadvantages - Nemo Hansen)
17 Paranoia (Super review)
19 Kaos i 40K point (Chaos in 40K points - Tommy Jensen)
25 Plotline
27 Anmeldelser (Reviews: GURPS Illuminati, Central Casting: Heroes Now, Call of Cthulhu 5th edition, Greyhawk Adventures)
29 Tales from the Floating Vagabond (Super review)
31 COSMOS II (Computer game)
33 Brevkasse (letters)
35 Videotips & Film
36 Bagside (Rear page - Tommy Jensen)

68662.name: Pole Position
68662.description:
User summary:
It is 'a tactical game that plays a Formula 1 race.
Established the grid through the roll of the dice, players take turns moving on the track, always throwing the dice.
Overtaking is allowed only in some parts of the circuit, so if we get a greater number of who goes before us but we can not overcome it, we can accumulate the points are not used to do so later (the primordial idea of KERS!).
Along the track there are also boxes of penalty that we are forced to miss turns, forced a pit stop etc....
The race includes the pit stop to change tires every 3 laps.
After the number of laps set earlier in the game (minimum 4) wins who crosses the finish line first.

68663.name: Sprizza la Parola
68663.description:
From box:
An original game, exciting, full on the Italian language.
3000 questions on 13 different topics: plurals,contrarys, foreign words, literature, mistakes ....
The simple and fast strategy involves and will challenge all players with fun challenges, risks, exciting and thrilling competition.

68664.name: Highly Responsive to Prayers
68664.description:
User Summary

The first installment in the Project Shrine Maiden series.

The Highly Responsive to Prayers is a variant on the Break out (Arkanoid) type of game. On screen, there is a collection of bricks/blocks. A ball is bouncing around the screen, and the player should try to deflect the ball so that it hits the blocks, destroying them.
Unlike the Arkanoid type of game, where one side of the screen has no walls, and the player controls a "bat" that hinders the ball from exiting the screen, in Highly Responsive to Prayers, there are walls on all four directions, so the ball cannot exit the screen at all. Instead, it bounces around with a downward gravity, and the player controls a small shrine maiden on the floor, who can move sideways and shoot talismans upwards, hitting the ball and giving it momentum. If the ball hits the player, he loses a life.

The ball's upwards (bouncing) momentum decreases a bit with each bounce, but the ball's sideways momentum doesn't decrease naturally. So if the player fails to hit the ball and it stops bouncing, it will soon simply roll sideways, killing the player.

The game consists of 20 screens to clear, with a boss on stage 10 and 20.

68665.name: The Story of Eastern Wonderland
68665.description:
User Summary
The 2nd installment in the project Shrine Maiden series.

The Story of Eastern Wonderland is a straightforward shoot'em-up, except that the player controls a flying girl instead of the typical spacecraft. When enemies are shot down, they may drop various "items", such as Power Ups or Point items. The game consists of 5 stages, each stage having a mid-boss and an end-of-stage boss.

In Eastern Wonderland, there is just one playable character: Reimu Hakurei. She can, however, choose between 3 different shot types.

68666.name: L'inafferrabile U-BOOT
68666.description:
The Unseizable U-Boot is a game that emphasizes skill and intelligence.
The ability to see enemy movements constitute the most valuable help to gain the victory.
The gambling behavior is not random, but determined by the navigation tools used according to the tactical thinking of the players.
The game represents the various stages of a battle between a submarine U-BOOT and three destroyers.
The submarine wins entering the Base of destroyers, after covering all six areas that comprise the board, or sinking three destroyers.
Destroyers win sank the submarine or if it does not re-emerges within the set number of moves.

68667.name: Phantasmagoria of Dimension Dream
68667.description:
User Summary
The 3rd installment in the Project Shrine Maiden series.

Phantasmagoria of Dimension Dream is a "versus shmup", played against a human opponent or AI. Players play on a vertically split screen, and the goal is to survive longer than the opponent. Defeating enemies on the own screen will cause bullets to appear on the opponent's screen, not unsimilar to the Puyo Puyo (Puyo Pop) series of "vs puzzle games".

The game was explicitly inspired by Twinkle Star Sprites.

Playable characters are Reimu Hakurei, Mima, Marisa Kirisame, Elen, Kotoki, Kana Anabell, Rikako Asakura and Chiyuri Kitashiragawa (unlockable).

68668.name: Lotus Land Story
68668.description:
User Summary
The 4th installment in the project Shrine Maiden series.

Lotus Land Story is a straightforward shoot'em-up, except that the player controls a flying girl instead of the typical spacecraft. When enemies are shot down, they may drop various "items", such as Power Ups, Point items or other special items with various effects. The game consists of 6 stages, each stage having a mid-boss and an end-of-stage boss.

In Lotus Land Story, the player can choose between playing the characters Reimu Hakurei (shrine maiden) or Marisa Kirisame (witch). Both character can choose between 2 shot types, resulting in 4 combinations.

68669.name: Mystic Square
68669.description:
User Summary
The 5th installment in the project Shrine Maiden series.

Mystic Square is a straightforward shoot'em-up, except that the player controls a flying girl instead of the typical spacecraft. When enemies are shot down, they may drop various "items", such as Power Ups, Point items or other special items with various effects. The game consists of 6 stages, each stage having a mid-boss and an end-of-stage boss.

In Mystic Square, the player can choose between four characters Reimu Hakurei (shrine maiden), Marisa Kirisame (witch), Mima (evil spirit; a boss from Highly Responsive to Prayers) and Yuka (daemon, final boss from Lotus Land Story.

The backdrop story for Mystic Square is that monsters have started to pour our from a suspicious monster cave. Reimu travel there in a try to fix the problem, the other characters for tourist purposes.

68670.name: Immaterial and Missing Power
68670.description:
User summary:
Generally known as the "7.5th" game in the Shrine Maiden series, this game takes place in between Perfect Cherry Blossom and Imperishable Night, and is not developed by Shrine Maiden creator Zun, but by the game group circle Twilight Frontier. The extra character in this game is however, designed by Zun, and the game is an "official" member of the Shrine Maiden series.

The game differs from standard fighting games in the aspect that there is a strong focus on long-range attacks and interacting super-attacks.

Playable characters are Reimu Hakurei, Marisa Kirisame, Sakuya Izayoi, Alice Margatroid, Patchouli Knowledge, Yomu Konpaku, Remilia Scarlet, Yuyuko Saigyouji, Yakumo Yukari, and Hong "China" Mei Ling.

68671.name: Scarlet Weather Rhapsody
68671.description:
User Summary:
Generally known as the "10.5th" game in the Shrine Maiden series, this game takes place in between Mountain of Faith and Subterranean Animism, and is not developed by Shrine Maiden creator Zun, but by the game creator circle Twilight Frontier. The story and characters, however, are written and designed by Zun, and the game is therefore an official member of the Shrine Maiden series.

In this game, the ever-changing weather is constantly affecting the battle ground, and keeping up with the changes is the key to victory.

Playable characters are Reimu Hakurei, Marisa Kirisame, Sakuya Izayoi, Alice Margatroid, Patchouli Knowledge, Youmu Konpaku, Remilia Scarlet, Yuyuko Saigyouji, Yukari Yakumo, Suika Ibuki, Reisen Udongein Inaba, Komachi Onosaka, Aya Shameimaru, Iku Nagae and Tenshi Hinanai

68672.name: Policenauts
videogamefranchise: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)
68672.description:
User Summary:

A point-and-click detective crime story type text-and-voice adventure game by Hideo Kojima, loosely based on his previous game "Snatchers" in the same style.

It tells the story of former Police astronaut Jonathan Ingram, as he has to travel out to the space station Beyond Coast to solve the mystery of the disappearance of Kenzo Hojo, an employee of the gargantuan company Tokugawa Pharmaceutics. The game boasts tremendous information dumps about space travel and living in space, and the unfolding drama and story raises, in typical Kojima style, several questions on our society in general.

Policenauts was first released for the japanese OS PC98, but then ported to 3DO, Playstation, Saturn, and lately to the PS3 and PSP.

68673.name: Lack of Love
68673.description:
User Summary:

A strange puzzle-solving story adventure game by the avant garde developer Ken'ichi Nishi and Lovedelic. In Lack of love, you take the role of a microbe that can yell/attack, say hello, sleep and urinate. By interacting with the other microbes around you, you gain their friendship and when you've gained a certain amount of friends, you evolve into the next stage, gradually growing and entering new areas with other creatures to interact with.

Each creature has a name that hints on what should be done. There are the "scaredshellpeeks" (say hello when they peek out of their shells), the "sleepers" (sleep beside them) and so on.

As a background story, there is a robot named Halumi who is trying to colonize the planet the player is living on, and at certain points in the game, the player encounters Halumi and follows the road of colonialization.

The game was only released for the Dreamcast in Japan.

Individual credits:
Kenichi Nishi: Director
Ryuichi Sakamoto: Music

68674.name: Fable II
videogameversion: English/European Xbox 360 (Game of the Year) edition
videogamefranchise: Platinum Hits (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, US)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2007 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Spike Best RPG of the Year Nominee
2008 Spike Best Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Winner
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Best Technical Direction of the Year Nominee
2009 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Story of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Game Developers Choice Awards Game of the Year Nominee
68674.description:
From the game box:

Beginning as a penniless street-urchin, your destiny is to become Albion's greatest hero. but will your power lie in kindness or cruelty? Choose your own path to glory and experience how those choices change you and the world forever. A new life, a unique adventure - every time!

68675.name: Perfect Dark Zero
videogamefranchise: Platinum Collection (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, JP)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2005 Spike Best First-Person Action Game of the Year Nominee
2005 Spike Best Original Score of the Year Nominee
68675.description:
From the game box:

The year is 2020. The future is dark. Ruthless corporations compete in a savage, unseen war for global domination. Fueled by vengeance, Joanna Dark is is thrown into a raging battle of corporate conspiracy and corruption, where truth and the fate of the world rests on the barrel of her gun.

Leap into the next generation of gaming as you guide Joanne in the gripping prequel to the original mega hit 'Perfect Dark.'

videogame: Final Fantasy XI Online: Starter Pack
Final Fantasy XI Online: The Vana'Diel Collection
Final Fantasy XI Online: Ultimate Collection
Final Fantasy XI Online: Vana'Diel Collection 2007
Final Fantasy XI Online: Vana'Diel Collection 2008
68676.name: Final Fantasy XI
videogamecompilation: Final Fantasy XI Online: Starter Pack
Final Fantasy XI Online: The Vana'Diel Collection
Final Fantasy XI Online: Ultimate Collection
Final Fantasy XI Online: Vana'Diel Collection 2007
Final Fantasy XI Online: Vana'Diel Collection 2008
videogameexpansion: Final Fantasy XI Online: Chains of Promathia
Final Fantasy XI Online: Rise of the Zilart
Final Fantasy XI Online: Treasures of Aht Urhgan
Final Fantasy XI Online: Wings of the Goddess
Final Fantasy XI: Seekers of Adoulin
videogamehonor: 2003 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Nominee
2003 Japan Game Awards Best Game of the Year Winner
2003 Spike Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Winner
2004 Spike Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
68676.description:
From the game box:

Experience the living, breathing world of Vana'diel - a world that stands on the brink of war. Three powerful nations rally their troops against the beastmen in a desperate bid for survival. Help shape the destiny of Vana'diel in this awe-inspiring journey.

68677.name: E.N. Critters Volume 2: Beyond the Campfire
68677.description:
From the publisher:

What creatures of the darkness lurk just beyond the periphery of the firelight as you settle down for the night? Four new nightshades lurk within the shadows themselves, while other creatures are drawn to the warmth of the fire, or to the campers themselves.

The second book in the E.N. Critters line brings you 24 illustrated creatures for your d20 fantasy campaign. The creatures in this volume are primarily of lower challenge ratings as when parties reach the higher levels they are more likely to use magic such as secure shelter, teleport, tiny hut and so forth to avoid having to camp under the stars unaided.

For Volume 2 we have added three new features: full color illustrations, suggested knowledge tables and counter sheets. Each critter now has a table to aid GMs in determining what characters know about them on a successful Knowledge check. In addition, counters (front and back) for all critters in the book have been included after the statistics pages. The counter pages are set up to be printed two-sided on cardstock although you may just as easily print them out on two sheets of paper and glue them to the front and back of even thicker cardboard.

68678.description:
From the game box:

As war looms on the horizon, the mighty Archadan Empire begins a campaign to subjugate its neighbors. The small kingdom of Dalmasca was one such neighbor, and it is here that our tale begins.

In a fight for freedom, fallen royalty and unlikely allies must struggle to liberate their homeland. Trace the mysteries behind the Empire's invasion and unmask the players in a drama of justice and betrayal.
videogamehonor: 2004 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2005 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
2006 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2006 Japan Game Awards Best Game of the Year Winner
2006 Spike Best RPG of the Year Nominee
2007 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2007 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2007 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Nominee
2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Nominee
68678.name: Final Fantasy XII
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)

68679.name: E.N. Critters Volume 3: Tulenjord: Land of the Fallen One
68679.description:
From the publisher:

The third volume in the E.N. Critters series of Open Gaming Content Sourcebooks, Tulenjord: Land of the Fallen One deals with cold-themed critters - creatures living in and around a floating iceberg island caused by a dead god. The immense body of the dead god fell out of the skies and crashed into the icy waters of the northern ocean, churning up the sea bottom and freezing everything around him into an immense iceberg. The introduction of his divinity into the environment transformed a great many creatures into the forms you see presented in this tome....creatures of the air, of nearby islands, and of the sea both shallow and deep. The island of ice created around his body provides a home for these creatures, and has also attracted a number of other species in its travels.

For Volume 3 we have retained the new features from Volume 2: full color illustrations, suggested knowledge tables and counter sheets. These features will become standard for the entire series. Each critter has a table to aid GMs in determining what characters know about them on a successful Knowledge check. In addition, counters (front and back) for all critters in the book have been included after the statistics pages. The counter pages are set up to be printed two-sided on cardstock although you may just as easily print them out on two sheets of paper and glue them to the front and back of even thicker cardboard.

The book features:

More than twenty new cold-themed creatures
Detailed description of Tulenjord, its areas and history - the mountains, fissures, cliffs, snowfields and icy forests
Full color illustrations
Detailed ecologies and background
A suggested Knowledge table for each creature
A rules and game balance section for each entry
Counters for all creatures
Fully linked and bookmarked

68680.name: Final Fantasy XII: Revenant Wings
68680.description:
From the game box:

Vaan is now a full-fledged sky pirate and Penelo his trusted navigator. When they stumble upon the legendary sky continent of Lemurés, it's up to them to defend it from the evils of the outside world.

68681.name: E.N. Critters Volume 4: Along the Banks of the River Vaal
68681.description:
From the publisher:

Welcome to the fourth volume in the E.N. Critters series of Open Gaming Content Sourcebooks: Along the Banks of the River Vaal. The E.N. Critters series as a whole is a set of theme-based creature books with the theme/setting information secondary to the creatures and used mainly as a focus to design them around as well as to provide GMs with additional background, species interaction and general environmental descriptions. The creatures are fairly well detailed, while the environmentally based themes have been left intentionally vague in many places to allow the GM more leeway to modify and drop them into their own campaign if so desired. It is our hope that these creatures and themes will spark creative and enjoyable game sessions.

This volume's theme is of creatures dwelling along a wide river known as the River Vaal although the water’s edge in any body of fresh water, be it lake, pond, marsh, etc. will work just as well. The primary range is from temperate to warm, although some allowances have been made for creatures that could be found in colder climes.

More than two dozen all new creatures
Full colour illustrations throughout
Detailed ecologies and background
A "Suggested Knowledge" table for each creature
A "Rules & Game Balance"section for each entry
Counters for all creatures




The River Vaal flows through the heart of the land, starting at the Firewind Mountain range and the Feygarden Hills, flowing through the edge of the Dunshadow Moors, and then winding its way lazily through the Forest of Broken Limbs. Once it emerges from the forest, it then passes over the Knife Edge, plummeting far and fast in a grand waterfall known as Dowdin’s Falls. The area before the Knife Edge and Dowdin’s Falls is known as the Upper Vaal, and after it, appropriately, is the Lower Vaal. After the falls, it forms a vast body of water known as Dowdin’s Lake, feeding the nearby Grey Marshes and eventually becoming a river again and passing the Alabaster Hills and Growling Woods. It then meanders for a time and enters the Andelenian Forest where a large portion of it passes underground and feeds the massive roots of EarthTree. Rising to the surface again in the southern part of the forest, it continues flowing past the Swamp of the Sun and through the Feathered Sea Plains. It again picks up speed through the Azurothian Peaks and yet again slows down after it enters the Pale Jungle, eventually emptying out into the Helvenin Sea at the Aris Delta. The river is shown on the map as a single strip of blue for the sake of simplicity. Innumerable other rivers and streams feed into it, and there are plenty of backwater areas along its length.

68682.name: Heavy Rain
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
videogameexpansion: Heavy Rain Chronicles: Episode One: The Taxidermist
videogamehonor: 2009 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Gamescom Best Playstation Game of the Year Winner
2010 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee
2010 Japan Game Awards Most Innovative Game Winner
2010 Spike Best Graphics of the Year Nominee
2010 Spike Best PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Winner
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Technical Direction of the Year Winner
2011 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2011 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2011 D.I.C.E. Best Innovation of the Year Winner
