2011 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2011 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Technology of the Year Nominee
videogamecompilation: Heavy Rain and Beyond: Two Souls Collection
68682.description:
"Heavy Rain is an interactive drama video game developed by Quantic Dream exclusively for the PlayStation 3. The game is directed by Quantic Dream's founder and CEO David Cage, who also wrote and directed the studio's two previous games, Omikron: The Nomad Soul and Fahrenheit.

Heavy Rain's story is a dramatic thriller, centered around four protagonists involved with the mystery of the Origami Killer, a serial killer who uses extended periods of rainfall to drown his victims. Ethan Mars is a father who is trying to save his son from being the next victim, while investigative journalist Madison Paige, FBI profiler Norman Jayden, and private detective Scott Shelby are each trying to track down clues to the Origami Killer's identity. The player interacts with the game by performing actions highlighted on screen related to motions on the controller, and in some cases, performing a series of quick time events during fast-paced action sequences. The player's decisions and actions during the game will affect the narrative; the main characters can be killed, and certain actions may lead to different scenes and endings."

Source: Wikipedia, "Heavy_Rain," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68683.name: Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles: Echoes of Time
68683.description:
"Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles: Echoes of Time is a Wii and Nintendo DS action role-playing game in the Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles series developed by Square Enix."

Source: Wikipedia, "Echoes_of_Time," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68684.name: Manual 3D&T
68684.description:
This rule book came for free on Dragão Brasil #60.


Da contracapa do manual:

Em 1994 a Trama Editorial levou às bancas Defensores de Tóquio, um RPG satírico sobre super-heróis japoneses, seus poderes infinitos, gritos extravagantes e máquinas abiloladas. Simples e acessível, o jogo fez tanto sucesso que gerou uma segunda edição: Advanced Defensores de Tóquio, também apelidado AD&T.
Então, no final de 98, surgiu a idéia de tornar o jogo mais abrangente - capaz de acomodar não apenas super-heróis, mas tudo que fosse ligado a mangá, anime e videogames. Surgiu então 3D&T, Defensores de Tóquio 3ª Edição, lançado em diferentes módulos com diferentes regras.
Agora você tem todas essas regras em mãos neste livro básico completo, o Manual 3D&T.


Translated from the Back of the Book:

In 1994, Trama Editorial released Defensores de Tóquio, a satirical RPG about Japanese super-heroes, their infinite powers, extravagant screams and loony machines. Its great success created a demand for a new edition: Advanced Defensores de Tóquio aka AD&T.
At the end of 1998, the idea of making the game wider - a game not only about super-heroes but about everything connected to manga, anime and videogames - has become strong. So was the 3D&T born, Defensores de Tóquio 3ª Edição, released in many different modules with different rules.
Now you have in your hands this basic rulebook, the Manual 3D&T

68685.name: Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles: Ring of Fates
68685.description:
From the game box:

Unknown to them, twins Yuri and Chelinka share a gift that could change their world forever. Lead them on a perilous journey of discovery, and complete the Ring of Fates!

68686.name: Final Fantasy: Mystic Quest
68686.description:
From the game box:

The planet is dying. Cold winds blow. Fires rage. The trees are withering. In other words, it's brutal out there.

Only you can stop the Dark King from consuming the light from the Crystals of Earth. But don't think it will be a walk in the park. You're up against the sleaziest of slimebags, the evilest of ecto-scum - we're talking serious monsters here.

This isn't your basic shootem-to-smithereens kiddy game, either. You'll have to think your way out of some tough spots. Think you can handle that?

68687.name: Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles
videogamefranchise: Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)
videogamehonor: 2004 Golden Joystick Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
2005 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
68687.description:
From the game box:

A deadly miasma has swallowed the land and it's up to you to hold it at bay! Many dangers lie along your journey, but you need not face them alone. Enlist your friends in a crystal caravan and make your mark together in Crystal Chronicles!

68688.name: Mini-Torreta
68688.description: The children use either the dice with colours or the dice with dots. Depending on the colour or number of dots that come up when the dice is thrown the children build towers and the winner is the one who stacks the bricks skilfully and produces the highest tower! Mini-Torreta will be delivered in a small cotton bag.

68689.description:
In this fun game for the whole family, players must help Rasmus Klump in gathering the things he'll need to bake a great pile of delicious pancakes with jam.
On their way, around the whole farm and the mill to gather the things, all the players will meet a lot of different animals, to whom they will have to speak to in "animal-language" - "Oink" for the pig, "meow" for cat, and so on.
68689.name: Rasmus Klump: "Dyresnakspillet"

68690.description: When a player rolls one of the colours on his square he may take a building peg and place it on the matching colour space. When a square is complete with building pegs the player may take a second square from the pile, place it on top of the completed square and continue building his tower. At the end the player with the tallest tower is the winner!
68690.name: Pisa

68691.name: Super Mario Sunshine
videogamefranchise: Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)
videogamehonor: 2002 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2002 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2002 Most Wanted Game for Christmas Nominee
2003 D.I.C.E. Platform Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
2003 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee
68691.description:
From the game box

When Mario arrives on tropical Isle Delfino, the once-pristine island is polluted and plastered with graffiti. Even worse, he's being blamed for the mess! Now instead of enjoying a relaxing vacation, Mario has to clean up the place and track down the real culprit.

68692.name: E.N. Guild Vol. 4: Adventurer's Guild
68692.description:
From the publisher:

"Keep them alive, and keep them coming back."

Looking for organized information? A place to purchase new and used equipment? Looking for that edge against your next deadly encounter? Sure, you could go it alone, or you could visit the headquarters of the Adventurers' Guild.

E.N. Publishing brings you volume 4 in the E.N. Guild line, this time delving into the Adventurers' Guild. Its members know that knowledge equals survival, and a little information beforehand can make the difference in the end. The E.N. Guilds line brings you a focused sourcebook of a single guild per edition, full of insider knowledge and the rules to make it happen. These fully-bookmarked pdf's delve into the secrets of fantasy guilds, revealing their secrets, knowledge, and practices.

This ebook includes:

A detailed overview of the Adventurers' Guild and the difference it can make in your party's survival.
7 charts of services provided by the guild.
A glance at useful skills and three new feats.
A new prestige class called the information weaver, unique in its ability to seek out new information and contacts.
Three new spells and four new magic items.
Four pages of equipment tables for acquiring discount items of lesser quality.

68693.name: Luigi's Mansion
videogameversion: North American GameCube Player's Choice edition
videogamefranchise: Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)
68693.description:
From the game box:

Luigi's won a mansion! The bad news is that it's crawling with ghosts... and Mario seems to be trapped inside...

68694.name: E.N. Guild Vol. 1: Banking Guild
68694.description:
From the publisher:

If you thought banks were all about holding your character's wealth, think again. Add to your fantasy world a system of banking little before explored. Here is the glimpse into a complex guild where wealth can influence not only adventurers, but nations.

From E.N. Publishing comes a new line of books: E.N. Guild. Starting the series off, we bring you the Banking Guild. Enter the world of fantasy financing as never seen before. Adventuring parties can now take out loans, buy life insurance, invest in stocks and fund expensive quests. You'll never look at fantasy banks the same way again.

E.N. Guild books bring you a resource of knowledge and crunchy rules. This first fully bookmarked pdf venture into the secrets of fantasy guilds brings you 26 pages of material ready to use immediately.

This e-book includes:

A detailed overview of true banking, stock exchange, and insurance.
A new variant each for Knowledge and Craft skills involving money, and one new feat.
Two new prestige classes.
Three new spells and a new monster (the lead ooze).
Magic bank vaults and alternative currencies.
A brief glimpse at the gods of Theft, Commerce, and Greed.

68695.name: E.N. Guild Vol. 2: Merchant Guild
68695.description:
From the publisher:

When it comes to the buying and selling power of a community, no one else wields it like the Merchant Guild. From E.N. Publishing comes the second in the E.N. Guild series - the Merchant Guild.

Explore the intricacies of the merchants that compose this guild, their influence on a community, and what it takes to belong. E.N. Guild books bring you a resource of knowledge and crunchy rules. This fully bookmarked pdf venture into the secrets of fantasy guilds bringing you 24 pages of material ready to use immediately.

This e-book includes:


An overview of merchant guilds, from dues and membership, to community reputation, and more.
Two new feats
Two new prestige classes.
Five new magic items.
Five sample NPC merchants

68696.name: E.N. Guild Vol. 3: Monster Hunters' Guild
68696.description:
From the publisher:

Monsters are everywhere, a plague to both peasant and king alike. They battle foes in the forlorn depths of dungeons, the untamed wilderness beyond our fragile bubble of civilization, and, most insidiously, within the very cities that offer us sanctuary.

Surcease from this dire threat often comes in the form of doughty adventurers, brave souls who, for want of renown or simply treasure, confront monstrous beasts for the benefit of civilization.

Unfortunately, adventurers are often difficult to find, ill prepared, untimely, or just as likely to end up on a monster's menu as an unskilled commoner. In addition, adventurers come in all flavors of moral direction, and those beseeching aid from a passing band of heroes may end up with a threat more dangerous than the monster itself.

So what are those beleaguered by beasts to do? Where can one find a professional? Where are those well versed in the ecology of monsters? Those who are well studied in the obscure lore of bestial weaknesses, with the resources and skills to find and slay even the most dangerous of creatures?

The answer is, of course, at the local Monster Hunters' guild house.

From E.N. Publishing comes the third book in the E.N. Guild series, plunging you into a guild of studying and hunting monsters. E.N. Guild books bring you a resource of knowledge and crunchy rules. This third fully-bookmarked pdf venture into the secrets of fantasy guilds brings you 31 pages of material ready to use instantly. This e-book includes:


A detailed overview of the Monster Hunters Guild, introducing the Beast Hunters and the Lore Keepers.
A new variant for Knowledge and Knowledge Synergies involving monsters.
Two new prestige classes.
Three new spells, four new magic items, one new artifact, and a god.

68697.name: E.N. Guild Vol. 6: Thieves' Guild
68697.description:
From the publisher:

It all started as a joke.

Calling the group of cutthroats and cutpurses, bruisers and burglars, leg breakers and loan sharks a "guild" started as a joke somewhere back in the day. It was a flippant comment by someone whose name has long been forgotten, a sarcastic comment comparing the house of rogues to a legitimate establishment like the merchants' guild or the messengers' guild. The comment managed to insult both, the thieves and the businessmen.

Somehow, the name stuck and now organized groups of thieves are inevitably called thieves' guilds.

Many thieves' guilds have been described in broad strokes, and they are all too often described like Fagin's band of little thieves from Oliver Twist. This book takes a different approach and is more inspired by movies like Road to Perdition and The Godfather.

This book presents:

Information about thieves' guilds, including common terms they use, the thieves' code, and the various ranks within their guilds.
Two new uses for the Bluff and Perform skills
4 new feats
new Prestige Classes
3 new spells, and 3 new magical items
Layout, and outside look at a blacksmith shop used as a safe house by a thieves' guild

68698.name: Zeit der Ritter
68698.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Neersand - a peaceful, backwater city always in the shade of its big sister Festum, as far away as possible from the dangers of the black lands. However, evildoers also do their dreadful affairs here: a night burglary in the temple of the Sea God arouses the heroes. What have the thieves stolen - and why? The search for the answer leads far back into the past. Powerful secrets of the past threaten to get into the wrong hands. Can the heroes prevent it? They have unexpected assistants - as some enemies becomes the allies...

68699.name: Marvel: Ultimate Alliance
68699.description:
From the game box:

The world's largest army of super heroes is under your control.

Assemble your ultimate four-member strike force from over 20 Marvel heroes. Become your favorite legends, then interact with more than 140 characters in this epic action-RPG.

From the Official Game Site

-Assemble your Super Heroes Create the ultimate dream team and dynamically switch team members, starting with 20 playable Marvel Super Heroes, and unlocking even more as you progress. Experience the full scale of the Marvel universe with a combined cast of over 140 characters.

-Customize your team- Use a universal team upgrade system or customize each individual member for maximum effectiveness. Total team customization means a vast selection of power-boosting equipment, a unique team name and team icon, and an established team reputation as the story progresses.

-Change the course of the game –The missions you accept, and the objectives that you meet, will have a direct impact on how the story plays out. At the end, see how your choices changed the fate of the Marvel universe.

-Fight in no-holds-barred combat. With dynamic combat capabilities, you can now fight while airborne, on the ground, and even underwater! A host of combat tactics include grappling, charge attacks and a destructible environment, where everyday objects can become dangerous weapons.

-Cooperate or compete online. Play the entire story from beginning to end individually or with up to 3 of your friends. Switch between cooperative and competitive mode to partner with or challenge up to three other players. Online multiplayer supports 1-4 people.

-Unique comic book missions that are unlocked throughout the game will reenact legendary Marvel battles.
-Over 17 exotic locales take the player around the world, out of the universe and back again.

Unique Platform Features

-PLAYSTATION®3 computer entertainment system and Xbox 360 feature amazing graphics that take full advantage of the next-gen. hardware. These include real-time shadows, detailed texture to the environments, and true hi-def. in-game cinematics.
-Nintendo Wii will have intuitive and fun Wii-specific controls for movement, combat and powers
-PC customizes the next gen. graphics to a PC with intuitive mouse controls. Incredible attack combos can be unleashed with the click of a button.

Marvel: Ultimate Alliance is an all-new Action/RPG that lets players create their ultimate team from the largest Super Hero alliance ever as they engage in an epic quest to determine the fate of the Marvel universe. For decades, Earth's Super Heroes have opposed evil in their own cities, and on their own terms. But now, Dr. Doom and a newly reformed Masters of Evil have plans for world domination, and the heroes must band together to defeat them. Players can create and control their own completely unique team, selecting from the largest roster of legendary Super Heroes ever assembled in one game.

68700.name: Wald der Gräber
68700.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Wood cutting is a strenuous and dangerous job. Lumberjacks can be killed by falling trees or get in a deadly landslide. However, in the small wood of Honingen strange deaths amount, and it is soon clear that foul play is involved. Only a courageous and clever hero can investigate, what really is behind the accidents: Is it a drama of jealousy? Does somebody want to prevent a street being built or does the near wood of Farindel has a part to play? You should be aware of your enemies, as they will not hesitate to kill you.

68701.name: Marvel: Ultimate Alliance 2
68701.description:
From the game box:

The largest army of super heroes is back!

Harness the power of over 24 playable heroes and villains with exciting new character and team upgrades!

68702.name: Hexen II
videogameexpansion: Hexen II Mission Pack: Portal of Praevus
68702.description:
"Hexen II was a first-person shooter computer game developed by Raven Software from 1996 to 1997, published by id Software and distributed by Activision. It was the third game in the Hexen/Heretic series, and the last in the Serpent Riders trilogy. Using a modified Quake engine, it featured single player and multi player game modes, as well as four character classes to choose from, each with different abilities. These included the offensive Paladin, the defensive Crusader, the spellcasting Necromancer, and the stealthy Assassin."

Source: Wikipedia, "Hexen_II," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68703.name: Hexen II Mission Pack: Portal of Praevus
68703.description:
"An expansion pack called Hexen II: Portal of Praevus was released in 1998 featuring new levels, new enemies and a new playable character class, The Demoness. It focuses on the attempted resurrection of the three Serpent Riders by the evil wizard Praevus, and takes place in a fifth continent, Tulku, featuring a Sino-Tibetan setting.
The expansion featured new quest items, new enemies, and new weapons for the Demoness. She is the only player class to have a ranged starting weapon, whereas all other characters start with melee weapons.
It also introduced minor enhancements to the game engine, mostly related to user interface, level scripts, particle effects (rain or snow), and 3D objects.
Portal of Praevus also featured a secret (easter egg) skill level, with respawning monsters. The only released patch for the expansion added respawning of certain items (such as health and ammo) in Nightmare mode, so that it would be slightly easier for playing."

Source: Wikipedia, "Hexen_II," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68704.name: Erben des Zorns
68704.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Punin - the name alone makes eyes shine: for the researcher, scholar and wizard because of its scientific hoards, for the merchant because of the wealth, for the rogue and the beggar precisely for the same reason, for the mercenary and warrior because of the numerous caravan routes to the south that must be protected, for the jester because of all mighty personalities which romp about here conceitedly.
Reason enough to visit the merry royal city for the birthday festivity of the Prince Selindian Hal of Gareth, count of the fertile valley of the Yaquir. It will not take too long to have your heroes dreaming of the sweet wine, the fiery Almadanis and the Reconquista of the land occupied by the heretical Novadis to the south of the Yaquir. However, the honourable river has seen so many cultures come and go, some of them have even been become mythical.

68705.name: Make A Match
68705.description:
From the back of the box:

Mixing and Matching fun for all ages.
Players roll the die and try to make as many mixed up comical characters as they can, choosing and combining card parts from different figures. The object then is to try to make complete figures by winning cards from other players. Each complete character scores one point, and the player with the most points wins!

68706.name: One Piece Grand Battle: Swan Colosseum
68706.description:
"The One Piece video games series is published by subsidiaries of Namco Bandai Holdings based on Eiichiro Oda's shonen manga and anime series of the same name. The games take place in the fictional world of One Piece, and the stories revolve around the adventures of Monkey D. Luffy and his Straw Hat Pirates, the franchise's protagonists. The games have been released on a variety of video game and handheld consoles. The series features various genres, mostly role-playing games the predominant type in the series' early years and fighting games, such as the titles of the Grand Battle! sub-series."

Source: Wikipedia, "List_of_One_Piece_video_games," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68708.name: TurboGrafx-CD
68708.description:
The TurboGrafx-16 was the first video game console in North America to have a CD-ROM peripheral[citation needed] (following the PC-Engine CD-ROM add-on in Japan, although the FM Towns Marty was the first Japanese console to have a built-in CD-ROM). The TurboGrafx-CD debuted at a prohibitive $399.99 (and did not include a pack-in game). Monster Lair (Wonder Boy III: Monster Lair) and Fighting Street (Street Fighter) were the initial TurboGrafx-CD titles. Ys Book I & II soon followed. However, the TurboGrafx-CD catalog grew at a very slow rate compared to the library of TurboChip (HuCard) titles.

The TurboGrafx-CD came packaged in a very large box, 85% of which was filled with protective styrofoam inserts. By some accounts, no other video game console (or peripheral) has been packaged in such an overkill manner. The TurboGrafx-CD did however come with a large plastic "carrying case" that could comfortably hold the TurboGrafx-16 base system, TurboGrafx-CD, all AC adapters, 2 – 3 controllers, and a few games.

Although the TurboGrafx-CD library was relatively small, American gamers could draw from a wide range of Japanese software since there was no region protection on TG-CD / PC Engine CD-ROM software. Many mail order (and some brick-and-mortar) import stores advertised Japanese PCE CD and HuCard titles in the video game publications of the era.

Source: Wikipedia, "TurboGrafx-16", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68712.name: Ninja Gaiden Black
68712.description:
From the game box:

This time it's personal... Ryu Hayabusa, the deadly and feared ninja assassin, is out for blood after his clan is massacred y the evil Vigoor empire. Vowing to seek revenge on those that wronged him, Ryu sets off on an action-packed adventure where the lines between good and evil are blurred and all he believes in will be tested. Posses the fury of Ryu Hayabusa as you destroy your opponents using lethal ninja weapons, cunning skills and amazing acrobatic moves. You mission: to annihilate your enemies, ultimately defeating the powerful Vigoor empire.

This release incorporates all of the downloadable content available for the original game.

68713.name: Dead or Alive
68713.description:
From the game box:

The fighting game you've been waiting for...

Purist fighting for purist fighting fans.

No lightning bolts, no magic tricks, no weapons...

Your survival is all in your own hands.

68714.name: Dead or Alive Xtreme Beach Volleyball
videogameseries: Dead or Alive Xtreme Beach Volleyball
videogamehonor: 2001–2002 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
2003 Spike Best Animation of the Year Winner
2003 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
68714.description:
"Dead or Alive Xtreme Beach Volleyball (DOAX) is a beach volleyball game by Tecmo released in 2003 for the Xbox video game console. Showcasing the graphics capabilities of the Xbox, it received late-teen ratings in most regions for its depictions of busty women in skimpy bikinis both on and off the beach. Unlike the previous games in the Dead or Alive series, it is a sports game as opposed to a fighting game."

Source: Wikipedia, "Dead_or_Alive_Xtreme_Beach_Volleyball," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68715.name: Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars
68715.description:
User Summary:

In a departure of his normal side-scrolling platformer affairs, Mario takes center stage in a role-playing/adventure hybrid game for the first time. While Bowser is trying to abduct the princess yet again, the Mushroom Kingdom is sent into a tail-spin when the Smithy Gang shows up and takes over Bowser's castle. Mario travels through towns, churches, mining villages, towers, and even underwater picking up coins, fighting baddies, and gaining friends (and even foes) in the fight against Smithy. The battle system incorporates turn-based menus with a button-press timing mechanic that keeps you involved in every battle you face.

Super Mario RPG was released for the SNES in 1996 and again on the Wii Virtual Console in 2008.

68716.description:
Plan West™

- While Poland mobilizes and the diplomats try to find a peaceful solution to the Danzig situation, Hitler launches a back-stabbing attack without a formal declaration of war. Although England and France support Poland and on September the 3rd declare war on Germany, the Poles are left to fight alone….

Game components:
- Book-case box
- 70 x 50 cm map (28 x 20 in)
- 264 die-cut counters
- Game rules
- 1 die

In the late 1930s, Polish generals Berbecki, Bortnowski, Kasprzycki, Kutrzeba and Rómmel designed Plan West (Plan Zachód) for the defence against a German invasion. The planners had predicted the direction of most of the German thrusts, with the exception of the intensity of the flanking movement via Prussia and Slovakia. Although the Polish Army had already started their mobilization during mid-August, the final part was postponed until August the 30th due to the political situation and the work to find a diplomatic solution. However, on the German side, a general mobilization had already been completed under the cover of a military exercise, and the German army was deployed around the Polish border according to the German strategic invasion plan, Case White (Fall Weiß), originally developed by generals Blumentritt and von Manstein.
Plan West™ is an attempt to create a fun and fast-paced board game on one of the most decisive campaigns during World War II. The game is based around a chit-pull system and a Victory Point time track that forces the Germans to operate at a historical tempo during the game. Plan West™ covers the first 10 days of the campaign and is played on a coffee table sized map.
68716.name: Plan West

68717.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Wargaming the Wars of Napoleon Bonaparte.

Brought to you by the same team behind Beneath the Lily Banners, the book combines the writing of Barry Hilton with the creative talents of illustrator and designer Clarence Harrison. The book is lavishly illustrated with over 200 original photographs shot especially.

150 pages of full colour with 210 photographs of some of the finest wargaming models around. The rules come with a six sided gate-fold full colour play sheet on thick gloss finish card.

The rules require no rebasing of collections. Unit basing is immaterial as long as it follows the general conventions of tabletop gaming. Republic to Empire can be used for all scales although they are primarily written for 28mm scale Divisional to Army level games.

Unit sizes can vary from 16-60 for infantry and 10 – 60 for cavalry. The game play is smooth and free flowing with minimal need to refer to the main text once concepts have been mastered. New players usually pick up the key mechanisms within three to four game turns.
The rules contain comprehensive detail on

Scales – Creating your Army – Setting up the game – Command and Orders – Exploitation – Formations and Movement – Terrain effects – Skirmishers – Play Sequence – Artillery – Shooting – Charging – Close Combat – Resolve – Fighting in Built up Areas.

The text is laid out in a way that separates:

Background information on concepts

Core rule mechanisms

Examples of mechanisms at work

There a 10 page fully illustrated example game from the 100 Days Campaign with full detail from orbat construction to conclusion.

Special rules sections to cover adaption for the Revolutionary Wars Period and the 1812 War in North America are also included.
68717.name: Republic to Empire

68718.name: To Live and Die in HK
68718.description:
From the back cover:

A rules companion for Hong Kong Action Theatre!, To Live and Die in HK is filled with new material to enhance the Cinematic Action role-playing experience: New Specialties, new Signature Moves, expanded rules for Martial Arts, Vehicles, and Magic, as well as two completely new genres of HK action films (plus 6 new adventures!) Optional rules for Non-Studio play are also included, allowing players to transform their characters from action film stars to heroes and heroines in continuing campaigns! To Live and Die in HK also offers more of the valuable source material that HKAT! fans have come to expect, including updated film listings and sidebar texts -- rangin from bios of HK film stars to common genre conventions.

68719.name: Adventurer (Issue 11 - Jun 1987)
68719.description:
Adventurer; Issue 11, June 1987
The Superior Fantasy and Science Fiction Game Magazine
Cover art by Josh Kirby

68720.name: The Triad Sourcebook
68720.description:
From the back cover:

The World's Oldest Criminal Organization is Coming for You... Are you ready?

The Triads control crime in Hong Kong, and in many other cities around the world - but what few people realize is that the Triads have a history that reaches back 2000 years, to their beginnings as revolutionary secret societies in ancient China!

This sourcebook, for use with Hong Kong Action Theatre!, is a complete reference to the Triads - their history, their traditions, and their operations. Whether they appear as the villains or the heroes, the Triads are an integral part of the Hong Kong Action Film genre, and now HKAT! players have more information than ever before available!

The Triad Sourcebook features more gangsters than you can shake a REALLY BIG GUN at, a timeline of Triad history, varied informational sidebars, adn a collection of film adventures for Hong Kong Action Theatre!, including an epic-length adventure pitting the Triads against the forces of the Cthulhu Mythos!

68722.description:
The seductive powers of Chaos have infiltrated the town of Derricksburg. Can one lone knight prevent them from spreading to nearby villages?

Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the next Battle Pack for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, The Burning of Derricksburg! Check out “New Leaders and Ancient Enemies,” an introduction to this exciting new cycle... then this summer, prepare to settle the score with your greatest foe.

The Burning of Derricksburg is the first Battle Pack installment of The Enemy Cycle, a linked expansion series for Warhammer: Invasion, a card game of intense warfare, clever kingdom management, and epic questing.

This 60 card pack contains 20 different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Warhammer: Invasion metagame.

What’s more, The Burning of Derricksburg is the first Battle Pack for Warhammer: Invasion to adopt the versatile new collation format, meaning you’ll receive three copies each of all twenty cards in one convenient purchase! From Fantasy Flight Flight Games
68722.name: Warhammer: Invasion – The Burning of Derricksburg

68724.name: KnowMe
68724.description:
From the publisher:

Get to know your co-workers and friends better in 3 hours than you normally would in 3 years!

This unique board game gives players the chance to choose the type of questions they answer, but the easier the question, the fewer the points. Questions can have you trading shoes with the person across from you, asking the group what they think of your smile, or describing your relationship with your mother. You never know what the next question will be . . .

Use it to:

* Integrate Teams
* Manage Change
* Turn Diversity into Strength
* Improve Communication

Create an atmosphere of trust among players and have fun getting to KnowMe™!

68725.description: A two player simulation of the Finnish Civil War that cost the lives of over 37,000 Finns. The war was fought in Finland from 27 January to 15 May 1918 between the forces of the Social Democrats led by the People's Deputation of Finland, commonly called the "Reds", and the forces of the non-socialist, conservative-led Senate, commonly called the "Whites". The Reds were supported by Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic, while the Whites received military assistance from Sweden and the German Empire.
68725.name: Under the North Star: The Finnish Civil War 1918

68726.name: Way of the Samurai
68726.description:
"Way of the Samurai is a PlayStation 2 action-adventure game released in 2002.

Set in 19th Century Japan, the player takes on the role of a ronin who wanders into a remote village and becomes involved in a conflict between rival clans. A notable feature of the game is the Choose Your Own Adventure style branching storyline, which allows minor decisions by the player to radically alter the course of the story.

Way of the Samurai was released on PlayStation Portable on September 18, 2008 in Japan; prior to the release of Way of the Samurai 3."

Source: Wikipedia, "Way_of_the_Samurai," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68727.name: Way of the Samurai 2
68727.description:
"Way of the Samurai 2 is a PlayStation 2 action-adventure game released in 2004. It was released on PlayStation Portable only in Japan in 2009.

The game is a prequel to Way of the Samurai.

The player starts as a hungry ronin who collapsed at the gate of a famous trading island-city called Amahara. Soon thereafter, a little girl shares her riceball with the ronin, giving him (or her, depending on the player's choice) energy. A choice appears, introducing the player to the diverse life of a samurai."

Source: Wikipedia, "Way_of_the_Samurai_2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68728.name: Higasuto
videogamedeveloper: The Front Rolling Defence Action Friendships Association
videogamepublisher: The Front Rolling Defence Action Friendships Association
68728.description:
Box back translated:
The girls are shooting in eight directions!!

The rules are simple! Be the only one left standing!
Move in all eight directions, dodge and shoot!
Fight for the illegally strong talismans (items), and turn the tables again and again!
A Shrine Maiden franchise action shooting game.

68729.name: Alice to Eternal
68729.description:
User summary:

A romantic adventure game featuring Alice Margatroid of Shrine Maiden fame. This isa spin-off product and not part of the Project Shrine Maiden series.

68730.name: Toho Sojiki
68730.description:
User summary:
An action shooting game in which the goal is to clean the world. You use the enemies bullet hell to help sweep the floors.

68731.name: Dairanto Ukaga Smash EX
68731.description:
Translated box back:

The third Smash Brothers-type action game!

A battle game for four players based on the Shrine Maiden characters.
Use the different attacks and super attacks to push your opponents off the screen. You can also change between two characters. The characters vary between special, ranged, close combat and healing, which allows for tactical choices. Fun to play alone, even better on four. Easy to learn but with depth. Complete with high quality music and full voice.

68732.name: Marisa no Kagi
68732.description:
Translated from the belt and the box back:

Wondering left and right, and before you know it, it's dawn.
An intricate puzzle action game.

In the dark, deep maze, reach out with your right hand and grab the key!

A Shrine Maiden franchise game with Marisa Kirisame in the main role.

68733.name: Super Marisa Land
68733.description:
User Summary:

A Super Mario game with Marisa Kirisame of Shrine Maiden fame.

Marisa Land works with the same principles as Super Mario, but you can pick up mushrooms in several stages, going from 2-head size to 8-head size (similar to the giants in Super Paper Mario).

Features Alice as an unlockable character.

68734.name: MegaMari
68734.description:
User summary:

A Rockman (Mega Man) game with Marisa Kirisame from Shrine Maiden fame.

68735.name: DrunkTankies Battle in the Eastern
68735.description:
User summary:

A Shrine Maiden franchise game, where the players moce on a non-scrolling screen shooting and clearing the screen from opponents, all while dodging a bullet hell.

68736.name: Thoho Soccer
68736.description:
User Summary:

A soccer simulation game with characters from Shrine Maiden fame, this is a game like some of the Captain Tsubasa soccer games for the Famicom, complete with crazy super-attacks. The game was initially just a flash animation that became popular.

The strange spelling is not a misspell, it's called Thoho soccer.

68737.name: The FirstBarrage of Scarlet Sisters
68737.description:
User summary:

A pornographic adventure game with characters from the Shrine Maiden game "Embodiment of Scarlet Devil".

68738.name: Minionomicon
68738.description:
From the Back Cover:

Back with a Vengeance!

Minionomicon: the minion and widget building supplement for RandomAnime. Building upon RandomAnime's already fast and versatile universal role-playing game system, Minionomicon introduces expanded rules for fanatical cohorts, powerful magic items, and amazing technological gizmos! The Minionomicon supplement includes:


Expanded minion creation rules. Create and customize exotic faceless minions to add variety and challenge to your games. Battle your characters against ravenous zombies, winged monkeys, or even swarms of robotic killer bees!



Expanded widget creation rules. Build and customize weapons, armor, tools, and even musical instruments just the way you want them with Minionomicon's new point-based widget creation rules. Use your widgets in the game and upgrade them with the Style Points you earn to make them even more powerful!



Over 50 new gimmicks for minions, widgets, and characters. Summon hordes of ninja, create plague-bearing zombies, combine skeletons into fearsome patchwork bone monsters, and take control of your opponents' minions. Create magical healing potions, ultra cool gun-swords, retractable ninja lines, flying carpets, and even city-smashing super cannons!



New game mechanics and action systems add even more versatility to your RandomAnime games. Build and repair items and weapons, assemble cunning traps, use group battle tactics to gang up on your opponents, or blast your way to victory with powerful explosives. Minionomicon even includes hints on how to fine-tune your games for just the right balance of cinematic style and over-the-top action!


Minionomicon: Because you can never have too much of a good thing.

68739.name: Dacartha Prime
68739.description:
From the Back Cover:

Imagine a dream carved in stone. A place of passion and power. A city that moves with every shift, traveling the world without ever leaving its walls. Dacartha, the Free City, Gateway to the Maelstrom.

The long awaited new supplement for the Maelstrom game world covers the city of Dacartha in detail, from the barrios and the undercity to the Free Legions and the Senate. The ultimate science fantasy setting just got better! Not only is Dacartha Prime an excellent game setting, it includes the second editin Story Engine rules! Crawling with great art, Dacartha Prime includes story hooks, game ideas, maps, NPCs and more!

Explore the steaming undercity. Take your chances with the Trade Alliance. Steal art from the penthouse homes of the Dam. Live it up in the Black Barrio. Walk the Dream while ghosting on the Threes. Sign up for the Expeditionary Forces. Outfox the commissars. Explore the world. Just don't turn your back, and keep your eyes on the door...

A complete roleplaying game, Dacartha Prime includes a world overview, the complete Story Engine rules and even the fast play rules.

This book includes:


Everything about the city of Dacartha


World overview

Complete Story Engine Rules (Engine2)
Story Bones introductory rules
7 works of short fiction
Thorough index




Confront the Unknown. Transcend the Impossible.

68740.name: Book of Gray
68740.description:
From the Back Cover:

Welcome to the Maelstrom!

The Book of Gray is a collection of odds and ends for the Maelstrom world. An excellent hodge-podge of scenarios, magical abilities and items, realms and "a sharp dose of fiction to get you in the mood" (Serendipity's Circle, June 2000). Fully revised with 30 pages of new material, this second edition (formerly Gray's Journal) is compatible with the new Story Engine rules.

68742.name: Perfect Dark
videogamefranchise: Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)
videogamehonor: 1999 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Winner
68742.description:
From the game box:

Step into the dark...

As Carrington Institute's most promising new Agent, Joanna Dark must uncover the truth behind the dataDyne Corporation's recent technological breakthroughs - breakthroughs which could have serious consequences for mankind.

68743.description:
Jin Li (锦鲤) is the Chinese word for Koi. Koi are friendly fish. They love getting close to other koi, rubbing up against each other, gathering in small groups.

In Jin Li the players each control two koi in a pond. They swim their fish through the placid water, maneuvering around or jumping over stones that are dropped into the pond, and score points by getting close to any of the other koi. Be a friendly koi and score points, but don't let your opponent's koi get too friendly or you'll lose the game.

Jin Li is a fishy little game that's easy to learn and fast to play.
68743.name: Jin Li

68744.name: Paper Mario
videogamefranchise: Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)
videogamehonor: 2002 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
68744.description:
"Paper Mario, known in Japan as Mario Story , is a role-playing video game developed by Intelligent Systems and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo 64 game console. It was first released in Japan on August 11, 2000, in North America on February 5, 2001, and in Europe on October 5, 2001. Paper Mario was re-released for Nintendo's Virtual Console in 2007.

Paper Mario is set in the Mushroom Kingdom as the protagonist Mario tries to rescue Princess Peach from Bowser. To do so, he must locate seven "Star Spirits" to negate the effects of the captured Star Rod, which grants invincibility to Bowser. The player controls Mario and a number of partners to solve puzzles in the game's overworld and defeat enemies in a turn-based battle system. The battles are unique in that the player can influence the effectiveness of attacks by performing required controller inputs known as "action commands."

"

Source: Wikipedia, "Paper_Mario," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68745.name: Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door
videogamefranchise: Player's Choice (Best Selling Nintendo Games, US & EU)
videogamehonor: 2005 D.I.C.E. Role-Playing Game of the Year Winner (Console)
2005 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2005 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Nominee
68745.description:
From the game box:

Time passes, the pages turn... and a new chapter unfolds in an unfamiliar land! Get ready for a two-dimensional role-playing adventure for the ages as Mario returns to paper form to discover a mystery that sleeps behind an ancient, legendary portal called the Thousand Year Door. The quest is long, the dangers many, and this time, Mario will have to make full use of his papery qualities just to survive.

Microbadge:

68746.name: Babes in the Wood
68746.description:
The game consists of a 3D plan of a little cottage. There are two platforms on each side of the roof where Hansel climbs to throw down ginger.

Below stands Gretel who catches the pieces of ginger. There are six places where Gretel can stand on each side of the cottage and each side of the roof.

You can move Hansel and Gretel according to the throw of the dice. Hansel can move one platform up or down, and Gretel can move to an adjacent place on the ground. A third option given on the dice is for Hansel to throw down one ginger by sliding new tile from the bundle on the table.

Each platform of the roof consists of six ginger tiles. On the other side of the tile are one or three almonds, but there can also be a witch who can catch Gretel and force her to give up one ginger tile.

The game ends when there are no tiles to put on the roof. Whoever has collected the most almonds wins.

68747.description:
The board shows a city with lots of high buildings between which the players roll and move. When a player pawn reaches a black field, the player can look at the top face-down tile next to it and keep it if so desired. If not, he/she puts it back on top of any stack. When a player rolls a 6, he/she can demand a tile from another player who has four tiles or more. The goal is to collect a thief tile and exactly 140 Marks (money tiles come in 50s, 20s and 10s). The first player to achieve this is the winner.

(user summary)
68747.name: Emil und die Detektive

68748.name: Way of the Samurai 3
68748.description:
"Way of the Samurai 3 (侍道3, Samurai Dou 3) is a video game made by Acquire, released by Spike on November 13, 2008 in Japan for the PlayStation 3, and later ported to Xbox 360. It is the sequel of the PlayStation 2 games Way of the Samurai and Way of the Samurai 2.

The English version of the game was released in North America by publishers UFO Interactive (Xbox 360) and Agetec (PS3) in October 13, 2009.

The time is the Sengoku period. The story takes place in Amana, a fictional land ruled by a rising feudal lord, Fujimori Shuzen, who had overthown his former superior, Lord Sakurai, and became the new ruler. The Fujimori clan is an emerging force in Amana and has many enemies within its territory. In order to protect their domain, they force farmers and villagers to overwork and impose heavy taxes on them to strengthen their armed force. Because of this, people in Amana are beginning to feel discontent toward the Fujimori clan.

There are three main factions in Amana: Fujimori clan, Ouka clan, and Takatane villagers. The Ouka clan consists of vassals of the Sakurai clan and outcasts who desire power. They want to overthrow the Fujimori clan. The Takatane villagers are harmonious people only wishing for peace."

Source: Wikipedia, "Way_of_the_Samurai_3," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68750.name: Blue Chip
68750.description:
Blue Chip is played on a 8x8 square board.
On each turn each player must do the next two things:
1.Pass or move one of his stones,if and only if the stone is orthogonally adjacent to a neutral stone.
2.Pass or move a neutral stone,if and only if it is orthogonally adjacent to any non neutral stone.
A player wins when his first row is filled with stones,including at least one of his color.

68751.name: Samurai Western
68751.description:
"Samurai Western is a PlayStation 2 game released in 2005. The player assumes the role of a samurai named Gojiro Kiryu, who travels to the Wild West in search of his brother Rando.

Although it was not particularly emphasized either in the game's marketing or in the game itself, Samurai Western is actually a "gaiden" (side-story) entry in the Way of the Samurai series.

Samurai Western does away with the adventure elements present in the main Way of the Samurai games, and instead is comprised purely of action. The game is divided into stages, with the goal of each being to defeat the dozens of enemies that appear within it. The game can be played alone, or simultaneously with a second player. The game has multiple difficulty levels, ranging from Normal to Insane. You may also practice a level before you play it, but it does not count as a level completion."

Source: Wikipedia, "Samurai_Western," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68752.description:
From the Days of Wonder website:

Go deep behind enemy lines at Sword Beach as you airdrop in to capture the bridges of the Orne… Join Guderian’s famed Panzers as they battle the armored columns of the British Expeditionary Forces… Sign on for Operation Crusader to take on Rommel in the deserts of North Africa and liberate the garrison in Tobruk…

The Memoir ‘44 Breakthrough Expansion will take you deep into the battles of World War II with two, double-sided, 9-panel board maps covering all four Memoir ‘44 map environments - countryside, beach, winter and deserts. These oversize boards stretch the limit of current printing technology and are 13 x 17 hexes deep, opening up the Breakthrough format to new, more expansive scenarios.

The Breakthrough Expansion includes 15, never-in-print-before scenarios, created by Jacques “jdRommel” David, and Memoir ‘44 author, Richard Borg. These scenarios cover the Western and Eastern Fronts, as well as the Mediterranean and Pacific Theaters and include classic battles such as: Operation Crusader; Operation Amherst; and two different renditions of Sword Beach - all designed for the 13 x 17 hex Breakthrough format.
68752.name: Memoir '44: Breakthrough

68753.name: Kreuzwort-Pulok
68753.description:
Kreuzwort-Pulok is a collection of games with the same materials: 256 letter tiles (15 don't have letters, but faces on them - these are wildcards) and a grid board for each player that is protected from the view of other players by an integrated paper screen. There also is a cardboard "plate" (a round disk for discarded tiles).

The goal is to form crosswords on the grid boards. There are ten games included:

Sechzehner-Spiel: Each player has to form a word that someone announced. Tiles not needed for this are used for crossing words. Tiles are drawn and discarded (openly, so other players can grab the discarded ones). When the first player finishes, the other get penalties depending on the number of tiles left over and the number of tiles missing for the basic word.

Fünfer-Spiel: Each player has to form a cross of two words with five tiles. When that isn't possible, additional tiles are drawn, but not more than two unused ones can be held in the end. The first player to achieve a legal crossword scores points.

Achter-Spiel: Same as the Fünfer-Spiel, but two or more crosses have to be formed, three tiles can be kept.

Kaufspiel (for two players): Each player draws ten tiles and looks at them without sorting them. The active player can then announce "buying" or "playing". When buying, he/she also announces a number of tiles. Both players now have to discard this number of tiles and redraw them. When playing, both try to form a legal cross with their tiles. The winning player gets 10-15 points, the other one a penalty depending on the number of unused tiles.

Leiter: Two columns of ten letters each are places on the table. The task of the players is to extend each pair of letters in one row into words. Thus they can get rid of their tiles. A player who cannot play has to draw a new tile. The first player to get rid of his/her tiles is the winner.

Gruppenspiel: Similar to Leiter, but with an open cross instead of fixed columns. So the players can add tiles in any direction, as long as the letter combination occurs in a German word.

Wettrennen: Each player gets 19 tiles and secretly forms a cross using at least 11 tiles. The score of the first player to achieve this is 10 plus the last digit squared (11 to 91 points). The other players lose one point for each unused tile.

Wörter anbinden: A letter is placed on the table. Each player takes turns to add a letter, but the letters still have to form the beginning of a word. When that is not possible, all but the last (at least) two tiles are discarded and the last letters start the new word. The first player who can use up his/her tiles is the winner.

Ausfüllspiel: Three letters are flipped open on the plate in the middle of the table. All players now try to form a word which uses two of these letters as first and last letters. The first player to manage this is the winner.

Alleinspiel: A collection of four solitaire games.

The designer of Kreuzwort-Pulok is uncredited, but the preface is signed "J.M." (It seems likely, but isn't entirely clear whether these are the initials of the designer).

(User Summary by HilkMAN)

68754.name: WET
videogamehonor: 2010 CVA Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2010 CVA Best Narration of the Year Nominee
68754.description:
"WET is an acrobatic shooter game, developed by Artificial Mind and Movement and published by Bethesda Softworks for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. The game stars a heroine named Rubi Malone voiced by actress Eliza Dushku.

WET is an action game that combines shooting and swordplay with stylish acrobatics and a mass of gore. The main character, Rubi, carries twin pistols (which appear to be revolvers, but hold a surprising amount of ammunition) and a sword (she can also carry dual shotguns, sub-machine guns, or crossbows), and can fire while jumping, sliding on her knees, seducing goons and running on walls. During these acrobatic actions, the game enters slow motion, and she will automatically aim at a second enemy, allowing the player to shoot at two enemies at once. She can also combine her attacks, such as wall running off a person or performing a sword uppercut while sliding. Racking up kills and collecting multiplier icons gains multipliers, which increase score and the rate at which Rubi regenerates health. Rubi can also regain health by finding bottles of whiskey. When activated, she takes a swig from the bottle, then throws the bottle into the air and shoots it. In some sections of the game, Rubi's face will get covered in blood and she will go into a murderous, berzerker-like rage. These sections are presented in noir style, with bold red, black and white visuals. Rubi's attacks become faster and stronger to fight against large numbers of enemies during these sections, and killing chains of enemies extends her psychotic fury. There are also motorway sections that feature shooting integrated with quick time events."

Source: Wikipedia, "WET_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68756.name: Lone Wolf Club Newsletter (Special Issue - New Year 1986)
rpgissuearticle: New Year's Special Treasure Hunt Competition
68756.description:
User summary of articles in this newsletter:

Monastery Mailbag: a selection of letters from Lone Wolf fans.
The Kai Konnection: a pen-friend listing feature.
The Summer Special Crossword Competition: solution to and winners of the previous special newsletter's competition.
News from the Monastery: previewing The Magnamund Companion.
Warlock Quest: an advertisement for Warlock.
Magnamund: a condensed history of the last free planet of Aon, covering the major events that have shaped this world in the 18,000 years from its creation to the defeat of Darklord Zagarna.
Order Form: for purchasing Lone Wolf Gamebooks.
New Year's Special Treasure Hunt Competition: requiring entrants to use their copies of the gamebooks to solve a riddle.

68757.name: Lone Wolf Club Newsletter (Issue 5 - 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Beyond the Nightmare Gate & Castle Death
Lone Wolf Club Painting & Drawing Competition
68757.description:
User summary of articles in this newsletter:

Monastery Mailbag: a selection of letters from Lone Wolf fans.
Order Form: for purchasing Lone Wolf Gamebooks.
The Kai Konnection: a pen-friend listing feature.
News from the Monastery: previewing Grey Star Book 3: Beyond the Nightmare Gate and the cover of Book 07: Castle Death.
Lone Wolf Crossword
Caption Competition: winners of the previous newsletter's competition.
Grey Star Book 3: Beyond the Nightmare Gate & Book 07: Castle Death: an offer to purchase the new books signed by the author.
Lone Wolf Club Painting & Drawing Competition: in which entrants were to illustrate a scene from the Lone Wolf or Grey Star books.

68758.name: The Grass of Parnassus
68758.description:
A strategy/fantasy game played on two decks of standard poker-style playing cards, the basic idea behind The Grass of Parnassus was to create a fun strategy game which could be played on standard cards.

Each player has a city. The objective is to either build your city to a strength of 15 or to pummel your enemy's city to a strength of zero. Each player holds two "decks" of cards - a resource and action deck. Action cards may be played if the player has the corresponding resource cards to spend. Actions include strenghtening your city, hiring a champion to defend your city, deploying spies and thieves, and attacking the enemy city or champion.

Though intended for two players, up to four may play at one time by adding one deck for each additional player; this may add more dimensions to the game as alliances and cooperatives may be formed and broken.

The play is not too intense, though planning a few turns ahead is essential to success.

68759.name: WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2007
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2006 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
68759.description:
"WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2007 (often shortened to WWE SvR 2007 and known as Exciting Pro Wrestling 8: SmackDown! vs. Raw 2007 in Japan), is a professional wrestling video game released by THQ and developed by YUKE's Future Media Creators. The game is based on the professional wrestling promotion World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE). It is the eighth installment in the WWE SmackDown vs. Raw series and is the successor to 2005's WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2006 and was succeeded by WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2008 in 2007. THQ, Yuke's and WWE officially confirmed the game on March 31, 2006. The game was released in November 2006 for the PlayStation 2 and Xbox 360 consoles and was released in December 2006 for the PlayStation Portable system. SmackDown vs. Raw 2007 is the first game in the SmackDown vs. Raw series to be released outside the PlayStation consoles. The PlayStation 3 is the first console from Sony that didn't get a release until the following year with WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2008 that came out.

The game introduced a few key new features including an analog control system, interactive hotspots, and fighting within the arena crowd. The game also included several improvements on the previous game's existing match types and modes."

Source: Wikipedia, "WWE_SmackDown_vs._Raw_2007," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68760.name: Captain Soul Adventure Game
68760.description: A somewhat Blaxploitation roll and move game (spinner) where you play "Captain Soul" a Black super hero battling the forces of evil while exploring outer space.

68761.name: WWE SmackDown! vs. Raw 2006
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2006 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2007 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
68761.description:
"WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW 2006 (often shortened to WWE SvR 2006 and known as Exciting Pro Wrestling 7: SmackDown! vs. Raw 2006 in Japan), is a professional wrestling video game released on the PlayStation 2 console and the PlayStation Portable handheld console by THQ and developed by Yuke's. It is part of the WWE SmackDown vs. Raw video game series based on the professional wrestling promotion World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE). It is the sequel to 2004's WWE SmackDown! vs. RAW and was succeeded by WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2007 in 2006.

The main focus of the game is to bring more realistic and authentic to the series with many new features, breaking away from the arcade-like gameplay that earlier games in the SmackDown! series possessed. As well as the addition of the new Buried Alive and Fulfill Your Fantasy matches, the game also included two new modes: General Manager and Create-An-Entrance. This also marked the first time a game in the SmackDown! series was published for a handheld console, as it was released on the PlayStation Portable."

Source: Wikipedia, "WWE_SmackDown!_vs._Raw_2006," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68762.name: El Condor Pasa
68762.description:
You and your Condors' family have to take as much carrion you can, in the hope of earning more victory points than the others condors' family.

Flying from a big tree, the condors will land to take carrions - earning some victory points.
But, standing on the tree, the condors will make the most victory points that will give the final victory to your condors' family.

Now it's your turn to take a chance to make more victory points than other condos' family. Take your water and beware from bones, rattle snakes, cactus and be fast so you'll win your prize: the better place on the condors' tree!

68763.name: WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2008
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2007 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
68763.description:
"WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2008 (often shortened to WWE SvR 2008 or SvR '08 and known as Exciting Pro Wrestling 9: SmackDown! vs. Raw 2008 in Japan), is a professional wrestling video game developed by YUKE's Future Media Creators and released on the PlayStation 2, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, Wii, PlayStation Portable and Nintendo DS video game consoles by THQ in November 2007. Amaze Entertainment oversaw development for the Nintendo DS version.

The game is the ninth edition of the long-running WWE SmackDown vs. Raw video game series based on the professional wrestling promotion World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE). It is the sequel to 2006's WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2007, succeeded by WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2009, and is the first WWE game to include the promotion's ECW brand. It is also the first WWE game to be available for all seventh generation game consoles."

Source: Wikipedia, "WWE_SmackDown_vs._Raw_2008," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68764.name: WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2009
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2009 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
68764.description:
"WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2009 (often shortened to WWE SvR 2009 or WWE SvR '09 and known as Exciting Pro Wrestling 10: SmackDown! vs. Raw 2009 in Japan), is a professional wrestling video game developed by Yuke's and published by THQ for the PlayStation 3, PlayStation 2, PlayStation Portable, Nintendo DS, Wii, and Xbox 360 video game consoles. It is the tenth video game in the WWE SmackDown vs. Raw series, and is the sequel to its predecessor, WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2008 and is succeeded by WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2010. TOSE oversaw development for the Nintendo DS version. The game was released on November 9, 2008 in North America.

The video game is based on the professional wrestling promotion, World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE), and is named after the promotion's two brands, Raw and SmackDown. The game introduced a few key new features including the Inferno match, a revamped tag team match, and four new game modes: Create-a-Finisher, Road to WrestleMania, Career and multiplayer season."

Source: Wikipedia, "WWE_SmackDown_vs._Raw_2009," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68765.name: WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2010
videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
68765.description:
"WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2010 is a professional wrestling video game developed by Yuke's, and published by THQ for the PlayStation 2 (PS2), PlayStation 3 (PS3), PlayStation Portable (PSP), Wii, Nintendo DS, and Xbox 360 systems. It is the eleventh and current video game in the WWE SmackDown vs. Raw series, and is the sequel to its predecessor WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2009. It was released on October 20, 2009 in North America, October 22, 2009 in Australia and October 23, 2009 in Europe. TOSE oversaw the development for the Nintendo DS version.

The game is based on the professional wrestling promotion World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE), and is named after the promotion's two brands: SmackDown and Raw. It also features the promotion's former third brand ECW. It is also the last game to feature the third promotion, ECW. Similar to previous games in the series, WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2010 involves players competing in various different professional wrestling matches, either as one of the in-game characters based on WWE's roster or as a character created in the Create-a-Superstar mode. WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2010 adds several new features with the main theme based around customization, such as a Story Designer allowing players to create their own playable WWE storylines, an expansion on the Create-a-Finisher mode to include aerial techniques and for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 versions, the customization of attire colors in a mode called Superstar Threads, a revamped Create-a-Superstar mode and a Paint Tool for creating logos to use on their created characters.

This game became the first of the series to be available as an iPhone App. It was released on December 23, 2009."

Source: Wikipedia, "WWE_SmackDown_vs._Raw_2010," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68777.name: Assassin's Creed
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2006 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Winner

68777.description:
"Assassin's Creed is a third person action-adventure video game developed by Ubisoft Montreal and published by Ubisoft. It was released worldwide in November 2007 on the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360, and April 2008 for PCs.

Details emerge of a struggle between two factions, the Knights Templar and the Assassins, over an artifact known as a "Piece of Eden" and the game primarily takes place during the Third Crusade in the Holy Land in 1191. The game received generally positive reviews, and won several awards at E3 in 2006. A sequel, Assassin's Creed II, was released in November 2009."

Source: Wikipedia, "Assassin's_Creed," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68778.name: Amiga CD32
68778.description:
The Amiga CD32, styled "CD32" (code-named 'Spellbound'), was the first 32-bit CD-ROM based video game console released in western Europe, Australia and Canada. It was first announced at the Science Museum in London, United Kingdom on 16 July 1993, and was released in September of the same year. The CD32 is based on Commodore's Advanced Graphics Architecture chipset, and is of similar specification to the Amiga 1200 computer. Using 3rd-party devices, it is possible to upgrade the CD32 with keyboard, floppy drive, hard drive and mouse, turning it into a personal computer. A hardware MPEG decompression module for playing Video CD was also available. The CD32 managed to secure over 50% of the CD-ROM market in the UK in 1993 and 1994, outselling the Sega Mega-CD, the Philips CDi, and even PC CD-ROM sales.

Source: Wikipedia, "Amiga CD32", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
videogameversion: UK Xbox 360 (Classics Game of the Year) edition
68779.description:
"Assassin's Creed II is a third person action-adventure video game developed by Ubisoft Montreal and published by Ubisoft for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 video game consoles, and Microsoft Windows. It is the second video game installment of the Assassin's Creed series and is a direct sequel to the 2007 video game Assassin's Creed. The game was released on video game consoles in November 2009, and released for Windows on 3 March 2010.

The game is set in 2012, with player-controlled protagonist Desmond Miles escaping from Abstergo Industries with an employee, Lucy Stillman, after being forced to relive the genetic memories of ancestral assassin Altaïr ibn La-Ahad through a machine known as the "Animus." After escaping from Abstergo, Desmond enters a device which is more advanced than the Animus and relives the genetic memories of ancestral nobleman Ezio Auditore da Firenze, who lived during the Renaissance period of the late fifteenth century in Italy. The player controls Ezio, who becomes an Assassin after his father and brothers are murdered by a traitor to the Auditore family. While controlling Ezio, the player can explore game renditions of Italian cities, regions and landmarks in open world gameplay. The gameplay is a mixture of action, stealth and platforming."

Source: Wikipedia, "Assassin's_Creed_II," available under the CC-BY-SA License.
