68780.name: Super Star Wars: Return of the Jedi
videogameversion: North American SEGA Game Gear edition
68780.description:
From the game box:

Join the Rebellion and crush the Death Star in a giant 16-meg universe filled with all the action and adventure of the Star Wars finale. Take command of five different characters - from Wicket the Ewok to Princess Leia - and go up against the Empire's worst, from Jabba the Hutt to the Emperor himself! This is it! You're going to need every ounce of Force you've got!

68781.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 50 - Dec 2000)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Knights of the Dinner Table Cover Gallery
KODT Strips - Alphabetical List by Title
KODT The Rest of the Story - Goth to Get Some!
Retro KODT: An Appetite for Adventure
The Gary Jackson Files - School of Hard Knocks
68781.description:
"We've Not Yet Begun to Fight"

Special Double Issue

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68782.name: Super Star Wars
68782.description:
From the game box:

Join Luke, Han and Chewbacca in their fierce war against the evil Empire. Battle treacherous aliens. Pilot two vehicles in high-speed, first-person, 3-d sequences. Fight your way through the wastelands of Tatooine to the hostile streets of Mos Eisley and beyond. So grab your blaster, strap on your lightsaber, and take on the fight for galactic freedom.

68783.name: Super Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back
68783.description:
From the game box:

Pursued across the galaxy, you and your rebel forces marshal new strength on the remote ice world of Hoth. Although tracked by probe droids, attacked by ice monsters and confronted by an army of gigantic Imperial Walkers, you must not give in. You are the Alliance's only hope. Learn the ways of the Force, then test your skills in this fast-paced sequel to the hit game, Super Star Wars.

68784.name: Star Wars: Masters of Teras Kasi
68784.description:
"Star Wars: Masters of Teräs Käsi is a Lucasarts fighting game released in 1997 and set in the fictional universe of Star Wars. "Teräs Käsi" refers to a martial art used in the game; and, while being in grammatically incorrect form, is Finnish for "steel hand"."

Source: Wikipedia, "Star_Wars:_Masters_of_Teras_Kasi," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68785.name: Ships of the Elves
68785.description:
From the back cover:

DEADLY GRACE

Upon the waves, the ships of the elves are now only seldom seen. Once the ancient race ruled the oceans and none dared challenge their mastery but now the new races have taken up the challenge of the sea and sail with vigour to all corners of the world. Many have forgotten the elves, but their rule of the waves has by no means been surpassed. The elves go to sea for many reasons; to defend the waters of their nations, to trade with the lesser races or simply to dare the unknown.

Inside you will find:

Elves at Sea: Never before covered history and information on the sea-borne clans of elves and their total mastery of the ocean. Covering traders, explorers, and warriors in exquisite detail, players and Game Masters alike may discover the true secret behind the elves' supremacy on the waves.

Crews: Elves do not hire out their services to just any captain and even then can prove extremely expensive. However, for the captain who will settle for nothing less than the very best, gold cannot hire a better crew than one comprised solely of elves.

Weaponry: New shipboard weapons employed by the elves, including the Heavy Ballista, Fire Tower, Bound Bolts, and Naptha Elven Fire.

Ships of the Elves: Nearly 20 new vessels are featured, covering the entire vista of elven ingenuity in ship design. From the glorious and rarely seen Sea Haven to the deadly fast Elemental Ram, few pirates are foolish enough to challenge an elven fleet at sea, be it from the explorer, trader or warrior clans.

68786.name: Max-It
68786.description:
From rules page:

Max-It is a unique dice game played with a special set of five dice. Three regular d6s and two "function" dice, each of which has two Plus (positive) signs, two Minus (negative) signs and two Times (multiplication) signs. Game play involves rolling and re-rolling the dice, and grouping them in various combinations to produce the most desired results.

The game is divided into three rounds, each with a different objective. A round consists of three turns and a Max-It roll for each player. A Max-It roll uses only two dice, one regular and one function, and may cause a scoring upset. After three rounds, each player takes a final Max-It roll. The player with the highest total score wins.

Round 1 - Players try for high positive scores.
Round 2 - Players try for high negative scores.
Round 3 - Players try for the greatest difference between two dice rolls.

Components include 5 dice (3 regular and 2 function), dice cup, instructions and players' score pad.

68787.name: Push
68787.description:
Push is played on a initial empty 8x8 board.
Each player inserts a stone onto the board from an edge.
The push may be horizontal,vertical or diagonal,but must be away from the pushing edge.
Passing is not allowed.
If a stone,when pushed meets another stone,this too is pushed on the same direction,and so on.
Wins the player which has 5 stones in a row.

68788.name: Admiral Byrd's South Pole Game 'Little America'
68788.description:
Follow Rear Admiral Richard Evelyn Byrd, Jr., USN (1888–1957) on his trail by air, sea and land from New Zealand to the South Pole avoiding the perils of icebergs, crevasses and blizzards along your route.

Housed in the original 2 part box with color illustration on box lid depiction Admiral Byrd and scenes from his Antarctic exploration: Game board, 4 wooden game pieces, 4 spinners mounted to wooden sticks with colored cords and wooden plugs simulating radio microphones.

Object of the game is to insert peg at bottom of microphone into die-cut holes at “New Zealand”, spin the spinner and start out for Admiral Byrd’s Little America base. As players reach their destination they announce their safe arrival using the microphone and then continue on to the South Pole. The first player to reach the South Pole by exact count wins.

68789.name: Temporada de Caça
68789.description:
Da Contracapa:

Durante milênios os vampiros trapacearam a Morte. Agora a Morte quer acertas as contas...

As Noites Finais se aproximam, mas pode ser que as crias de Caim não sobrevivam para vê-las chegar. Vampiros são caçados e destruídos. Refúgios são queimados. Uma rede de caça-vampiros, conhecidos como Clubes de Caça, leva horror aos imortais, e em sua liderança está ninguém menos que o Anjo da Morte.

O Ceifador.


From the Cover, Translated into English:

For millennia vampires have cheated Death. Now Death wants to set things straight...

The Final Nights approach, but it may be that the childer of Cain will not survive to see them arrive. Vampires are being hunted and destroyed. Havens are being burned. A network of vampire hunters, known as the Hunt Club, brings fear to the immortals, and its leader is none other than the Angel of Death.

The Reaper.

68790.name: Zombie Office
68790.description:
'Zombie Office' begins with players attending another boring birthday party at the office. The boss is leading them in a verse of 'happy birthday' when an accumulation of chemicals finally take their hold on his squishy brain, turning him into an enraged, flesh-craving zombie. Run for your LIVES!!!

Run into nearby rooms, search for office supplies to use as weapons and other useful items, screw over your coworkers or work together to survive; but remember, there's only one first-place!

One player starts as the original zombie and chases down the human players, attacking and changing them into fellow zombies whom join in the frenzy, hopefully infecting everyone before the police arrive.

"This job really bites!"

68791.name: The Saboteur
68791.description:
From Wikipedia:

The player will be able to explore the open world Nazi-occupied Paris and some of the countryside and parts of Germany. Colour is a key element in the gameplay, and players will experience an Ōkami-esque style when entering certain parts of the city. In order to make that district coloured ("inspired") again, players must weaken the German forces occupying the area. In doing so, that district's citizens regain their hope, characterized by the "Will to Fight" (WtF) factor, a measure of public morale.

In areas with low WtF, the area is dark, with colour being various shades of grey (with the exception of several German flags, bright red and complete with swastikas), whereas in areas with high WtF, the area is vibrant and with full colour. WtF also affects gameplay, as in areas with low WtF, the area is filled with German soldiers who patrol in most places of the map in large numbers.
It is up to the player to return colour to areas of darkness.

In areas with high WtF, the Germans will not be completely evicted, but they will no longer be everywhere at once, and will primarily be centered around military bases, barracks, police stations, HQs, and other strategically important areas. In addition, the French people will play an active role in the struggle for areas with high WtF. For example, if Sean, the main character, gets in a fight with German patrols, allies like the French Resistance, Maquis, and even French passersby will intervene against the occupiers.

Throughout the game, players will upgrade their character in the form of "Perks". These will improve accuracy, ammo counts, damage and more. Perks are gained through actions, such as evading high alarm levels, sniping targets or demolishing a set number of German installations.

After you are introduced to the black marketeer Santos, you unlock weapons smugglers to buy weapons, ammunition, explosives, maps and other items. He also runs all of the garages in the story.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Saboteur_(2009_video_game)

68792.name: Viva Piñata: Trouble in Paradise
68792.description: The second game in the Viva Pinata series introduces you to new settings, new pinatas, and more challenges. Return to your Pinata garden alone, or with a friend for some cooperative play.

68794.name: Saints Row
videogamefranchise: Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2006 Spike Best Action Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2007 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2007 D.I.C.E. Best Story of the Year Nominee
68794.description: Welcome to Stillwater, a fictional city currently in the middle of gang war. Try as you may, you are unable to maintain your distance from the violence. You are saved from certain death by the 3rd Street Saints. Now you must prove your loyalty, and help them overthrow the other gangs of the city.

68796.name: Saints Row 2
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
68796.description: Five years have passed since the end of the first Saints Row game. You wake up after being in a trauma induced coma during that time. Now, you must re-form the 3rd Street Saints that disbanded after the events of the last game. In the meantime, the city of Stilwater has been re-built by the Ultor Corporation, and a whole new group of gangs have taken the place of the old gangs. You must lead your new Saints back to the top.

68797.name: College Hoops 2K8
68797.description: One of the most beloved basketball games of all time. This year, Visual Concepts has added 2K Shares. This feature allows users to upload created chants, rosters, and more. In addition, the game includes nearly every Division I basketball school.

Bowl like a pro or go for that home run...
Experience Tennis, Baseball, Golf, Bowling and Boxing as you never did before.
Thanks to the Wii remote, each sport will be immediately familiar and easy to play.
And, when you feel ready, challenge your friends and family: everybody will be in for some serious Wii Sports fun.

68799.name: Dead Rising
videogamefranchise: Platinum Hits (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, US)
Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2006 Spike Best Action Adventure Game of the Year Winner
2007 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Technology of the Year Nominee
2007 Japan Game Awards Japanese Game of the Year Winner
68799.description: Created by Keiji Inafune, creator of Mega Man. You play as Frank West, a photojournalist. You become trapped in a mall within the city of Willamette, Colorado. The game's zombies share a certain similarity with George A. Romero's "Dawn of the Dead" zombies. While you are stuck in the mall, you must use everything available to you to survive and rescue other survivors.

68800.name: NBA 2K6
videogamehonor: 2005 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2006 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee
68800.description: Shaquille O'Neal is the cover athlete for this year's NBA 2K title. In addition to roster updates, this year also sees the introduction of the shot stick controls.

2006 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
2007 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee
68801.description: Shaquille O'Neal is once again the cover athlete for the game. This year, Signature Style is added, which captures the animations of certain players.

2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Casual/Social Game of the Year Nominee
2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2008 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
68802.description: The second installment in the mega-succesful Guitar Hero series, which helped define the music genre for video games. In addition to many improvements over the mechanics of the first game, Guitar Hero II also adds approximately 70 new tracks.

68803.name: Krazy Bee Rummy
68803.description:
A set collecting, rummy card game played in multiple hands.

Players must collect 14 different card sets or "steps", one per hand, in a specific order, with an increasing level of difficulty. On a players turn they must draw a card, complete a step if possible or play off cards from their hand onto their own or other players steps if they have their target step "down", and discard a card to end their turn. If player discards a playable card, another player may call "rummy", play the card from the discard, and give the discarding player a card from their own hand. A hand of play ends when any player discards the last card from their hand.

Players score points for cards remaining in their hands at the end of each hand of play. After completing all 14 steps, the player with the lowest score wins.

Game includes 143 card deck (featuring unsuited number cards from 1 to 13 and "Wild Bee" wild cards), a set of four unique sliding windowed step counters that allow each player to keep track of which of the 14 steps he or she is trying to "get down" next, and a large pad of score sheets. Cards are linen finished and seem to be of high quality. Box top is sturdy. Inner box, with game rules printed on bottom, is somewhat flimsy.

68804.name: Kameo: Elements of Power
videogamehonor: 2006 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
2006 D.I.C.E. Best Visual Engineering of the Year Nominee
68804.description: Kameo has had the power to morph into the elemental warriors passed down from her mother the Elf Queen. Her sister grows jealous and kidnaps the Queen and several other members of her family and holds them hostage. She then releases Thorn, the Troll King, and his vast armies. Kameo must now find and use the elemental spirits in order to rescue her family and set the world right.

68805.name: Jeu du Grand-Homme
68805.description:
This game, the name of which translates to 'Game of a Great Man', celebrates the important events in the life of Napoleon I (1769-1821). There are 63 playing spaces, with representations or allegories of events in the Life of Napoleon I.The rules are engraved in the centre of the game board.

Rewards: forward movement, extra turns, taking of counters.
Forfeits: backward movment, lose of turns, payment of counters.
Equipment required: teetotum and playing counters.

Published in Paris, France.

68806.description:
The name of this game translates to 'Game of Parisian Monuments'. There are 63 playing spaces which represent places of interest in Paris with additional scenes in the corners. The end of the game is marked with the Arc de Triomphe. Rules are engraved in the centre of the game board.

Rewards: forward movement, extra turns, taking of counters.
Forfeits: backward movment, lose of turns, payment of counters.
Equipment required: teetotum and playing counters.

Published in Paris, France.
68806.name: Jeu des Monuments de Paris

68807.description: Simple roll and move track game featuring the comic strip character who was drawn from 1955 until 1986.
68807.name: Dondi Finders Keepers Game

68808.name: Jostle
68808.description: Jostle is a combinatorial game (i.e. two player, perfect info, etc.), which uses a 10x10 square grid, 16 red checkers and 16 blue checkers, as shown in the figure. On your turn you move one of your checkers to an unoccupied, orthogonally adjacent square, subject to the following. The value of a checker is its number of friendly orthogonal adjacencies minus its number of enemy orthogonal adjacencies. You can only move a checker when you increase the moved checker's value. The last player to move wins. I.e. if you don't have a move on your turn, you lose.

68809.name: Warhammer 40,000: Spearhead
68809.description:
Spearhead is a new way to play Warhammer 40,000 that enables you to unleash exciting tank battles and daring breakthrough missions on the tabletop, bringing the full mechanised fury of the 41st Millennium to bear in your games. June's White Dwarf will contain the main part of the supplement, including new rules and missions.
(from publisher)
Spearhead will make use of forces totally consisting of vechiles or monstrous creatures (in the case of the Tyranid and Daemon armies). This radical change from established Warhammer 40,00 will involve necessary changes to many core aspects of the rules system, most notably deployment of forces.

68811.name: Dragon (Issue 255 - Jan 1999)

Bazzar of the Bizarre: Life-Shapes of Athas
The Shadow Way: The Deadly Combination of Psionics and Ninjutsu

Psi Kits: New Kits for Psionicists

Vol. XXIII, No. 8
Cover art by Rebecca Guay

68812.name: Dragon (Issue 256 - Feb 1999)
rpgissuearticle: Ares - Blood Philosophy: World of the Weren
Bazaar of the Bizarre - Tools of the Trade
Hidden Agendas - Society of the Serpent
Rogue Heroes - Skills & Powers for Thieves & Bards
Role Models - Getting the Lead Out
Wyrms of the North - Tostyn Alaerthmaugh
68812.description:
Rogue Skills & Powers

Vol. XXIII, No. 9
Cover art by rk post (Randy Post)

68813.name: The Corporate Sourcebook
68813.description:
From the Back Cover:

In the 24th Century Corporations Rule

The Corporate SourceBook

A rules supplement for Justifiers RPG. Learn the ins and outs of the Corps, get an eyeful of the latest military hardware, and play one of 6 new Career Classes in your Justifiers campaign.

68816.description:
(from Compass Games website:)

Storming the Reich is a game about the World War II Allied campaign to liberate Northwest Europe from Nazi occupation. It is a game of brutal attrition and slashing advances. Opening on the evening of D-Day, with the Allies on the beaches and the Germans reacting (albeit belatedly) to the landings, the game covers the full campaign through to the battle of the Ruhr Pocket in April of 1945.

With plenty of armor, paratroop divisions, naval gunfire, air superiority and even the 79th Funnies, the Allies will break out from the beaches and race across France toward the Seine River. To keep pace with operations they will face difficult logistical decisions including the grounding of units and Red Ball Express in favor of other operations, a surprisingly thin infantry leash, and whether to give Monty the lead in offensive operations over Patton (or vice-versa)… For the Allies there’s a chance at an early auto-victory for breaking out of the landing areas ahead of schedule, but they can quickly lose the game if they don’t cross the Seine on schedule.

The German player will need to counter the Allied push with a healthy dose of reinforcements (admittedly of low quality), but with very limited replacements. They will need to take advantage of opportunities to thwart the Allies such as when Monty looks the other way at Antwerp, and they can even win the game, although not the war, by launching a successful Counteroffensive (aka. The Bulge). Careful use of Panzer Brigades and Tiger Battalions in offense and defense will play a key role in stopping the Allies.

Storming the Reich is a two-map game with units portrayed mostly at division level (with some armored brigades and battalions). Each hex is about 8 miles across (or about 13km). Each turn represents a month of operations accept during summer where each turn is 2 weeks. For players of Red Storm over the Reich, there are many similarities such as the variable movement allowances for both sides (a key feature for fog of war, variability, replay value, and solitaire play) and the same basic combat engine. A key difference is the elimination of the Redeployment Phase.

There are 3 scenarios included. Scenario one is the full 15-turn campaign using both maps, beginning on D-Day and ending in April of 1945. The second is a one-map “Normandy Breakout” scenario – at only 4 turns it is a perfect learning scenario covering the initial desperate fighting following the landings. Lastly is a one-map “Bulge to Victory” scenario where both players really get to flex their gaming muscles.


Ted Raicer's game on the campaign for Northwest Europe, using a variation of his Red Storm Over the Reich system.
It does not link up with Red Storm Over the Reich.
68816.name: Storming the Reich

68817.name: The Unbidden
68817.description:
From publisher blurb:

I used to be so foolish. I used to think that the world was too small for me, that I was always destined to break through the invisible doors that kept me enclosed among the mundane. Oh, and I was right about that — and I was terribly wrong, too.

Oh yes, I was always destined to break through those doors. I’ve done it. But I was wrong when I thought the world was too small. It isn’t. It’s too large. There’s so much space out there between the stars and behind the doors… so much space that the things that should never have come to be thrive out there, pulsing and growing and waiting.

Waiting for fools like me.

— Chashmal of the Mysterium

For use with The World of Darkness and Mage: The Awakening rulebooks.

This book includes:

A collection of dangerous threats for any Mage game, antagonists ranging from the living mage to horrors born of no womb
A treatment of Mage as a potential horror game, with advice on how to bring the terrifying, maddening and gruesome elements of magic into a chronicle
Dangers that go beyond simple entities — constructs, locales, even conditions and infections poised to plague the Awakened

68818.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Saints are marching back to New Orleans with their first Super Bowl Championship!

The MONOPOLY brand proudly presents the New Orleans Saints Super Bowl XLIV Champions Collector’s Edition. Buy, sell and trade Drew Brees, Reggie Bush, Darren Sharper, Marques Colston and Robert Meachem in an effort to own the NFL’s best. Relive the road to glory from their 13-game winning streak to Garrett Hartley’s game winning overtime field goal against the Vikings.

Congratulations to all Saints fans and to the city of New Orleans on your first Super Bowl victory in franchise history!
68818.name: Monopoly: New Orleans Saints Super Bowl XLIV Champions Collector's Edition

68819.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Jackpot!

Buy, sell and trade the most popular hotels and casinos in Las Vegas right now! Wheel and deal Caesars Palace, Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Stratosphere and the Red Rock in an effort to own and control the Entertainment Capitol of the World, Las Vegas. Become the "Kingpin" of America’s favorite board game, MONOPOLY, the Las Vegas Edition.

Includes 6 custom pewter tokens: roulette wheel, wedding chapel, stack of money, poker chips and showgirl.
68819.name: Monopoly: Fabulous Las Vegas Edition

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
68820.description:
Enemy Action: Ardennes is the first in a series of card-driven war games on pivotal operations and campaigns in World War II, from John Butterfield, designer of RAF, D-Day at Omaha Beach, Ambush! and Hell’s Highway. Each game in the series allows for play by two players or one player, playing either side in the conflict.

Enemy Action delivers fun, tense wargaming with a focus on command and capabilities:
- Low complexity with constant decision points for both sides;
- Two-player competition;
- Solitaire play of either side with an innovative system governing enemy command and tactics;
- Card-driven impulse system, with multi-purpose cards that can be played to activate formations, implement command events, or gain tactical advantages in combat.
- Diceless and chartless combat system – players draw combat chits that build a narrative of each combat.

EA: Ardennes portrays the German offensive against the western Allies in December 1944 -- the Battle of the Bulge. Each player controls the German or Allied (US and British) side. If playing solo, the game system controls the other side.
- Map scale: 2.5 miles per hex. Hexes are oversized for easy counter handling.
- Unit Scale: Regiments, brigades and divisions
- Time scale: One day per turn, with several impulses in each turn.

BGG wiki page with many clarifications and hints and errata:
Enemy Action: Ardennes German Solo FAQ
68820.name: Enemy Action: Ardennes
boardgamefamily: World War 2: Battle of the Bulge

68821.name: Treachery: A Fantasy Warlord scenario
68821.description:
User Summery:
When a local Duke decides to kidnap and ransom the leader of a mercenary group he's had under his employ in order to recoup some of his payroll, the Duke finds himself in a small war with a band of hardened fighters.

The Duke's forces include well-trained Humans and a small number of Dwarves while the Mercenaries contain a motley mix of Humans and Wood-elves. The Mercenaries main objective is to free their leader, L'Naiden, while the Duke is trying to hang on to the leader while crushing the Mercenaries.

This scenario appears in Red Giant (Volume 1, Number 2 - 1990) magazine.

68822.name: Street Fighter IV
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
videogamehonor: 2008 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Winner
2009 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Spike Best Fighting Game of the Year Winner
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Winner
68822.description:
"Street Fighter IV is a 2008 fighting game produced by Capcom. It is the first numbered Street Fighter game released by Capcom for the arcades since 1999. The coin-operated arcade game was released in Japan on July 18, 2008, with North American arcades importing the machines by August. The console versions for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 were released in Japan on February 12, 2009, and were sold in North American stores as early as February 16, with a February 18 intended release date. The official European release was on February 20. A Windows version was released on July 2, 2009 in Japan, July 3, 2009 in Europe and July 7, 2009 in the US. A version for iPhone OS was released on March 10, 2010. As of March 31, 2009, Street Fighter IV had sold over 3 million copies worldwide. An updated version, Super Street Fighter IV, was released as a standalone title in April 2010."

Source: Wikipedia, "Street_Fighter_IV," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68823.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 51 - Jan 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Gary Jackson Files: A Bid Too Far...
KODT The Rest of the Story: Bring 'Em Back Undead or Alive
68823.description:
"One Ring To Fool Them All"

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68824.name: Dawn of the Dice of the Dead
68824.description:
Dawn of the Dice of the Dead is a cooperative horror survival game for 1-4 players based on the dice system created by Mads Brynnum for Dice of the Living Dead. The game adds an epic storyline and a multiplayer framework, as well as new mechanics. Players represent survivor groups who have a limited time to search through an abandoned mall to find supplies and materials that will help them be rescued, all the while fighting off ravenous zombies.

Dawn of the Dice of the Dead can be played solo by controlling 1-4 survivor groups, or cooperatively by 2-4 players.

As of March 2010, a print-and-play playtest version is expected to be available soon, as well as a Vassal module.

68825.name: Deadly Games
68825.description:
From the back cover:

Dungeons...

The classic test of an adventurer's skill. Bizarre traps and exotic monsters stand in the way of ancient treasures. Cruel villains often use them to hide their machinations from the prying of adventuring meddlers.

But some dungeons want to be found.

Rumors tell of these great death traps, where adventurers are lured or forced to compete for the entertainment of the Society of Sinister Sport, a secretive organization devoted to profiting from the injury and death of adventurers - for the rich and jaded will pay grandly for the chance to watch heroes fall.

The creators of Tournaments, Fairs & Taverns (2nd Edition) present four devious death-traps, designed to be inserted into an existing campaign as a uniquely challenging encounter, or to be used individually as a one-night session for when you don't have a game planned. From the psychological horrors of the Dungeon of Darkest Shadow to the hellspawned hordes within the Well of Fiends, you will find many ways within to challenge your characters with these Deadly Games.

68826.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 52 - Feb 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
KODT The Rest of the Story: Dancing with the Devil
KODT The Rest of the Story: The Thrall is Gone
68826.description:
"It's a Wonderful Afterlife"

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68827.name: DM's Idea Pipeline: 2004 Collection
68827.description:
From the Introduction:

This collection of the DM’s Idea Pipeline features the material that was e-mailed to subscribers from June through December of 2004. The items, characters, rumors, and just plain stuff found in this book are designed to be used in your
games as you see fit. A lot of the material is created with adventure hooks in mind and DMs will no doubt have ideas of their own as they read through this book.

68828.name: The Imperfect Lotus
68828.description:
From the back of the PDF:

Many rare and exotic martial arts are practiced in Creation. Within this tome are enclosed some of the rarest, arts uncommon even compared to their rarified brethren. When your Exalt’s back is against the wall and all hope seems lost, these styles’ unexpected techniques may be what’s necessary to turn the tables. Players and Storytellers intrigued by such esoteric fighting arts should inquire within.

A martial arts sourcebook for Exalted featuring eight supernatural martial arts styles, ranging from simple Terrestrial styles to powerful Celestial fighting arts.

68829.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 53 - Mar 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
KODT The Rest of the Story: The Vampire Slayers
68829.description:
"The Spy That Hacked Me"

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68830.name: DM's Idea Pipeline: 2005 Collection
68830.description:
From the Introduction:

This collection of the DM’s Idea Pipeline features the material that was e-mailed to subscribers during 2005. The items, characters, rumors, and just plain stuff found in this PDF are designed to be used in your games as you see fit. A lot of the material is created with adventure hooks in mind and DMs will no doubt have ideas of their own as they read through this PDF.

68831.name: Debris from the Fallen Races
68831.description:
From the White Wolf website:

During the production of The Scroll of Fallen Races, quite a bit of material had to be cut. Now we've compiled that missing information for your Exalted series.

Welcome to Debris from the Fallen Races a PDF-Exclusive Series Book for Exalted®. Debris of the Fallen Races contains:

* Five martial art styles for Dragon Kings
* Chaos Pattern Charms
* Statistics for subterranean creatures

68832.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 54 - Apr 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
68832.description:
"Speak Easy & Carry a Big Stick"

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68833.name: Splinters of the Wyld
68833.description:
From the White Wolf Website:

Sometimes writers write too much.

The Compass of Terrestrial Directions, Vol. II-The Wyld offers many locations, people and creatures for Exalted games, but the writers produced quite a bit more than we expected. It seemed a shame just to throw the excess material away, though. Then, over time, other books ended up with little scraps and fragments of Wyld lore, and those seemed too cool to leave in the oblivion of a computer trash bin. Before we knew it, we had a lot of pieces with no home, so we decided to stitch them together into a crazy quilt of additional game pieces for your Exalted series.

The result is Splinters of the Wyld, additional glimpses of the madness waiting at Creation’s rim. - A PDF-Exclusive Series Book for Exalted

Splinters of the Wyld contains:

New locations for the Northern, Western, Southern and Eastern Wyld
More Mutations and Deragements
More creatures and characters

68834.description:
Educational Math board game that uses checkers type movement. The playing pieces called "Tivit"s are 6 sided dice with each side having a symbol and numerical value. The 2 players race to reach the opposite side of the board, forcing them to cross paths and allowing for opportunities to jump over other pieces. Each location at the other side of the arena (board) has a mathematical operation(addition, subtraction, multiplication or division). A players score is the value of their Tivit adjusted for the math operation for each Tivit associated with their final location.

The game includes 30 different paper boards with varying degrees of difficulty. For ages 8 and up.
68834.name: Hockey Tivitz

68835.name: Le Nouveau Jeu du Costume et des Coeffures des Dames
68835.description:
In each corner of the sheet is a scene for a different part of the day showing a woman engaged in a relevant pursuit such as dressing and hunting.

The game board has 63 numbered compartments, each showing the head of a lady. The rules are in the centre. This game is dedicated to the beautiful sex.

68836.name: Lyceian Arcana
68836.description:
From the publisher:

In an abandoned classroom in the Lyceum, three mages stand together, channeling their energies into a desperate ritual spell. Their enemies, dreamborn monsters bent on destroying the physical world, are half a continent away, seeking an artifact whose location had been sealed in the Lyceum’s vaults. The heroes’ only chance of getting there in time is this daring teleportation. They have been dodging charmed spell duelists and bribed effigist priests all day, and they hope that now they might have enough of a reprieve to perform the dangerous ritual. Their allies and bodyguards look on expectantly.

Suddenly, the doors to the classroom burst open, and in strides a Ragesian inquisitor, ancient and powerful, flanked by a hulking pair of biomantically-created beasts. Magically shielded by his bearskull mask, the inquisitor throws forward his hand with a fierce snarl, and his beasts charge. The bodyguards of the three mages hold the monsters at bay, while a master of the martial art of Tel-Shalanth tumbles across the room, hoping to disrupt the Inquisitor’s energy before he can cast a spell.

Nobody casts magic missile.

E.N. Publishing’s Elements of Magic – Revised Edition gave you a system to create any sort of spell you desired on the fly, breaking free of the traditional forms of d20 magic. In Lyceian Arcana, we present guidelines, examples, and new rules to help you turn that system of game mechanics into any sort of magical world you desire. Discover an academy’s worth of knowledge, including:

Nine sample magical traditions, including the Dreamers of the Inner Path – mages who draw power from the horrors they find in their dreams – and the Taranesti Diabolists – opportunistic dark Elves who gain their greatest powers by bartering with the infernal.
Conversions of the core spellcasting classes, to let you use the Elements of Magic system while keeping the same feel in your games.
Five new magical classes, such as the Godhand – a warrior who receives magical boons from his deity – and the Anima – a flexible class that lets any character imbue herself with permanent magical abilities.
Twenty-five magical tradition feats, a way to make yourself part of a particular magical tradition far more easily than taking a prestige class.
Expanded magic item and spellcasting rules. Create intelligent items, or cast powerful spells in massive rituals.
Information on the Lyceum itself, an academy devoted to teaching diverse magical knowledge, and a perfect way to introduce the Elements of Magic system to an existing game.

68837.name: Round the Town
68837.description:
A race around London on tracks, illustrated with various well known buildings.

There are eight starting points, all on the outskirts of London and each with numbered routes. The aim is to be the first player to reach the centre of London, marked by Charing Cross. There are 8 playing pieces.

Designed in England and printed in Germany.

68838.name: Elements of Magic (Revised Edition)
68838.description:
From the publisher:

Magic defines fantasy. It is the magical that makes a normal story into a fantasy that delights listeners, readers, and gamers by making all the impossibilities we can imagine become real. Dreams of magic can make even the most mundane day something to cherish, like a poem evoking the charm of the everyday world.

But sometimes, just like poems, magic can become stale and clichéd. Through repeated exposure, its novelty can wear off, and certainly, thirty years of magic missiles and fingers of death have been enough to render many fantasy gamers jaded. At its core, saying, “My love is a dove,” in a poem is as trite as, “I cast detect magic.”

Elements of Magic opens the world of magic to you, letting you create almost any type of magic-user you’d like. Magic is an artform, like poetry, and any good poet is never content to merely recite the works of others.

Elements of Magic is modular, able to fit whatever role you want it to play. It can be added to an existing campaign that already has wizards, sorcerers, clerics, and druids, perhaps representing another, higher sort of magic, or it can wholly replace the existing magic system, providing a whole new feel to your fantasy gaming. You will need a d20 core rulebook to use these rules, but this book will let you ignore the old, clichéd spells presented in those books, and create your own works of magical art.

Elements of Magic eliminates the spell memorization and preparation system entirely, replacing it with something bold, new and flexible. This book uses a spell list and magic point system, allowing you to build spells modularly, and letting you decide what the mechanics actually mean.

Elements of Magic is a rules module designed to replace the "fire and forget" spell system of the d20 Core Rules. The d20 spell system, while balanced and usable, is not flexible enough to model the magic users from most fantasy books and movies. Few wizards have ever memorized or prepared a spell, and even fewer forget them immediately afterwards. In Elements of Magic, each character has only a single spellcasting level, no matter how many types of magic she learns in her career. The Elements of Magic gives characters many times the options of the standard d20 rules. Individual spells are replaced by spell lists. Instead of learning a fireball spell, for example, a mage could learn the Evoke Fire spell list, which is very flexible as to its usage and appearance. Nor is the mage limited to fire evocations – with 20 elements to choose from, she could learn Evoke Lightning to stun and damage your foes, Transform Light to make them evaporate into a dim glow, or even exotic combinations of spell lists, such as Create Force/Drain Time, to lock them in a bubble of stasis. It would take thousands of standard spells to duplicate the effects of the spell lists in this 94-page book.

68839.description:
This game has 100 playing spaces. Players follow a young mouse from the time he gets up in the morning until he goes to bed at night. The French instructions are printed on the game board.

All numbers and rules are in French and the game was designed to teach the language.

Rewards: forward movement, extra turns.
Forfeits: backward movement, missed turned.
68839.name: The Day's Doings of a Little Mouse: An Amusing Game for Learning French

68840.description:
The board is laid out with a tree in each corner and a clearing in the centre. Players move along pathways that connect the different areas, and they follow printed directions, which include both forfeits and rewards. In the middle of each outer edge is a store comprising four oval spaces on which players place the food they have gathered. The playing pieces represent four woodland animals: a wood mouse, a red squirrel, a bank vole and a harvest mouse.

The game requires the players to gather winter stores for the animals and attempts to instill knowledge about the animals.

Rewards: forward movement, collect items.
Forfeits: backward movement, missed turns and forfeit of items
Equipment required: 4 round markers of stained wood, green with a paper label showing a woodland animal, 16 tokens, ovals of printed card - four each of acorns, beechnuts, pine cones, hazel nuts and wooden dice.

Published in the UK.
68840.name: The Wild Wood

68841.name: Notre Tombeau - Ecran
68841.description:
User summary:

Four fold keeper's screen, with an original artwork by Erwan Le Gac. Can be downloaded for free here: http://ddata.over-blog.com/xxxyyy/0/03/35/44/ecran_nt.pdf

68842.name: Phantom 2040
68842.description:
From the game box:

You are the phantom, searching for the evil Rebecca Madison in the vast city of Metropia. As head of Maximum, Inc., she will stop at nothing to fulfill her twisted plans to control the world...

unless you overpower her.

Vicious bosses and hordes of biots programmed to destroy you, relentlessly attack you at every turn. But you strike back with an arsenal of heavy-duty weapons including a smart gun, inductance rope, homing missile, and many others. Use two weapons at once to double your chances of survival! Then control your destiny as you weave your way through more than 60 incredible levels.

he danger is staggering. The fate of the city, the eco-system, and all of humanity rests on your abilities. You know what must be done to save Metropia and the world from certain doom.

Become the Phantom!

68843.description:
Do you love A. A. Milne's Winnie The Pooh? OK, here is the race game! On the game board one can see some of the adventures to be found in the books of Milne.

Published in London, UK.
68843.name: Winnie the Pooh's Race Game

boardgameartist: Eelco Martinus ten Harmsen van der Beek
68844.description:
This game uses the children's book character, Noddy, created by Enid Blyton in 1949. It is a four-track race game in which each player has a plastic playing piece in the shape of a railway engine. The pieces are of different colours, matching the colours of the four tracks. Players use a spinner instead of dice and they follow instructions that are given along the trackways.

Rewards: forward movement.
Forfeits: backward movement, missed turns.
Equipment required: markers, in the form of a steam engine driven by Noddy, coloured plastic, teetotum, marked 1 to 6.
68844.name: Little Noddy's Train Game

68845.name: Steel Bonnets: Skirmish Rules for 16th Century Border Reivers
68845.description:
From the introduction of the rules set:
"Fraser's book The Steel Bonnets gives a good history of the cattle raids back and forth across the Anglo-Scottish border during Elizabeth's reign. Having visited Hexham, capital of the Middle March last year, and toured the first purpose-built gaol in England, my interest in the Border Reivers was rekindled and I devised the following game.

"Being both a wargamer and a role player I was interested in developing a fast, easy set of rules suitable for a skirmish encounter while instilling a sense of proprietary interest on the part of the players with their figures. Too often, I find, tabletop generals are willing to sacrifice their regiments with gleeful abandon, heedless of the actual cost. Role playing games generate a notion of investment and caution, with characters developed over a series of adventures. Steel Bonnets attempts to recreate the care and concern a reiver patriarch would feel for his sons and gillies when they are on raid."

Scale: One turn equals one minute; one figure equals one man; half an inch equals one yard. 20mm or 25mm figures are recommended.

Although a miniatures game, figures have individual characteristics and skills that develop over time.

This simple system includes rules for Spotting and Victory Point, as well as everything need for combat. Includes four scenarios: The Cattle Raid, Black Mail, Government Raid, & Gaol Break.

Rules set appear in Wargames Illustrated #78 (March 1994)

68846.name: Slobbering Mutants
68846.description:
This is a game where players move their pawns around a hexagonal-grid board, and absorb bursts of radioactivity. These bursts occur at random locations. Each player uses the radiation they absorb to acquire cards with different abilities. The players battle each other until there is only one player left.
The Mutant Abilities are tongue-in-cheek, and are of three different types, depending on the type of radiation absorbed: Alpha, Beta, or Gamma.
The players track their hit points on seperate player sheets with plastic tokens.

There are expanded rules for serial/campaign play where players keep some attributes between games.

68847.name: La Vie Humaine un Nouveau Jeu
68847.description:
The boardgame has 84 playing spaces. The main title and the individual ones are in four languages: French, German, English and Polish. The aim is to reach immortality, and the end space of the game is the Immortal Man. It shows a memorial monument with an urn on the shoulders of women who stand on a column and steps, accompanied by four figures. On the memorial tablet are the words ‘MLEOPOLD/HERvBRAUNS/GEB1752GEST85’, which refer to Leopold of Brunswick, who drowned in 1785 while attempting to save people in a flood. He would have featured here as a model of selflessness, which was considered one of the qualities needed to attain eternal life.

Rewards: receipt stakes and/or moves forward, according to the rules.
Forfeits: payment of stakes (counters) and/or moving backwards or staying an extra turn in one spot, in accordance to the rules.
Equipment required: teetotum, one marker per player; at least 12 counters per player.

68848.name: Cutlass of Cheese
68848.description:
This is a dungeon crawl created by the same designer as "Cutlass of Fire" and made to poke fun at it. The rules are filled with funny references to the game itself and the previous game.
Squares are laid face down on the table and turned up as player put their pawns on them. The player will encounter walls, monsters, skulls, fountains, and treasure chests. By using cards for all actions except moving, the players battle monsters, find gems, and find spells, weapons and armor. The players' ability to use the items depends on their skills. Spell skills are based on the known elements of the universe, namely: Cheese, Nougat, Lint, and Uranium 236. Weapon skills could be: Stabby, Pummely, Huckey, and Minty Fresh. The number of hits a player or monster can take is called, "Chutzpah." The game ends when 7 gems are returned to 7 skulls (just like Cutlass of Fire) and the player with the most points wins.

68849.name: Le Grand Terme ou Le Jeu des Temps
68849.description: The boardgame was designed for the German and French market and uses those two languages. The starting point is a clock face numbered 1 and entitled 'Temporellite' or 'Zeirlichkeit' and the finishing point is number 33, 'Eternity'. Some of the squares require the receiving or paying of a token and some send the player forwards or backwards. The game would be played with dice. The player going out on the number 33 will win.

68850.name: NeMoren's Vault (d20)
68850.description:
The last of his line, Baron Paytro NeMoren has left his dark past sealed for decades in the family's underground vault. Now, three years after his death, a group of stalwart adventurers has gathered according to the baron's final wishes. At long last, the seal will be broken and the secrets of the vault will be revealed. Can some sins be forgiven? Can death stop the thirst for revenge? Find out when you enter NeMoren's Vault.

NeMoren's Vault is an introductory fantasy roleplaying adventure for use with the D20 system. For 1st-3rd level characters.
Notes on This Edition
32 pages. Included with this adventure are full color character and monster counters, full color visual aids and handouts, a battle grid, and pre-generated characters for "out-of-the-box" action!

[From back of the book]

68851.name: Medusa
68851.description:
Medusa is a Go game played on a base-10 hexboard with 61 'holes', so that a corner cell has 2 liberties, a cell on the edge 3, and a cell on the inside 4, as in regular Go.

On each turn a player has the following options:

Drop a stone on an empty cell.
Move one or more of his groups (a group is a set of connected stones).
Drop a stone and then move one or more groups.
Pass.




The player with more points wins. Points awarded:

One point for each stone.
One point for each surrounded cell.

68852.name: The Rifter (Issue 36 - Oct 2006)
rpgissuearticle: From the Desk of Kevin Siembieda
68852.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Issue #36 Horror Special includes:

- Rifts: Official Madhaven source material by Brandon Aten & Taylor White!
- Rifts: Story that serves as an introduction to Rifts Deep South, an upcoming sourcebook. Written by Josh Sinsapaugh.
- Beyond the Supernatural: The Dark Brotherhood. A big honking and scary adventure by Ed Emmer.
- Beyond the Supernatural: The Hoarse Whisperer. An insideous new monster to haunt your nights. According to Wayne Smith, it is awful and nasty, which means you’ll love it!
- Beyond the Supernatural: Another weird creature from Michigan myth, the Nain Rouge (aka the Red Dwarf), a bizarre, evil imp whose appearance always heralds disaster.
- Heroes Unlimited/Palladium Fantasy: The Epoch of Legends. A strange setting for your adventures.
- The latest chapter of Hammer of the Forge.
Stories and fiction.
- News, coming attractions and fun.

68853.name: Bob's: The Great War Game
68853.description:
The game deals with the Boer Wars, two wars fought between Britain and the two independent Boer republics, the Orange Free State and the South African Republic (Transvaal Republic). The First Anglo-Boer War (1880–1881) and The Second War (1899-1902).

This is a strategy game in which the two players attempt to reach their goals, while halting the progress of their opponent.

68854.name: The Rifter (Issue 37 - Jan 2007)
rpgissuearticle: From the Desk of Kevin Siembieda
The RCSG , Ft Laredo, and East St Louis Rift
68854.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Issue #37 includes:

- Splicers: House Shiva - Official Splicers source material by Todd Yoho.
- Heroes Unlimited: The Expanded Mega-Hero.
- Rifts: Short Story by Jason Marker.
- Rifts source material to tickle any fan.
- The latest chapter of Hammer of the Forge.
- Stories and fiction.
News, coming attractions and fun.

68855.name: The Rifter (Issue 39 - Jul 2007)
rpgissuearticle: From the desk of Kevin Siembieda
68855.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Palladium’s second annual Swimsuit Issue, but this one is so much more.

- Each bathing beauty is a femme fatale - a dangerous and deadly female heroine, villainess or monster statted out by Kevin Siembieda and a dozen freelance writers for various Palladium game lines - Rifts, Heroes Unlimited, Nightbane, Ninjas and Superspies, Palladium Fantasy RPG, Chaos Earth, and others).
- Each pinup has value as RPG source material.
- Eye-popping David Martin cover.
- 20 femme fatale pinups, each by a different Palladium artist.
- Game stats for each femme fatale by Palladium’s top writers.
- Source material from various authors and artists.
- News and coming attractions.

68856.name: Game of Strategy
68856.description:
The game board shows a cavalry headquarters in the centre and the implements of war in each corner.

Counters: 16 black and 16 white.
Spinner: With two arrows.

68858.description:
Tanto Cuore: Expanding the House, both a standalone game and the first expansion for Tanto Cuore, brings a garden theme to the world of maid-collecting, with construction cards such as "Garden", "Lily Garden" and "Leaving".

This is a Japanese deck-building card game which has a mechanism similar to Dominion.

Each player plays as the Lord of a mansion and hires maids to fill out their house to become the King of Maids! The end goal is simple enough, the player who has the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins! Players acquire Victory Points by employing a variety of maids and "Love" cards that allow for different strategies. You can even employ Private Maids that stick around to use their special powers each per turn! Some give you a bonus, or affect your opponents in a negative way. But beware, your opponents can make your maids sick or give them bad habits, affecting your maids in negative ways and decreasing your Victory Points!

The game art is in the Japanese anime style and uses the theme of maids commonly seen in anime! All of the cards, dividers and manual fit into an easy to transport box so you can easily take the game with you wherever you want.

Tanto Cuore: Expanding the House includes 280 cards, with artwork from 27 artists.
68858.name: Tanto Cuore: Expanding the House

68859.name: Transports
68859.description:
The gameboard shows 3 islands, 6 ships and two opposing fortified harbours with their areas marked off with blacklines.

This game was published shortly before the outbreak of the First World War in 1914. It requires the Red Fleet to move its transports from one safe harbour to another while under the protection of battleships, destroyers and cruisers. Its enemy, the Black Fleet, attempts to capture the red side's transports. Rules govern the movement of each vessel, and there are a number of islands that have to be avoided. The Black Fleet is not allowed to enter the harbours. The game is won or lost if the transports are successful.

Equipment: 13 triangular cards each with a picture of a ship and a letter, these represents two fleets (red and black) and various ships: transports, battleships, destroyers and cruisers.

Published in London.

68860.name: Sink the Submarine
68860.description:
This game is a straightforward race game with an unusual pattern of play with 104 squares set up and down the board around the central illustration with naval warfare, which is the finish.

Published in England.

68861.name: Maribato!
68861.description:
User Summary:
A fighting game with characters from the anime series "The Virgin Mary is watching you" (Maria-sama ga miteiru).

Players play in teams of two, and can switch between the two characters mid-fight. Special moves and fighting style are based on characters from Street Fighter II and Garou Densetsu (Fatal Fury), and are at the same time hints from scenes from the TV series.

68862.name: The new game of Jutland: A fascinating game of naval strategy
68862.description:
The game requires each player to position his fleet on the pad and guess the position of their opponent. The winner is the one who finds out the opponent's position first.

Each player takes a pad of charts and decides whether he shall be Blue or Red. He then marks on his chart the positions of his fleet, as follows, by means of crosses:
One Battleship: four squares
One Cruiser: 3 squares
Two Destroyers : 2 squares each

The squares marked must be consecutive for each ship, and must be in a straight line, although they may be placed diagonally, vertically or horizontally. There must be, however, at least one blank square between any of the ships, and they must not touch each other. The players must not see each oher's charts and where their opponent's ships are placed.

68863.name: A.R.P.
68863.description:
Air Raid Precautions

The illustrations on the gameboard deal with jobs done and dangers encountered during the war years.

This game is a race game with rewards and forfeits along the 120 squares. The start is the air-raid drill and the finish is the All Clear sounding. The game was inspired by the air-raid precautions (ARP) put in place in Britain before the Second World War.

68864.name: Retribution
68864.description:
Publisher blurb:

In the frozen depths of winter, murderous winds mercilessly batter the crumbling Priory of Cymer. Within, trapped by their duty and the heaped snowdrifts that render travel near impossible, the few remaining faithful huddle together and tend the sacred places of their forbears. With the weather worsening, nerves fray and tempers snap as the wind howls its mournful dirge for the forgotten dead of a fallen time. But the worst is yet to come. One of those trapped within holds a murderous grudge that only blood can expunge and as the storm reaches its savage height terrible revenge is wrought amid the frigid halls and faded glories of a bygone age.

68865.name: Monsters of the Mind
68865.description:
From the back cover:

There's more to these monsters than Claw/Claw/Bite!

Asuras, dorje golems, makaras, thoughforms, yali. These and many more exotic creatures await you in Monsters of the Mind. Developed by Arcana: Societies of Magic authors Kevin Brennan and James Maliszewski, this book presents more than 50 psionic creatures for us in any d20 fantasy campaign. In addition to accurate stats and evocative illustrations, each monster's entry includes notes on using it with Naranjan, the setting of the Mythic Vistas sourcebook Mindshadows. From the tiny Vinn Mohar to the gargantuan Wondrous Many-Headed Beast of Ketasha, Monsters of the Mind has a challenge for every adventuring party.

Monsters of the Mind features:


Updated 3.5 stats for all monsters.
Challenge ratings from 1/4 to 21.
Psionic variants of classic monsters like the aboleth and yuan-ti.
Beautiful art from Toren "Macbin" Atkinson, Drew baker, Kent Burles, Dennis Detwiller, Kevin Crossley, and James Ryman.
A brief introductin to Naranjan.


Whether used on its own or in conjunction with Mindshadows, Monsters of the Mind is a must for any psionic campaign.

68866.name: Sanctuary
rpghonor: 2003 ENnie for Best Cartography - Runners Up
2003 ENnie for Best Interior Art - Runners Up
68866.description:
From the back cover:

Sanctuary... a place of refuge providing safety from those who would bring you harm. Sometimes those who seek sanctuary are not those who you would expect to do so. Even the blackest heart needs someplace they can call home.

The rural backwater of Cherrimoor is a place far from the political intrigue of the towns and cities but it has its own secrets, its own stories. A Gothic adventure unfolds, involving a search for a fallen paladin, a family curse and the new tenant of Tharlin Keep.

Sanctuary is a role-playing game for 4-6 characters of levels 4-5. It includes a detailed local setting, maps and core plotline that can be used with most d20 fantasy games and comes with a bonus CD containing music tracks, key scenes, and buildings rendered in 3D.

68867.name: F1 Wyścig
68867.description: In these exciting races players must properly dispose of the stock tires and fuel. Accelerating quickly consumes fuel but it gives you more move dices. Cornering the car loses a tire. When the fuel level and tire is low, the player must enter the car on the pitstop. After replenishing fuel and tires can continue to move to fight for victory.

68868.name: Legendy Polskie
68868.description: A player is unveiling the lost legends of Polish. Collect the cards and travel around the game board (map Polish). Players can exchange parts of the legends of the others. The player who accumulates the most points wins the game.

68869.name: BattleBox Core Fantasy Set
68869.description:
From the back cover:

A comprehensive tabletop game accessory, the Battle Box contains a booklet of new rules systems, spell effect and area effect grid templates, a pad of character tracking sheets, a set of reference cards detailing all major actions, a fold-out battle mat, and a d20!

68870.name: Liber Vampyr: Secrets of the Blood
68870.description:
From the publisher:

Liber Vampyr: Secrets of the Blood

This sourcebook for the 3.5 OGL and the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game is intended for mature audiences and provides players and Dungeon Maestros with guidelines and rules which bring vampires to life in a way fantasy roleplaying games have never done before. Included are rules that make vampire characters more accessible to players, as well as broadening the different styles of vampire available. Finally, the book contains an all new rules system which drives home the vampire’s hunger for blood, and will make your players see the game in a whole new way.

68871.name: The Deck of Many Things
rpghonor: 2007 ENnie for Best Aid or Accessory - Gold Winner
68871.description:
From the back of the pack:

Draw if you Dare

The most famous artifact of them all comes to life with the Green Ronin's Deck of Many Things. Each deck includes 22 cards beautifully illustrated by Eliane Bettocchi and 2 rules cards. The Deck of Many Things can be used with any edition of the worlds most popular fantasy RPG and is sure to spice up any game.

Pray for the Moon and beware the dreaded Donjon with the Deck of Many Things!

68872.name: The Deck of Illusions
68872.description:
From the back of the box:

Let the power of illusion be your shield!

The Deck of Illusions is a tricky magic item that has helped more than one adventuring party out of a tough jam. Just tossing a card creates an instant ally, or at least the illusion of one!

Green Ronin's Deck of Illusions brings this wondrous item to life with 36 tarot-sized cards, with each fearsome threat marvelously illustrated. When you absolutely have to pull a red dragon or a frost giant out of your back pocket, reach for the Deck of Illusions.

This deck contains 36 cards: 35 with illustrations, one card with some rules and one card of advertising.

68873.name: Afrika
68873.description:
"In Afrika, the player assumes the role of a photojournalist hired to take images of various animals. Gameplay is mission-driven; players receive e-mails at base camp instructing them as to which animals they must photograph. Players may then travel by foot, jeep, or hot air balloon to the areas where requested animals are found in order to photograph them. The in-game camera is controlled by the Sixaxis. Depending on the quality of the photograph taken, the player will earn in-game money. This money can be used to purchase new supplies such as an upgraded camera."

Source: Wikipedia, "Afrika_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68874.name: Bladestorm: The Hundred Years' War
68874.description:
"Bladestorm: The Hundred Years' War is a video game for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 platforms. It was published by Koei and developed by Omega Force.

The game is loosely based on The Hundred Years' War between the Kingdoms of England and France in the 14th and 15th century.

Just like the Kessen and Musou series' from Koei, certain liberties are taken from the original history. For example, unlike what happened in real life, it is possible to save Joan of Arc from her tragic fate."

Source: Wikipedia, "Bladestorm:_The_Hundred_Years'_War," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68875.name: Mad Scientist!
68875.description:
"Greetings, I am Doctor Milton Perfidious, anarchist and terror to the civilized world. You have been selected as the top of your class to create things beyond your wildest dreams and to cause chaos in a world that shuns us and calls us MAD! Today’s lesson will be in giant monster creation and the instigation of a rampage in said monster. Now if you would please turn to page 13 in your text books..."

In Mad Scientist! you play the role of a mad scientist hell bent on the destruction of the civilized world. Players will create giant monsters with spare parts around their "lab" and use them to battle other players’ monsters and to destroy or protect locations. The player, who wreaks the most havoc, destroys the most locations and wins the most monster battles will be named the victor. There are also special Degrees in mad science that can be earned throughout the game and they give you special skills that other players do not have access to, as well as actions you can take to foil your fellow mad scientists’ plans.

68876.description: Boots on the Ground is the new Worthington Games series that puts you in the middle of the action. Start your mission as the Team leader of an elite group of shooters. Your team consist of a Demo expert, Heavy Weapons Expert, Medic, Scout, Sniper and you, the leader. During your briefing you are told your objectives and known intel on the area. As always, intel always changes once the Boots are on the ground. Move your force through the urban area facing an unknown number of insurgents coming from you at all angles. As the team leader you decide if you stay as a group or send out your specialist to eliminate the enemy with their special skills. Also come on the field with another team, you and another player can fight the insurgents together as Alpha and Bravo team, while the insurgents move and engage both teams with equal resolve race to see which team can complete the objectives first.
68876.name: Boots on the Ground

videogamefranchise: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)
Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
68877.description:
"Uncharted: Drake's Fortune is an action-adventure video game developed by Naughty Dog, and published by Sony Computer Entertainment for PlayStation 3. Combining platforming and third-person shooter elements, the game charts the journey of protagonist Nathan Drake, supposed descendant of the explorer Sir Francis Drake, as he seeks the lost treasure of El Dorado, with the help of friend Victor "Sully" Sullivan and journalist Elena Fisher.

Originally announced at E3 2006, the title was developed for about two years before being released at the end of 2007. Seen as a key title for the PlayStation 3 during the holiday season of 2007, the game was well-received by critics, many of whom cited its technical achievements and its high production values, similar to that of summer blockbuster films. The game went on to sell more than one million copies in ten weeks, and become part of the European best-selling Platinum Range of titles. A sequel titled Uncharted 2: Among Thieves, was released in 2009."

Source: Wikipedia, "Uncharted:_Drakes_Fortune," available under the CC-BY-SA License.
videogamehonor: 2007 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2007 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee
2007 Spike Best PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Technical Direction of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Story of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Visual Engineering of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Nominee
68877.name: Uncharted: Drake's Fortune

videogamefranchise: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)
videogamecompilation: Uncharted 2: Among Thieves Game of the Year Edition
videogame: Uncharted 2: Among Thieves Game of the Year Edition
68878.description:
User Summary:

"Uncharted 2: Among Thieves" is the award winning sequel to "Uncharted: Drake's Fortune". Again developed by Naughty Dog & released by SCE, Uncharted 2 refines & enhances the gameplay & structure of the first game, featuring a mix of gunplay, stealth, platforming & puzzle solving, all played from a 3rd person perspective.

Uncharted 2 is best known for its sense of scale & quality of experience - from start to finish, the player is taken to exotic locations and thrown into incredible over-the-top set piece moments, with easy to learn controls & interactions through a refined animation & interaction system. Uncharted 2 is often regarded as one of the top tier exclusive titles on the PlayStation 3 system.
videogamehonor: 2009 EGM Game of the Year Winner
2009 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Winner
2009 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Winner
2009 Game Critics Best of Show Winner
2009 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Nominee
2009 Game Critics Game of the Year Winner
2009 Gamescom Best Playstation Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Spike Best Action Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2009 Spike Best Graphics of the Year Winner
2009 Spike Best Original Score of the Year Nominee
2009 Spike Best PlayStation Game of the Year Winner
2009 Spike Game of the Year Winner
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Action Game of the Year Winner
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Winner
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Winner
2010 British Academy Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Winner
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Animation of the Year Winner
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Winner
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Winner
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Sound Design of the Year Winner
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Visual Engineering of the Year Winner
2010 D.I.C.E. Game of the Year Winner
2010 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Winner
2010 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee
2010 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2010 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Winner
2010 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Technology of the Year Winner
2010 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Winner
2010 Game Developers Choice Awards Game of the Year Winner
68878.name: Uncharted 2: Among Thieves

68879.name: Mirror's Edge
videogamedeveloper: EA Digital Illusions CE AB (EA DICE)
videogamehonor: 2008 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Critics Best of Show Nominee
2008 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Winner
2008 Spike Best Action Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2009 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Winner
2009 D.I.C.E. Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
68879.description:
"Mirror's Edge is a single-player first person action-adventure video game developed by EA Digital Illusions CE (DICE) and published by Electronic Arts. The game was announced on July 10, 2007, and was released for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 in November 2008. A Windows version was released on January 16, 2009. Mirror's Edge is powered by the Unreal Engine 3 with the addition of a new lighting solution, developed by Illuminate Labs in association with DICE.

The game has a realistic, brightly coloured style and differs from most other first-person perspective video games in allowing for a wider range of actions such as sliding under barriers, tumbling, wall-running, and shimmying across ledges and greater freedom of movement, in having no heads-up display, and in allowing the legs, arms, and torso of the character to be visible on-screen. Mirror's Edge is set in a society where communication is heavily monitored by a totalitarian regime, and so a network of runners, including the main character, Faith, are used to transmit messages while evading government surveillance. In the style of a three-dimensional platform game, the player guides Faith over rooftops, across walls, and through ventilation shafts, negotiating obstacles in parkour fashion.
"

Source: Wikipedia, "Mirror's_Edge," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68880.name: Midnight's Terror
68880.description:
From the publisher:

BEWARE THE CITY OF DREAMS…

Heated theological debate is the norm in Thygasha, a mecca for major religions. Recently, however, extremists disrupted the peace with mortal conflict in the streets. Worse, mysterious thieves stole the Orb of Midnight – an evil artifact – from its guardians. Concurrently, rumors that a second source of Thygasha’s renowned “silver sand” had been discovered caused would-be treasure seekers to foray into the exceedingly dangerous Khydoban Desert. Only a few lucky souls returned, whispering tales of vast caverns filled with the valuable drug. With handfuls of the precious material, several of these survivors financed return expeditions into the harsh wasteland, but none have returned. In addition, Prince Shyja’s scouts have disappeared and an ancient burial crypt is now seen above the sands.

This world supplement and free-flowing adventure provides hooks for characters of any motivation, and enables their personalities to come alive as they solve mysteries, battle dangerous new foes, and much more. Explore the famous City of Dreams on the eastern side of Reanaaria Bay, around the Arajyd Hills, into the foreboding Khydoban Desert, through two dangerous dungeons, and (if you’re lucky) back again.

Like all Kenzer and Company products, this adventure was designed with the Dungeon Master in mind. We prepare all the details so you can spend less time flipping pages and more time gaming. Being a DM has never been so easy, or so much fun! Here’s some of what you get:

80 pages of useful background, maps, NPC profiles and portraits, encounter tables, a full glossary, artwork and adventure details; no useless fluff!
6 new magic items and 1 new spell!
Details on the exotic City of Dreams, including the many churches, taverns, the complex market bazaar and more!
Player aids and handouts that your group is sure to enjoy.
ImageQUEST Adventure Illustrator: “Because a picture is worth 1,000 words.” ImageQUEST is the picture book that gamers love. Now DMs can not only read the boxed text, they can actually show it to the players.




Although easily converted for use in any campaign setting, this book is designed for the the official Dungeons & Dragons campaign setting, the Kingdoms of Kalamar - a realistic, dynamic world where complex political alliances mix with marauding bands of humanoids, and medieval technology and culture come faces to face with magic and the fantastic. Whatever type of adventure you seek, you can find it here.

This work is an official 3rd Edition translation of the adventure supplement previously published as Secret Temple of Adajy in July 1997.

For characters of 6th to 8th level.

68881.name: Annie Wants her Stripes
68881.description:
This is a boardgame published by the magazine Woman. It is a race game with help and hindrance along the way. It also reflects the fact that women were very much involved in the war effort during the Second World War.

On the gameboard one can see a snake pattern of squares with 18 illustrations and directions. On the right are the title, instructions and 4 playing pieces to be cut out.

68882.description: The players throw the three dice at one time and everyone looks together for the tile with the same shapes as those that come up on the dice. Different versions offer variety so that even older children and adults can have a lot of fun with Shapy.
68882.name: Shapy

68883.name: Steeple-Chase
68883.description: The gameboard is long and oval-shaped, and the 100 playing spaces are narrow and angled. The basic rules of race games are still used, however, with turns missed and players moving backwards and forwards as directed. This particular game is played anticlockwise. The game has five fences with a fallen horse and rider at the second. The centre illustration and the corners depict the race goers, the grandstand, coaches, horses and men and women. In each of the corners is a scene from a horse race and in the space between the start and the finish the scene of gathering the horses ready for the race with the starter and his flag.

68884.name: Tastaro
68884.description:
The educational matching game that helps promote visual and tactile shape recognition while boosting memory skills at the same time. Different options of play and levels of difficulty mean that Tastaro is suitable for various different age groups and accelerates the learning curve in a fun way.

Contents:
• 8 wooden shapes
• 32 wooden cards (45 x 45 x 4 mm)
• 3 cotton pouches
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

boardgamehonor: 2007 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
68885.description:
This game calls for quick perception and some imagination. To act, imitate or describe a wide variety of illustrations is fun and encourages creativity!

The players thrown the dice and places their figures on the first space with the colour shown on the dice. Now they have various options to explain the illustration to the other players. They can mime it, imitate the sound or explain the illustration without calling it by name. The first one to reach the goal wins the game.

Contents:
• 1 wooden game board (370 x 370 x 10 mm)
• 6 playing figures
• 1 colour dice
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box
68885.name: Imita

68886.name: Scouting Tests
68886.description: A race game which starts at 'Enrolment' and moves counter clockwise. Accompanying the game are test cards and badges, which determine the rewards and forfeits. The winner is the one who reaches the Silver Wolf Badge.
