68887.name: The New Game of Motor Tour: A journey of 440 miles from Edinburgh to London with incidents en route
68887.description:
The board is numbered from 1 (Start) to 100 (London) with 101 and 0 after 100. The winner is the one who lands on 100. If a player lands on 101, he must leave the game as he had been killed. If a throw takes a player to 0 or beyond, they must return to compartment 86.

The Motor Tour may be taken part in by as many players as there are motors/markers. Each player starts at number 1 and plays in turn and must go on to No 2, that is, throw 1 before he/she can get a motor to commence the tour. The towns meed not be called at, but if fall on a town the player misses a turn to view the sights. More than one motor can be on the same division at the same time, and motors can pass and re-pass each other.
If fall on division marked with penalties or advantages, follow the instructions stated on the divisions.

68888.name: Motor Cycle Racing
68888.description: The playing surface is long and oval-shaped, and the playing spaces are narrow and angled. The basic rules of race games are used, with turns missed and players moving backwards and forwards as directed. The game is played anticlockwise. The centre of the circuit shows a vivid, modern illustration of a motorcycle race in progress, with illustrations of cycles and people in each corner.

68889.name: Greyhound Racing
68889.description:
The playing surface is long and oval-shaped, and the playing spaces are narrow and angled. The basic rules of race games are still used however, with turns missed and players moving backwards and forwards as directed.

The hare must be advanced on its own track at the same time as the dogs. This is achieved by using two dice of different sizes, the smaller one for the hare. The dogs are moved by the players individually when their turn comes round, but the hare is moved at each throw of the dice.

To win, a dog can either land in the same compartment as the hair or pass the winning post, but the dogs may not pass the hare, and those that might, lose a turn. Losing a turn is also the penalty if a dog lands in a compartment already occupied as `it is supposed a fight ensues'.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
68890.description:
It`s fun to go shopping! Particularly when you`re buying colourful and healthy food! Giving children the opportunity to buy the food and pay for it themselves delevops in them an awareness of nutrition, strategic thinking and an early understanding of quantities.

The players move their figures along the board and bit by bit they buy four different items of food (apples, peppers, maize and fish). They have money tokens to use to pay for them but they must make sure to get the food at the right price. The first to pay for these four food items is the winner.

Contents:
• 1 wooden playing board (appr. 370 x 370 x 10 mm)
• 4 playing figures
• 16 money tokens
• 1 dice with dots
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box
68890.name: Piazza

68891.name: Whatzizz??
68891.description:
A mirror is something wonderful. The reflecting surface shows an exact image of whatever is held in front of the mirror. It´s a little more difficult if you can only see part of what is reflected in it. You need concentration and imagination to figure out what it is.

Each player puts a card facing downwards on the mirror element. Now all the players guess one after another what the picture might be by looking at the section of the mirror facing them. The player who guesses correctly may take the card and the one who collects the most cards wins the game.

Contents:
• 1 mirror element (135 x 135 x 105 mm)
• 60 motifs cards
• 5 empty cards to design yourselves
• 1 pen
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

68892.description:
This game with our "Funny Friends" is convenient for the youngest. Even two years children are able to follow easy instructions. The clear shapes and colours of the game are especially age oriented.

The animals run once on the racecourse on the playing field whereby the spinning arrow decides how far each animal may run in each go. The winner is the first animal to arrive back at his start or go beyond it.

Contents:
• 1 wooden game board (400 x 400 x 10 mm)
• 4 playing figures
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box
68892.name: Funny Friends Rallye

68893.description:
The small players thread the animals one by one according to the order of the cards. Once all animals have been threaded in the correct order and are placed in the middle of the table the game is over and all the players have won.

This game with our Funny friends is convenient for the youngest. Even at two years children are able to follow easy instructions and the game figures are extra big so that the small hand can grasp easily. The clear shapes and colours are especially age oriented.

Contents:
• 6 animals (dog, cat, sheep, horse, cow, pig)
• 6 wooden cards
• 1 string
• 1 lacing stick
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box
68893.name: Funny Friends Line

68894.name: Sliced Nations
68894.description:
A card game where the cards each have a letter of the alphabet and part of an illustration. The aim is to collect all the cards for one nationality.

It must be said that this is an educational game and not a game in the Happy Family category.

Published in New York.

68895.description:
Roll the Tama Roulette and start discovering the Tama Planet. His districts (Patchi Forest, GuruGuru City, Mame City and Tama City) and his inhabitants have numerous surprises. In each of your trips, a test is waiting for you: a reunion with a Tamagotchi character, an unexpected expense, an exciting game, a card to collect...
But don’t forget your objective: collect the major number of cards and have the most points before the sunset!


Haz girar la Tama ruleta y empieza a descubrir el Tama Planeta. Sus barrios (Bosque Patchi, Ciudad GuruGuru, Mame Ciudad y Tama Ciudad) y sus habitantes te reservan numerosas sorpresas. En cada uno de tus de tus desplazamientos, te espera una prueba: un reencuentro con un personaje Tamagotchi, un gasto imprevisto, un palpitante juego, una carta para coleccionar...
¡Pero no olvides tu misión: coleccionar el mayor número posible de cartas y reunir el máximo de puntos antes de que se ponga el sol!
68895.name: Tamagotchi: El juego

68897.name: Hide & Seek with the Kings & Queens of England
68897.description: A card game with the players trying to collect additional cards to create sets/tricks.

68898.name: Swords of the Middle Kingdom
rpgissuearticle: Review: Swords of the Middle Kingdom
68898.description:
From the back of the book:

IN AN AGE OF LEGEND
AND A TIME OF TYRANNY
THE LAND CRIED OUT FOR A HERO.
WILL YOU ANSWER THE CALL?

Explore the World of Wulin, defeat the minions of the evil Manchu, and restore the benevolent Jen Dynasty to power--all while satisfying your craving for kung fu carnage! Event Horizon Productions proudly presents the newest game in the slam-bang Cinemaction line. All of the outrageous, magic-wielding, wire fu action you love is here complete with a fully realized Chinese fantasy world built right in.

So answer the call . . .

Wulin needs you!

68899.name: Game of Columbia's Presidents
68899.description: A card game which was designed to teach the names and dates of Columbia's Presidents. The cards has an illustration, dates, signature and names of associates. Collect cards and get tricks to win.

68900.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 55 - May 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
68900.description:
"Puttin' on the Crits"

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68901.name: Amusement for Beginners in French
68901.description:
Teach French with cards! 210 cards with pictures and names cut in half. The top half with English name and upper half of the picture, while the French name and the lower half of the picture is on the lower half of the card.

The game could be played by one person or in the same way as dominoes.

68902.name: The Multiplication Table in Rhyme
68902.description: This card game has 96 cards, each showing one half of an illustration and one half of a caption. Its aim is to teach multiplication in a fun way. Players must collect both halves and the completed picture should prompt the the particular sum.

68903.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 56 - Jun 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Gaming with Strangers in the Dark
68903.description:
"I Dream of Djinni"

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68904.name: Mc Dowall's Musical Game
68904.description:
A game with 150 cards each printed with a question about music. The answers are all contained in an accompanying booklet. There are six classes of questions concerning different aspects of written music.

Class A contains Questions on the Form of the Characters, etc
Class B Time, Rests Clefs, etc
Class C The Names of the Lines and Spaces
Class D Sharps, Flats, Accents, etc
Class E Signs and Italian Terms used in Music
Class F Scale, Major and Minor Keys.

68905.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 57 - Jul 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
The Army Who Came in from the Cold
68905.description:
"The Scrying Game"

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68906.name: The New Game of Illustrated Proverbs
68906.description:
This game of 63 cards uses proverbs with humorous illustrations as its teaching tool. The idea of the game being to collect the words that make up the proverb.

The Twelve Proverbs are shuffled and dealt out to the players. The player on the left hand of the dealer commences the play by asking any other player for a card of any Proverb of which he holds one or more in his hand. If he obtains it he may continue asking until he asks for a card which the player asked does not hold. The right of asking in then transferred to him and he in the same way continues to ask till in like manner disqualified. When any player has obtained all the cards of a set forming the complete proverb, he turns them up on the table. The player who first completes all the Proverbs of which he holds cards at the commencement of the game, of which any cards remain to him as the game progresses, wins.

68907.name: The Royal Game of Mother Goose
68907.description:
Each card is printed with a title and illustration of a character, and a rhyming couplet. Each verse gives a moral lesson and a reward or forfeit.

Shuffle the cards and deal them out face downwards. The dealer commences by turning up a card and paying or receiving as directed on their card. The card with Mother Goose winning the pool and repeating the following words on turning up the card and making every player turn up whatever cards they have left:

Mother Goose by starlight flies
On the air with golden prize,
Her share will be the total hoard,
When all are served she clears the board.
The game all o'er her task is done,
Her only aim to cause some fun.
So now good night my children gay,
For Goosey bids me haste away.

68908.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 58 - Aug 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
End of the World as We Know It!
HackMaster Player's Advantage - Hero Building 354: Hints and Tips
Making Game Props 101 - Scrolls and Parchment
Rustlers of the Night - Pack Ape
68908.description:
"May All Your Hits Be Crits"

Cover by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

68910.name: The New Game of Animals
68910.description: There are 11 sets of cards. The lead card has a picture of an animal: an ass, cat, cow, dog, fox, goat, hare, horse, lion, pig or rat. The others in the set spell out the name of the animal with the letters illustrated in pictures. The set of lion cards is double in point value, because he is the 'king of the beasts'. The player who has obtained the largest number of sets at the end of the game wins.

68911.name: Everytown
68911.description:
Everytown is a ready-made, highly customizable locale for a Twilight: 2013 Campaign.

As written, the locations of Everytown are purposely named by their function and the NPCs called by their trade or position in the town rather than given names so the GM can easily modify them to reflect the locale and society they choose for their campaign. The intent is to maximize utility for every group playing Twilight: 2013, while retaining a plausible feel of a community of survivors that has survived the Last Year relatively intact.

Everytown is the root and trunk of a tree that, it is hoped, will bear much adventuring fruit for players. The follow-on scenarios connected to Everytown will be branches of that tree, usable on their own if grafted into another campaign, but adding adventure to the Everytown setting.

- from the publisher's description

68913.description:
The game board depicts a colorful spiral. Each of the six colors has six base fields from which a spiral "arm" leads to the center of the board. The colors don't "belong" to any player. Instead, any player can use playing pieces in any color.

There are two rule sets included:
In the "dice game", players take turns rolling four dice. With the results, they can put playing pieces on free spaces in the spiral. One die can be used to jump over another piece which is then returned to its base. When a player has occupied certain positions, he/she is awarded a number of scoring chips. The player with most chips at the end of the game is the winner.
The "board game" is a push your luck game. The pieces, which contain numbers from 1-6, are placed on their bases, face down. One piece of each color is flipped over and put on the corresponding position in that color's spiral.
A player can now flip over pieces and move them into their position until he/she flips over a piece that is larger than a previously played piece in the same color. In that case, all pieces that were jumped over are moved back to their bases (behind the un-flipped pieces, in numerical order) and it's the next player's turn. The same scoring applies as in the dice game.

(User summary by HilkMAN - corrections welcome. The rules aren't easy to understand)
68913.name: Spirakel

68914.name: The Guardians Masters of the Electroworld
68914.description:
From the box: "The Guardians, Angel, Logan, Destiny and Sky, help kids and parents through a maze of tough choices and everyday life situations. The object of the game is to make it home from school safely. Move forward by answering tough questions.

"Identifies areas where your child is at risk. Helps kids and parents express their feelings. Introduces ethical role models. Makes learning fun with interactive role play. Fosters a positive environment for family discussions. Teaches options for handling difficult situations."

User comment: Contains a colorful playing board which is a layout of several blocks and streets. School, fire department, bank, grocery store and other mainstays of small town America are depicted.

68915.name: Hirelings: Into the Wild
68915.description:
Publisher blurb:

You wouldn’t travel into the primeval forest without a tent and trusty hatchet; why go without a wily scout? Hirelings: Into the Wild is a free supplement to round out any wilderness-oriented Pathfinder Roleplaying Game campaign. Inside are full write-ups for four different hirelings: the camp follower, the guide, the porter, and the steward. This fully illustrated PDF also includes rules and helpful hints for using hirelings in your campaign.

68917.name: Leverage: The Quickstart Job
68917.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dennis Holland is not a good guy. He's responsible for bank failures, collapsed mortgages, and dozens of innocent people being forced from their homes. He collects seventies memorabilia. He's a bad man. And he's hosting a party.

Nathan Ford and his Crew are on the job, but it has to be done fast, and there's not much time. Presented as a training exercise for newcomers and experienced gamers alike, The Quickstart Job lets you and your friends play Nate, Elliot, Parker, Hardison, and Sophie as they take down Holland and his corrupt schemes. Included are rules, characters, and all the twists and complications you need for a night of high-stakes LEVERAGE action.

68918.name: Leverage: The Roleplaying Game
rpghonor: 2011 Origins Awards Best Roleplaying Game Nominee
68918.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The rich and powerful, they take what they want. You steal it back. You were bad guys, but there are worse people out there. The weak and the helpless need you. You provide... leverage.

The Leverage Role Playing Game puts you in the middle of a dysfunctional but highly-specialized group of con-artists, criminals, and crooks who are trying to turn over a new leaf. You protect the victims of corporations, mobsters, and corrupt politicians by using your expert skills to outwit and overcome the real bad guys. Using the award-winning Cortex System as its foundation, the Leverage RPG includes all the rules you need to create a team of rogues, plan a job, and get it done... even if it means going to Plan B.

68919.name: Leverage: Grifters and Masterminds
68919.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Every job needs a plan, and every con needs a player. This sourcebook for the Leverage RPG includes expanded rules for staging heists, planning capers, and putting one over on the mark. It's the ultimate resource for both players and Game Masters, including more classic con frameworks, new twists, a host of cover identities, criminal masterminds, and plenty of scenario ideas.

68920.description:
User Summary:

Edition Spielbox No. 88. First published in Spielbox 1/2010.

Players are hikers that are trying to cross a bridge. However the bridge is not stable and will collapse if there is ever too much weight on it.

Each player is secretly assigned one of six colours at the start of the game. The players throw the die in turn and make a number of moves with any pawns equal to the value rolled. Each space on the bridge has a weight score and if the sum of the pawns' weight is greater than the stability score of the bridge, it collapses. Pawns at the start and in the middle of the bridge fall into the river and swim back to the start, pawns near the end land on rocks and are eliminated.

If a player wishes to move his pawn to the goal and win, he must declare his intention to do so before rolling. The next player may then try and guess the roller's identity, with a correct guess eliminating that player from the game as well.
68920.name: Schwere Schritte

68921.name: Leverage: Hitters, Hackers and Thieves
68921.description:
Publisher Blurb:

If you have to break in, bust heads, or bypass a firewall, this sourcebook for the Leverage RPG gives you the tools and tricks to do it. Cutting edge technology, high-powered weapons, more fighting styles, and expanded rules for overcoming security measures and handling tech-heavy jobs. Game Masters will enjoy the rogue's gallery of minions and mooks to throw in the path of the players.

68923.description:
From Fantasy Flight Games (publishers):

BattleLore: Horrific Horde provides forty-two additional figures for your BattleLore army, including two never-before-seen troop types, as well as even more of the primary Goblinoid staples that are available in both the core set and the Goblin Marauders expansion. With all these added units, Goblins will no longer be relegated to serving as mercenary forces for a standard human army. The time has come to let loose the fury of the Horde!

Contents:

8-page rule booklet, including 5 new adventures
42 figures:
12 Goblin Halberdiers
12 Goblin Swordsmen
6 Ogres
6 Hobgoblin Cavalry (=Lizard riders from BattleLore base set)
6 Hobgoblin Hyena Riders (first appeared in BattleLore: Goblin Marauders Specialist Pack)

14 banners (only 4 of which are of the fleur-de-lys type)
2 Specialist cards (Ogres and Halberdiers)
2 Unit Summary cards (Ogres, Hyena Riders)
2 Weapon Summary cards (Slings, Halberds)
1 Medieval Tactics card (Battle-Savvy troops)
15 Goblin Deployment cards for BattleLore: Call to Arms




Expands:

BattleLore
68923.name: BattleLore: Horrific Horde

68924.name: Long Leg Wins
68924.description:
(From the instructions:)
"The game is very simple and can be played with young children. Each of the players will have a great deal of fun as they try to make the longest leg."

(User Summary:)
A picture of a boy, without legs, is placed on the table. Players draw tiles with sections of a leg and a number printed on them. One or more tiles can be played each turn to extend one of the boy's legs, but may only be played if their values total 7 or 11. Boot tiles force players to complete their leg, but must also follow the 7-11 rule. The player who completes the longest leg wins the game.

68925.name: Scourge of the Rat-Men
68925.description:
From the publisher:

At first, they came for the livestock.
In this unforgiving world, those losses were hard enough. Yet still they came.

Now, children have been taken from their very beds! Can your heroes save the village from the Scourge of the Rat-Men?

Scourge of the Rat-Men is a 4E Adventure, for characters of 1st through 3rd level. A perfect starter for a new campaign and a new edition, this adventure gives you everything you need to start playing right away.

68926.name: The Linotaur
68926.description:
From the publisher:

Adamant Entertainment continues our line of 4E support products with The Linotaur: a complete playable race for 4E campaigns.

Proud leonine centaurs whose nomadic tribes hunt on the open grasslands, the linotaurs are decisive and stalwart, but somewhat quick to anger and very territorial. A young linotaur hunter will set forth from his pride in order to gain a tale -- every hunter’s worth is measured by the stories of their deeds that surround them. Linotaurs will become adventurers to amass life experiences, and then return to their pride and gain prestige through the telling of their tale.

The Linotaur presents these graceful hunters as a playable race, as well as statted as monster encounters for use in your 4E campaign. New linotaur feats are also included, as well as several adventure hooks.

68927.name: Characters: Noble
68927.description:
From the publisher:

This class is featured in Adventurer's Guide to Cthonia. The features outlined below in bold are exclusive to Feudal Characters: Noble.

Will you expand your ancestral land, stave off rebellion, win favor of your king or queen, or scheme to take their place? As a noble, you must contend with your rivals while keeping a close eye on discontent peasants. Are you ready for the challenge?

Feudal Characters: Noble features a new multiclass character for your favorite role-playing game. Why a multiclass character instead of a full-blown class? In short, any character has the opportunity to hold a hereditary title: noble fighters, noble warlords, noble rogues, to name just a few.

This product provides Players and Game Masters with the following for thrilling play:

A full description of the Noble multiclass character
Nobility multiclass noble feat featuring the following traits: aristocratic action, noble temperament, and self-control
Bloodline power source
38 new bloodline powers
38 power cards - yes, we've done the work for you
Noble class template for Game Masters to create noble NPCs of their own
Finally, a ready-made noble adversary for players to challenge: a typical human knight




Although designed for the Feudal Lords Campaign SettingTM, this product easily adapts into your favorite campaign or adventures

68928.name: Anthropophagi
68928.description:
From the publisher:

Medieval Bestiary: Anthropophagi features a cannibalistic race of fiends with a voracious hunger for flesh and the means necessary to enslave the living or undead to later gnaw on their bones.

This product provides Game Masters with the following for ease of use and thrilling play:

A full description and anthropophagi lore
Three anthropophagi monsters: man-eater, marauder, and corpse-herder
Combat tactics for each creature
Four example encounter groups from 4th to 9th level
An anthropophagi related quest
Racial traits to create your own deadly anthropohagi NPCs




Although designed for the Feudal Lords Campaign SettingTM, this product easily adapts into your favorite campaign or adventures.

68929.name: Historic Charleston Game
68929.description:
The Charleston Game plays a lot like Monopoly with one catch: players must answer Examination Questions about Charleston's history or culture correctly to purchase properties when they lands on them. Knowledge of Charleston is the only currency in this game. Acquired property cards contain information that can aid owners in answering future questions.

When a player lands on an already owned property, there's a Showdown between the player who landed on the property and the property's owner. (If one or both players have no property, no Showdown occurs.) To resolve a Showdown, both players put up a property as a Wager, then roll the dice. The player with the highest roll (reroll any ties) draws an Examination Card and attempts to answer the question. If he answers correctly, he wins both properties. If he answers incorrectly, the properties go to his adversary. The answers to all of the questions on the Examination Cards are in the Official Rule and Answer Booklet that comes with the game.

The game ends when all property is claimed by the players.

The game states that it was Authenticated by Historic Charleston Foundation, Inc.
Cover picture "Adapted from a Lithograph by Smith, Painting by Hill 1850. From the Collection of the South Carolina Historical Society.

Description from Rules:
The Charleston Game is a family-type game which reflects Charleston's beauty, history, and culture. It may be enjoyed by all ages and should provide an exciting educational benefit to the players.

The object of the Charleston Game is to obtain the most property by correctly answering Examination Questions concerning the history and culture of Charleston and South Carolina. Players travel around the board landing on various types of squares. Fact Cards contain important history information which will aid a player in answering Examination Question. They also provide instructions for a player which may be helpful or harmful.

The game ends when all of the property is claimed by the players. The winner is the player with the most property cards. There are no losers in this game. Everyone goes away with a little more knowledge and appreciation for the cultural and historical background of Charleston.

68930.name: Der schwarze Ritter
68930.description:
Each player receives 2 Knight (painted plastic) figures.
The aim of the game is to move one of his knights to the castle on the other side of the game board.
A die is used to move the knights.A player can roll as often as he wants until he stops OR until he rolls the "Black Night" which is a symbol on the die.

68931.description:
You've hit the museum and jumped the train! But don't stay long. You've gotta be quick in this steal and deliver race game for 2-5 players.

Flee The Scene is a fast-paced game of robbing museums across the Mediterranean. Players use trains, trucks and ships to steal antiquities and fence them off. Players can carry only three antiquities at a time and must optimize their movement to edge ahead of the competition.

The aim of Flee the Scene is to steal and deliver the most rewarding antiques before the time runs out. Each delivered antiquity scores points. Once 1 player scores 13 or more points, all other players have 1 last turn before the game ends. The player with the highest score is the winner!
68931.name: Flee The Scene
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ117: Flee The Scene (2015) Shem Phillips

68932.name: Mechanical Boxed Set
68932.description:
From the Back of the Slipcase

"AJ Book, Rouages
Players Book, Engrenages
Technical Book, Pièces Détachées

Rouages include an introductory scenario, which includes eight prefabricated PCs and a few NPCs, information about the Echo Factions, as well as additional information about Orpee, and its "picking" by Inaïs, five new creatures - including the Dream creatures - as well as an introduction to the world of the Shamans, along with a few of their keys...

Engrenages gives in-depth information about the Races, the Ecatims (half-Echoes), the Echo Brotherhoods and the Vocations, as well as introducing two new Vocations (the Spectre and the Engineer), five new jobs, and it includes a section entitled "Energies, Materials, and Equipment"... as well as an in-depth look at Subtle Mechanisms and how to use them...

Pièces Détachées are much simpler: the concrete application of the theories concerning Subtle Mechanisms, the Engineer and the Spectre's gifts and powers from the first Sphere, the gifts from the second Sphere of the twelve Vocations all together, as well as Errata from the first book - which are sad, but necessary.

If you are missing anything at all after this Mechanical Boxed-set, just wait for its continuation..."

User Summary

This product includes a heavy duty slipcase, three books as indicated above (64 pages each), a double sided map with Kaïnas on one side and a "Close-up of the Enclave" ~ the city of Khaï-Bhek ~ on the other side, and a four-panel Absolute Judge (AJ, i.e. Gamemaster) screen.

It has been indicated that this was a limited edition release intended to be followed up as a single hardcover volume.

68934.name: Wayfinder (Issue 2 - Winter 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Tales from the Front: Life in Korvosa, part 2
68934.description:
Table of contents:

Foreword
Deacon and the Devil
Weal or Woe: The Ritual of Stardust
Winter’s Fool, part 1
Threats of Irrisen
Skald Almighty
Side Treks: Northern Avistan
Holidays: Crystalhue
Kellid Fetishes
Tales from the Front: Life in Korvosa, part 2
Drugs of Golarion
A Feat for Every Sort
Sigur and the Wolf
Thematic Channeling
The Greenhorns, part 2
Prestige Class: The Gunslinger
The Well-Read Gorilla
False Assumptions
New Race: Svartalfar
Spawn of Rovagug: The Dawnfly
Falcon’s Hollow Campaign Traits
What Comes Back
A Matter of Blood: Sorcerer Bloodlines
Words from Many Roads
New Race: Abirai
New Monster: Asashim
New Monster: Grave Guard
Taste of Golarion
Linguistics Check
Burnt Offerings Stage Play

68935.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 2008
videogameversion: EU Wii version with Greek Back Cover
videogamefranchise: Xbox Classics (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, PAL)
68935.description:
"The Nintendo Wii version of PES 2008 (named Winning Eleven Play Maker 2008 in Japan) differs radically from the other versions. The basic gameplay is centered around pointing the Wii Remote at the screen and directing players by dragging them with the on-screen cursor, and passing is done by simply pointing to the desired space or player and pressing a button. This allows for a more tactical approach to the game, as there is almost complete freedom in moving any player on the screen anywhere, and much more tactics and maneuvers can be used in the attacking game than ever before.

This version omits the Master League mode for the Champions Road, which lets the player tour a slew of different leagues around Europe, and when a games is won, it is possible to acquire players from the defeated teams. Also, it features an online mode that Konami called "the best online experience" when compared to the other versions.

The Wii version of PES 2008 received generally more positive reviews than the other versions."

Source: Wikipedia, "Pro_Evolution_Soccer_2008," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

68936.name: Ritter
68936.description:
"A diceless battle game for ancients and medievals." from the cover of the rulebook.
Rules cover troop types (similar to DBA), movement, units and attacks. Each army has a rating for number of moves, number of killing attacks, and number of stands it can lose before it breaks. Combat is decided by a unique diceless matrix.
Also included are army lists from the dawn of history to the Renaissance and the Far East.
Part 2 of the Strategic Spectrum Series.

68937.name: Fusilier
68937.description:
A diceless battle game for the horse and musket era.
Rules included for troop types, units, movement, and attacks. Combat results are determined by a diceless combat matrix.
Army lists are included for the 16th, 17th, 18th and 19th centuries.

Third in the Strategic Spectrum Series.

68939.name: Brewster's Millions
68939.description:
From the rules...

All players are referred to as "BREWSTERS" and each have a fortune of $1,000,000. To win the game a Brewster must spend his $1,000,000 directed by the spin of the Rainbow Wheel and Diary Chart.

68940.name: Pirate Plunder
68940.description:
"Exciting Game of Deep Sea Diving for Buried Treasure Chests"

Nice colorful graphics on both game box and board for this All-Fair game. A simple roll and move track game with cardboard tokens and cardboard treasure chests.

68941.name: Naked Doom and Deathtrap Equalizer
68941.description:
A Tunnels and Trolls Two-in-One Adventure

Naked Doom

Although you were innocent, the court condemned you to the catacombs beneath the city ... many would have preferred death at the executioner's hand, but you weren't given the choice; stripped of weapons and clothing, will you fall prey to the terrifying monsters that lurk below, or will you make your way past the piles of human bones back to the light of day and freedom?

Deathtrap Equalizer

Designed by a death-dealing madman in the City of Kosht, the Deathtrap Equalizer is reached through a teleport gate that will plunge you into a hundred different adventures.Gripping your sword you stand before the shimmering portal and hear the last words of your host: "Beware: the Equalizer was designed to kill fools".Are you clever enough to survive?

Find out in this Two-in-One Adventure book, with comlete, easy-to-play rule system.

boardgamecompilation: Munchkin 5, 6 e 7: Tutti i Mostri Fatti a Fette
68942.description:
Description from the publisher:

Munchkin Marked for Death is a double-duty booster set! This pack contains 17 new cards, including "Anvil", "Recalculate Your XP", and the horrifying effervescence of the "Soap Golem" ... plus two almost-new cards. And they're balanced to let you use them as a quick rigged demo for your friends, to get them into the madness that is Munchkin!

The two "almost-new" cards are the corrected reprints of "Curse! Lead Paint!" and "Curse! Warranty Expires!". These were originally released with Munchkin 7: More Good Cards, but were erroneously printed with Treasure backs instead of Door backs.
68942.name: Munchkin Marked For Death

boardgamehonor: 2011 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
2013 Games Magazine Best New Abstract Strategy Game Winner
68943.description:
Abstract strategy game in the world of ancient elements

Aether is a tile placement game with simple rules but packed with deep and strategical game play. In Aether, players use the four primary elements - earth, air, water and fire - in the battle over the mystical fifth element Aether. Are you up to the challenge? Will you be the next ruler of the elemental planes?

In the game of Aether, players place element tiles and elementals on the gameboard in pursuit of gaining control of the aether tiles. On his turn, a player must place an element tile on any empty hexagonal on the board. In addition, player may place an elemental on top of the tile he/she just placed.

Each elemental on the board has its type defined by the type of element it is placed on. The elemental gains power from this type of element tiles: from the one it is sitting on as well as the ones surrounding it. In addition, each element has its counter element and all counter element tiles touching the elemental reduce its power.

The player with the most elemental power surrounding an aether tile wins it for him/herself. At the end end of the game, the player score points for each won Aether tile as well points for elemenentals left unused. The player with the most points is the winner.
68943.name: Aether

68944.name: Footprints (Issue 16 - Nov 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Relics of the Veil: The Urban
68944.description:
Publisher blurb:
Welcome to Issue 16 of Dragonsfoot's own e-zine:

Contents
The Transmuter (class)
Bandit Stronghold (adventure)
Elemental Stalkers (creature)
Frost Naga (creature)
Iceblight (creature)
Primordimental (creature)
The Urban (class)
Cantor's Pocket Demesne (spell)

68945.description:
Proxy Wars is an expandable two-player game in a contemporary but slightly fictional setting. Players represent a battle-ready faction and use their agents to fight for control of a customizable board, which is set up individually each game. To win, agents must occupy valuable tiles worth victory points (VPs) or wipe out enemy agents or do both.

Proxy Wars is a full-fledged strategy card-based board game, and the game mechanisms include tile-placing (the cards form the board) and deck-building elements. You are to decide how to best deploy your faction's power and agents to outwit your opponent with ingenious cutting, positioning and attacking strategies. Each player starts with ten agents (playing pieces) in his headquarters and a set of faction cards. Players alternate turns, choosing one of the following actions:


Play a new card
Recruit an agent
Move an agent
Attack enemy agents
Take card actions


At the end of the game, players total the number of agents they control, along with any VPs that they have accumulated on their cards. Whoever has the most points wins.

To play Proxy Wars, you need at least the two basic sets: GreenEngage and MegaCorp; Proxy Wars: Oath Bound, which contains additional cards for both factions, is recommended.
68945.name: Proxy Wars
boardgameexpansion: Proxy Wars: Oath Bound Expansion Set

68946.description:
User summary:

Reveal an oversized card, put 90 seconds on the clock, then attempt to find the correct side on each of the six enormous cubes, and arrange them to match the image displayed on the card. Hexahedron is a game for any number of players (even one) that features 36 pieces of abstract art by Alex Beard.
68946.name: Hexahedron

68947.description:
Arvuutin is a new kind of trivia/estimation game from Onni Games!

The main idea is that players answer to each question by playing number cards from their hands. On his turn, a player chooses a question from one of the question categories. After the question has been read out loud, all players choose their answer by playing cards face down on the table. All answers are revealed simultaneously. Each question has an answer between 1-100 and player's answer is the sum of the numbers he played. The player whose answer is closest to the correct answer, wins the question card for himself/herself but loses the number cards he/she played. Players may also play 'pass'-card and skip the question, but get to draw new number cards instead.

At the end of the game, players calculate their scores: players get points from won question cards and from hidden score cards that are dealt in the beginning of the game. During the game, players may influence what is the value of each question category at the end of the game - category's value depends on how many questions has been asked from that category. The game comes with eight question categories, from which five are chosen for each game. The player with the most points at the end of the game, is the winner!

Arvuutin offers a fast paced and fun trivia-experience for all people! Arvuutin will be published in Finnish and is available fall 2010 in Finland.


Arvuutin on kone, joka tietää vastauksen kaikkeen!

Päivittäin pitkä jono kansalaisia käy kyselemässä Arvuuttimelta mitä kummallisimpia kysymyksiä. Koneen vastaukset putoilevat numerokortteina vastauslaatikoihin ja tuppaavat menemään pahasti sekaisin. Pelaajat ovat Arvuuttimen työntekijöitä, joiden tehtävänä on setviä koneen antamat vastaukset.

Arvuutin on uudenlainen tietopeli, jossa pelaajat arvioivat oikeita vastauksia kysymyksiin ja esittävät arvauksensa pelin aikana käteen kerättävillä numerokorteilla. Pelin mukana tulee kahdeksan erilaista kysymyskategoriaa, joista pelaajat valitsevat kullekin pelikerralle viisi haluamaansa. Pelissä ei menesty pelkällä kovalla tiedolla, sillä sopivien numerokorttien kerääminen on myös tärkeää. Arvuutin tarjoaakin hauskan ja nopeatempoisen pelikokemuksen kaikille visailupelien ystäville!

Kaupoissa syksyllä 2010!
68947.name: Arvuutin

68948.name: Batalha Rock & Roll: Beta
68948.description:
Also called Rock`n Roll Battle.

This is a game inspired in Rock n' Roll Racing, a video game from 1993 for SNES and some other consoles.

In Rock`n Roll Battle, players must to make and spend money with improvements on them car to win the race. Each player is a character pilot of a car, forming combos combining the special power of the pilot and the special power of the car.

The turns are played using action points to move, shoot, put mines or use some another special power.

68949.name: Devilspawn
68949.description:
Publisher blurb:

This is the exciting new adventure written by Len Lakofka and set in the Lendore Isles. An adventure for 6-10 characters of level 3-5.

68951.name: Calculi und Trampoli
68951.description:
Trampoli consists of a game board and sixteen playing pieces in two colors.
The pieces are set up in the last row and aim to reach the opposite end of the game board. A piece can either move one field in any direction, or make a jump. A jump requires another piece (own or opponent's) to be exactly the number of fields away that the number on the jumping piece (they are numbered 2 to 6) states. The jump goes onto that piece and then, like in a trampoline jump, continues for the same distance yet again (in a straight line in any direction). The first player to get all his/her pieces into the last two rows on the opponent's side is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

68952.name: Paartour
68952.description:
Roll and Move in which each player has two playing pieces which start from different positions. The first player whose second piece catches up with his/her first piece is the winner.
The active player rolls two dice, using the lower result for the first, the higher result for the second piece. There is a limited amount of decision-making; a result can be forfeited or one die can be re-rolled (but then both pieces have to be moved). When a player rolls a double, he/she has to move both pieces and roll again. As soon as the second piece of a player has reached the starting line of the first piece, he/she can also make use of a blockade piece which can be removed (and employed against another player) on a roll of "1".

(User summary by HilkMAN)

68954.name: Yo ho ho
68954.description:
Very simple roll and move game. Each player controls four playing pieces and moves them around a track (depicting a sunken ship). When a piece reaches a field with another piece, the one that was there first is kicked into the water and has to start over again. On some fields, a player can proceed to the finish line immediately. The first player to get all four pieces to the finish is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

68955.description: From rules summary: Plan.It is a planetary puzzle game where players take turns rotating and placing planet tiles to match as many like planets as possible. The main components of the game are 45 unique planet tiles that contain 1/2 of a planet on each of the 6 sides. The tile distribution ranges from having all sides represent the same planet to having up to 6 different planets represented. Players are randomly assigned exclusive planets that they need to score points for. On their turn, they will first perform a preliminary action in which they place or rotate a tile. Next, they perform a primary action by placing a tile and calculating the resulting score. The scores increase exponentially as more planets are matched at one time. Players discard one card at the end of their turn and then draw back up to the hand limit (3 for 2-4 players, 4 for solitaire). The game ends when the planet tile draw deck is exhausted. Players calculate their score by multiplying the score of their lowest scoring planet by 3 and then adding that to the score of their highest scoring planet.
68955.name: Plan.It

68956.name: Reise durch die Nacht
68956.description:
Players roll and move through five countries, trying to collect sand stars. The different fields they reach mean different "events", such as skipping a turn or collecting trophies. There is no real decision making involved.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

68957.name: Seal of the Imperium (Volume 1, Issue 1 - 1999)
rpgissuearticle: Battle Kibitzers' Guide #1: Armies of the Five Empires
Mitlanyal: La! Our Prayer are Answered!
68957.description:
From the front cover:

The fanzine of M.A.R. Barker's World of Tékumel.

Table of contents:

-Tékumel 101: Introduction to Tékumel by Theron Goudeau
-Khirgár: Defender of the North by Patrick Brady & James Maliszewski, with M.A.R. Barker
-The Churstálli by David Peters
-On N'lüss by Steve Pisani
-Tékumel 301: Intermediate Studies, M.A.R. Barker interviewed by Joe Saul
-GURPS Tékumel: Part I, Characters by Brett Slocum
-Redefining the Sword by Patrick Brady
-Setnák by M.A.R. Barker and Zane Healy
-Mitlanyál: La! Our Prayers are Answered! by Bob Alberti
-Battle Kibitzers' Guide #1: Armies of the Five Empires by Ken Fletcher

68958.name: Pull the Plug on Granny
68958.description:
From the rules:

Pull the Plug on Granny is a strategic game simulating the American health care reform debate of 2009-2010. One player plays the Democrats and one plays the Republicans. The Democrats win by creating a bill with a sufficient number of agenda items on it (each element of the bill has a certain number of Agenda Points), and having enough congressional support for the bill to pass. The Republican player wins by preventing one or both of those things from happening.

Designer summary:

Pull the Plug on Granny uses the basic CDG mechanic from Twilight Struggle. It was designed from the ground up as a print and play, with a small board and a short deck. Rules and game combined will take 15 pages, and if you have some card sleeves around, you can probably be playing in under an hour for just the cost of the ink and paper.

68959.name: Director's Screen
68959.description:
From the back cover:

Doyle: If you need help, then look no further. Angel Investigations is the best. Our rats are low-
-1.9 Hero

Ah, scratch that. No rats here... honest.

But Doyle does have one thing right - whether your series stars our favorite supernatural investigators or some newly created heroes, there's lots of help here.

Players look to your directors for scintillating storylines, captivating characters, fancy fisticuffs, and rules leadership. In the face of all that, we got your back. So, while your crew is out and baout helping the helpless and stopping the latest apocalypse, right here you'll find lots of aiding and abetting.

An oh-so-useful addition to your Angel Roleplaying Game sessions, the Angel Director's Screen includes:


A full-color, four-panel screen covered with Angel images and designs to wow the players.
Easily referenced game play charts and tables, freeing directors to focus on the machinations and mayhem, not the mechanics.
Blood Brothers, Part Two, the conclusion of the two-part episode begun in the Angel Corebook, involving a familiar and supremely dangerous foe.
Character creation charts and aids for bringing new heroes to life.

68960.name: Arsenal
68960.description:
From the back cover:

You're only as good as what you're carrying. The difference between the right weapon and the wrong one is the difference between living another day and ending up vacuum.

In this book, you'll find the weapons, armor and other gear you need to survive, along with vehicles to get you where you're going - and maybe even back again.

This is the best of what's out there - the rest is up to you.

68961.name: Contact
68961.description:
From the back cover:

Just over that rise ahead - you see them? Never laid your eyes on anything like that, did you? Well, neither did anyone lese - these are the aliens of the Shatterzone universe, and they're waiting for you inside these covers.

From teh unexpected encounters of Fleet scouts to the murderous inmates of Uru-Nabal, here are the strange, the wondrous, the deadly, many of them from beyond the reaches of the 'zone. They're cunning and trusting, fierce and fantastic, but most of all, they're ... alien.

This book contains descriptions and stats for dozens of new alien species for your Shatterzone campaign, suitable for use as player or gamemaster characters.

68962.name: Grimsyn Sector
68962.description:
From the back cover:

Fight shatrats at the edge of the 'zone. Run guns under the well-armed nose of Fleet. Duck through the sewers of the megacorp worlds, and sneer at the most dangerous fringers.

Grimsyn Sector. You might get rich, you might get famous. You might never leave.

68963.name: Stock Ships
68963.description:
From the back cover:

Stock Ships is a catalog of prominent ship types and classes throughout the Consortium of Worlds. From the Dart fighter to the Greatsword dreadnought, these ships represent a universe of starships, spaceships, drop ships, pirate vessels, mercenary cruisers, freighters, and patrol craft. All constructed using the Shatterzone ship creation system - with the occasional modification.

Stock Ships also includes a new chapter on equipment, optional rules, and ship construction and purchases for the veteran Shatterzone shipbuilder and novice alike.

So build your ship, climb aboard and head for the Outer Frontier.

We dare you.

68964.name: Hardwear/Softwear
68964.description:
Subtitle - Take a Walk on the Cyber Side

From the back cover:

Looking for the newest in bioware or cybertech? How about the latest information about what's hot on the nets? Then you've come to the right place, compatriots. Welcome to Hardwear/Softwear. We have everything you need right here.

Hardwear/Softwear is a resource for both the gamemaster and the player to use. It contains robots, bioware, skillsofts, and information about the various networks in the Shatterzone universe.

So, before you go out there unprepared, look into Hardwear/Softwear. It could mean the difference between being off-lined or making it to the next day.

68965.name: Verken je horizon
68965.description:
In this game the players must answer the questions about SS Rotterdam in each category. Categories are culture, ship, travels, misc.
Components include gameboard, dice, pawn, "boarding passes", chits and cards.

68966.description:
Text from box insert:

MUPPET BABIES - A color matching game for 2 to 4 players

Just imagine being a fairy princess, a super hero, the King of the Sea, or an Olympic star. These are the Muppet Babies fantasies and you can make them all come true by racing around the gameboard, collecting dreams and doing some very clever color matching.

Contents: 1 gameboard, 4 Muppet Baby playing pieces, 8 dream disks, dice cup, 1 die

Object:
Collect your two dream disks and be first to enter your Fantasy Circle
68966.name: Muppet Babies: A Color Matching Game

68967.name: Liiklusmäng
68967.description: Liiklusmäng is a simple roll and move game about teaching traffic rules to children. The players are bycyclists who's aim is to move safetly through a city.

68968.name: Dragon Quest
68968.description:
User summary:

Dragon Quest was the first release of software developer Enix' lately hugely successful series "Dragon Quest".

Dragon Quest is a typical japanese role playing vide game. The player controls the main characters (unnamed), who travels from village to village, town to town, battling monsters in so-called random enxounters when on the world map, gradually buying new equipment in towns and following the story line to finally defeat the evil demon lord who threatens the peace of the world.

The character and monster design is by Akira Toriyama, of Dragon Ball / Doctor Slump fame.

Individual credits:
Akira Toriyama: Character & monster design
Koichi Sugiyama: Music

68969.name: Rudra no Hihō
68969.description:
User summary:

Rudra's Hidden Treasure was one of the last RPGs that Square released for the Super Famicon. It boasted four parallell stories; each time the game was started, the played coulc choose which of the four characters to currently follow the storyline of. They intertwined and each provided detailed that made up the full story.

The game had a "kotodama" spell system, the player had to construct the spells by himself, by combining short words into full spell names. The game contained allusions to Final Fantasy and Dragon Quest in this aspect; one could enter the spells from those games and get the same effect.

The character design was made by the in Japan famous special effects designer Keita Amamiya.

There was never any official translation of this game; however pirate translations were made available for emulators after a couple of years.


from a duplicate entry

User Summary

Every 4000 years the world is destroyed and remade, play as three different characters, each in their own scenario, starting 15 days before the end of the world. The game world combines elements of fantasy and magic with more modern technology and weapons.

What separates the game from most RPGs is the magic system where you are able to learn and combine different "mantras" in your spell book to create spells with different powers and effects.

68970.name: Tug of War
68970.description:
Easy 2-person dicegame about decimate the opponents pawns.

Each player represents a team of athletes that will challenge the opposite team in a tug-of-war. The number of pawns in play for each side represents the strength of that team. Through the clever use of dice rolls, each player tries to reduce his opponent’s team strength, while building up his own side through fresh substitutions.

A kind of "do it yourself" - game.
You only need 18 pawns in two different colors and 9 ordinary dice

68971.name: Dragon Quest II
68971.description:
User Summary:

The second installment in Enix' hugely successful RPG series "Dragon Quest".

DQII was ported to the MSX and MSX2 in 1988, to the Super Famicon in 1993 (together with DQI), and to the Game Boy in 1999.

It was released in 1990 in the States under the name "Dragon Warrior II". The Game Boy version was released in the States in the year 2000.

Individual credits:
Akira Toriyama: Character & Monster design
Koichi Sugiyama: Music

68972.name: Dragon Quest III
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
68972.description:
User summary:

The third installment in Enix' hugely successful RPG series Dragon Quest. Dragon Quest I, II and III form the story of the legendary hero Roto. It was released as "Dragon Warrior III" in the States in 1992.

DQIII was ported to the Super Famicon in 1996 and for the Game Boy Colour in 2000 (in the states in 2001)

Individual credits:
Yuji Horii: Scenario, Game design
Akira Toriyama: Character & monster design
Koichi Sugiyama: Music
Manabu Yamana: Main program

68973.name: Dragon Quest V
videogamehonor: 2004 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
68973.description:
User summary:

The fifth installment in Enix' hugely successful RPG series Dragon Quest. DQV bore the under title "The bride of heaven".

The game was ported to the Playstation 2 in 2004 and to the nintendo DS in 2008.

Due to the fact that Square didn't take part in the SNES (the western version of the Super Famicon), this game was during a long time never released in the west, but in 2009, the DS version reached Europe and the States, where it was called "Dragon Quest V: Hand of the heavenly bride". In Europe, the "V" was skipped in the title.

Individual credits:
Akira Toriyama: Character & Monster design
Koichi Sugiyama: Music

68974.name: U.N. Squadron
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
68974.description:
User summary:

A horisontal scrolling shooter game first released for the arcades, based on Kaoru Shintani's comic book "Area 88". The player controls either Shin, Mick or Greg, their crafts have different abilities and speeds. Between each stage, you can buy weapons from the old man, for the money you've earned on each stage. Usually, the player has a choice between two or more stages to approach, but sometimes home base is attacked and the player has no choice but to enter the attacking force's stage.

The Super Famicon port features some changes to game play, and is by some considered to be superior to the arcade. Generally, Area 88 is considered to be one of the best shoot'em-ups for the SNES.

The US/EU release was renamed "U.N. Squadron". The publishers also changed the backdrop (from the original comic book) from being a dark, gritty story of scarred mercenaries who had had no choice but to abandon human feelings, to being a story of freedom fighters for the United Nations.

68975.name: The Rifter (Issue 40 - Oct 2007)
rpgissuearticle: A Walk on the Wild Side - Barbarians part 2
From the desk of Kevin Siembieda
68975.description:
Publisher Blurb:

10 Year Anniversary Special

The theme remains horror and monsters, with barbarians thrown in for good measure. And this issue is jam-packed with epic ideas and excitement.

- The Zombie Apocalypse is here! Excited about the news that Palladium will be releasing a Zombie RPG next year? Well, get your first look at it right here. In fact, there’s enough material here to get started playing an improvised version of the game!
- The Devil Muse for Beyond the Supernatural. A nightmare beastie that will make your skin crawl.
- Barbarians, Part Two, for the Palladium Fantasy RPG.
- Face the horrors of a Xiticix hive in Spoils of War, a giant adventure for Rifts.
- Spell books and magic for all settings.
- Circus! Circus! - fiction set on Rifts Earth.
- The latest chapter of Hammer of the Forge.
- News, coming attractions, lots of art and lots of fun.

68976.name: Seiken Densetsu 3
68976.description:
User summary:

Seiken Densetsu 3 is the third installment in Squares action RPG series "Seiken Densetsu" (or "Mana"). The second game, "Secret of Mana" had been a success in the States and Europe, but Seiken 3 was never officially translated into English.

In Seiken 3, the players started with choosing 3 out of 6 characters to play with. Like in its predecessors, the non-player controlled characters acted according to an AI that could be set in aggressive or passive mode. Unlike Seiken 2, however, Seiken Densetsu 3 did not feature a 3 player cooperative mode.

68977.name: Treasure Hunter G
68977.description:
Box back:

Solve the riddle of the seven mysterious Oparts!

The adventure abut the seven oparts hidden in the world, is about to begin.
And the only trail is the notes of your old man, who gave his life in the search for treasures…

Characters created with the latest CG techonolgy
Bombastic magics. Learn all the various techniques.
Action Point Battle that gets more interesting the more you fight.
highly detailed graphics.

68978.name: Tales of Phantasia
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
videogamefranchise: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)
68978.description:
Translated box back:
The first fantasy role playing game from Namco, featuring Kosuke Fujishima as the character designer.
Beautiful graphics, and voice acting, fully using all of the 48 mega. And a completely new battle system – Linear Motion Battle, a real battle system in the same spirit as action games.
The story of grand love and courage is awaiting you.

Individual credits:
Kosuke Fujishima: Character design

68979.name: The Gvurrdon Map Pack
68979.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Gvurrdon sector awaits your exploration in this huge poster map, featuring every system, trade link and starbase in the sector. Beautifully illustrated in full colour, this map is the third in a series that will allow you to explore the entire Third Imperium and beyond, joining posters together to form one gigantic map!

The Trojan Reaches are fully detailed and explored in Alien Module 2: Vargr.

Includes a full key to aid navigation.

68980.name: Paranoia: Internal Security
68980.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The mandatory enjoyment of Paranoia’s 25th Anniversary continues! With this high-security book, players can leave behind the trials and tribulations of Troubleshooters and instead bask in the joy of being Blue level Internal Security Troopers - to serve, to protect, to vaporise!

With a very different mission briefing, players will jump at the chance to play Troopers, the brave citizens who stand between Alpha Complex and the criminal minds who seek to subvert it. There is no way the dangers that plague Troubleshooters could follow them into this elite service. None at all.

There will be brand new dangers instead!

68981.name: Treason in Word and Deed
rpgitemversion: Verrat in Wort und Tat (German Version)
68981.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Troubleshooters! Internal Security believes that there is a traitor in your team! Therefore, you will be locked inside this vault for the next 72 hours and subjected to a series of rigorous psychological tests to determine your loyalty. If you are loyal, you have nothing to fear (except extreme physical discomfort, lack of oxygen, potential psychological damage and accidental termination). However, if you are a despicable traitor, then you will be uncovered and punished! Seal the vault! Let the testing commence!

A 32-page deathtrap, er, mission for Troubleshooters.

68982.name: Termination Quota Exceeded
68982.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Your termination quota's exceeded, but your happiness index is still way down in the doldrums of despair, and your loyalty index ain't looking too good. Total Security means that everything's tracked and monitored, including your own dwindling chances of survival. There's a whole sector of traitors out there, and your gun won't fire until the next business day. You've got the BLUE clearance blues.

A 32-page mission for IntSec Agents.

68983.name: Paranoia Forms Pack
68983.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Are your players not suffering enough in Paranoia? Change all that with this handy forms pack! Whether they are Troubleshooters, Internal Security agents or High Programmers, there is no situation that cannot be made more difficult with a form!

Want to requisition a new piece of equipment? Have a form!

Want to execute Alpha Complex’s most notorious traitor? Have a form!

Want to enter the mandatory briefing room? Have a form!

The Paranoia Forms Pack. The perfect instrument for discerning Games Master.

68984.name: Rette unsere Welt
68984.description:
Trivia game with an environmental theme. Players roll and move along a track, with the fields they move onto determining the category of the question asked. There are some special event fields, on which a player can swap positions with another player, try to steal another player's trophy, etc. The first player to hold two trophies from each category is the winner.
There are only 275 questions included, which limits replayability.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

68985.name: Wonder Project J
68985.description:
A "communication adventure" from Enix, for the Super Famicon.

Translated box back:
Hello! I am the machine boy Pino!! The island where I am living, Colco, is in trouble. The humans and the robots are fighting. But if the J circuit in my body activates…!?
Therefore, I need your help. Communicate with me, and save the island!

Individual credits:
Noriko Hidaka: Character voice

68986.name: De Profundis (2nd Edition)
68986.description:
User summary:
De Profundis is a role-playing game set in the world of Cthulhu mythos created by H.P. Lovecraft. The system is loosely based on a psychological technique called psychodrama - the game does not require a traditional game master, as all the action is presented in letters written in-character by the players.

The second edition has been expanded by rules adapting De Profundis for play by email and several articles about improving game flow and adapting the rules for other settings.

68987.name: Wonder Project J 2
68987.description:
Wonder Project J2 ~ Josette from Colro woods

Translated box back:

Josette, a pure-hearted and bottomlessly cheerful mechanical girl. Her destiny relies upon your communication with her.

The worlds first "artificial personality" on the Nintendo 64!!

Crying, laughing, getting upset, thinking. Depending on how you behave, she shows different faces of heerself.

Josette is always by your side…

Individual credits:
Noriko Hidaka: Character voice

68988.name: Sai Dov'è
68988.description:
This is a word memory game. 49 letter tiles are placed face-down on a 7x7 grid. Before the start, each player looks at three tiles. Then they take turns flipping over at least four tiles. If these tiles form a word in exactly that order (must be at least four letters long), the player takes the tiles as points. If not, the tiles are covered again. When no more words can be formed, the game ends and the player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN

68989.name: Nanatsu Kaze no Shima Monogatari
68989.description:
"The tale of the seven winds island".

Translated box back:

A wonderful fairy tale – for you only.

An ultimate digital edventure story book, that is "The Tales of the Seven Wind Island". A picture book where there is no Game Over, where there is no combat. But there is air and light, and another world populated by strange inhabitants filled with life.
Your job is to create one book with a story.
What you have seen with your friends, what you have felt, what you have experienced, that will all be told in the picture book your are creating.
There is no game over.
Search and find the story for you and you only, in the mystical world created by Keita Amamiya.

User note: Keita Amamiya is a famous special effects designer and illustrator.

Individual credits:
Keita Amamiya: World design

68990.name: Star Fox
68990.description:
User summary:

Star Fox is a 3D Shooter developed for the SNES by Nintendo. It was released in 1993 and is the first instalment in the Star fox Series. In Europe and Australia the game was titled Starwing. Star Fox was the first game to be equipped with the Super FX chip, which is used to create the 3D graphical style with use of polygons, which couldn't be done with the basic SNES Hardware.

In the game the player is Fox McCloud, captain of the four-headed Star Fox team. The team has to defeat the evil Andross, by fighting their way through the Lylat system to Andross' home planet Venom. While the player only controls Fox McCloud and his Arwing, the other team members take part in the battle as well, and request for help from the player sometimes.

The player can choose between three different routes from the home planet Corneria to the enemy planet Venom. These routes differ in difficulty. Some levels take place over a planet, others take place in space. All the members of the Star Fox team fly in an Arwing. An Arwing's main weapon is a laser beam-like weapon. This weapon can be improved by finding upgrades hidden in the levels. A secondary weapon are nova bombs. They are limited in supply, but can be found throughout the levels as well.

While the game is in many ways a Rail Shooter, the player has some freedom of movement. The main progress of the Arwing through the level is automatic, but the Arwing can be moved vertically and horizontally, which is needed to aim. Apart from that the player has the possibility to brake or accelerate. This can be used to dodge enemy attacks and flying objects, or to get certain upgrades. Bonusses can be received by flying through a series of gates or rings present in some levels.

The game has inspired sequels on Nintendo 64, Gamecube and Nintendo DS.

68991.name: Live a Live
68991.description:
User summary:
One of Square's less known RPGs for the SNES; Live A Live was never released in the West. It is a mixture of themes, featuring several mini-RPGs, some of which have more in common with adventure games. Upon completing them all, the player is treated with an extra surprise.

Translated box back:
A new style RPG with a world selection

Several worlds, different in time and place.
Each chapter has different systems, with a varied sun factor.
Not just a collection of mini games. The story's deep!




Prehistoric chapoter: In a world without words, you rely on smell!
Bakumatsu chapter: Sneak into the maze-like castle, and save the captive!
Kung Fu chapter: Choose your successor among three pupils!
Western chapter: Place your traps and get the outlaws!
Modern chapter: Steal the special abilities of your opponeents, and aim to be the best!
Near future chapter: Use telepathy to find the truth!
SF chapter: Use your brains to save the ship from panic!

Individual credits:
Yoko Shimomura: Music

68992.description:
User summary:

One of Square's most famous role playing games for the Super Famicon, Chrono Trigger features character design by Akira Toriyama of Dragon Ball fame and music by Yasunori Mitsuda. It is by many considered to be the best RPG for the Super Nintendo.

The battle scenes in Chrono Trigger were special in the way that each character had an individual timer on when they could act, and one character could wait for another to be ready and form a combination special attack.

The game was subsequently ported to the Playstation by TOSE and into a remake on the Nintendo DS.

Translated box back:
A grande story bridging over dimensions.
Travel through time, to a far distant future. Fearful events and unexpected people are awaiting you there.

A new style command-type battle system.
All combats take place on the same screen, in real time. With several command types, the battles are tactical.

A fresh presentation of Akira Toriyama's world.
Detailed graphics, using all 32 megabits. You will enjoy an adventure in a true Akira Toriyama world.
videogamehonor: 2008 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
68992.name: Chrono Trigger
videogamefranchise: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

68993.name: The Cape Cod Vacation Game
68993.description: From box and instruction sheet: Game includes gameboard, 25 game pieces, two dice and play money. Each player starts with $715 in cash and five tokens, both playing pieces are placed at start/finish line, high roll of one die determines which player goes first. The object of the game is to visit the P'town Tower, dispose of all five tokens by purchasing activity squares and get back acroos finish line with money to spare.

68994.name: 100 Street Vendors of the City State
68994.description:
AGP 06201
Contains one hundred fully-described vendors, including stats, in the City-State of the Invincible Overlord, as well as information on haggling, coinage, and random encounters of vendors, depending on quarter of the city or street.
(From inside book)

68995.name: Election Day
68995.description:
From the Decktet wiki: Rule of the land was benevolently shared by the six Crowned Princes. Every five years the people would elect one of the Princes to lead the land for the next five years. Before the election, the Princes would hold a series of debates in which they would demonstrate why they were most fit to lead for the next five years. The debates were always reviewed by the three major newspapers and typically two of the papers' editors would agree that one of the Princes won the debate while the third paper's editor would choose someone else as the clear victor. In the end, the people would vote and a new leader would rule peacefully for another five years.

Election Day takes great advantage of the structure of the Decktet cards. There are 6 suits with 2 suits on each card. Each suit represents a prince. Each player plays one card face up on their turn until all players pass, ending the debate. The suit appearing most frequently during the debate keeps two of its highest point cards as influence points until the end of the game. The next most frequently appearing suit keeps one of its highest point cards until the end of the game. After all the debates, the influence cards accumulated are added up and the suit with the most influence indicates who the winning prince is. The player who backed that prince is the winning player.

68997.name: Club
68997.description: Publisher blurb: CLUB is an adults only, R rated collectors card game with pin-up art by the world's most dangerous cartoonist, William Levy, known for his underground comic book work in five countries. In this game, you run a strip club, trying to earn cash and avoid the wrath of your neighbors. Deal with street gangs, hustlers, egotistic dancers, crossdressers, and all the other facets of the business, while admiring the sensuous art. Starter deck contains 60 cards, instructions, and a dash of crazy.

68998.name: Ragnarok Battle Offline
68998.description:
User summary:

A "go to the right, kill all enemies" action game for Windows. The game allows for three players at the same time, and is based on the online game "Ragnarok" by Gravity. Created by a Japanese fan circle, this game received an official endorsement and was widely spread even outside the "home made games" market.

Players create a character based on one of the classes (Fighter, Archer, Merchant, Mage etc) and advance through the stages. As they level up, the player can choose how to improve the characters. Level 20 is maximum.

Translated box back:

The famous Flash animation is now a playable game for real!
A luxurious production with the full collaboration of the flash animation producer Syunpu Minamimuke, and the Korean Gravity Corp, the developer of the MMORPG "Ragnarok Online".


A true game version of the famous flash animation "Ragnarok Battle Online"! The scenes that everyone dreamt of can now be replayed in Windows!
A fresh action game with simple controls and speedy adancement! A game with a broad appeal, all from gentlemen to fair ladies. Of course, we also recommend it to crazy brothers! wWw
Six jobs, choose between 12 characters, and embark on adventure! The adventure can, as the flash, be played with 3 players simultaneously!
A painstaking piece of work we can pridefully present to all the country's 120 million Ragnarok players! Several memorable scenes that will bring tears to the eyes of fans! How many of them do you get?


Note: This game does not have any online capabilities. This is an offline version of the famous flash animation "Ragnarok Battle Online".

68999.name: Higurashi Daybreak
68999.description:
Translated box back:

The characters from "When they cry…" are wreaking havoc in a 3D emulation of Hinamisawa!!
A 3D vs action game where everything you wanted is possible!

The ultimate club activity, in the fight of the treasure of Furude shrine!! The scenario is written by 7th Expansion. (But
nothing scary this time)

A true fight, 2 on 2!
You can play in two teams as a tag battle. The combinations with your partner are more important than your own skill. Depending on the stage, the fight style will change. Use everything to your advantage and change your destiny!

All the unique characters!
All characters from "When they cry…" participate in this club activity. They vary from ranged specialists to melee specialists, from trap-setting to healing. Aim for the style that you master the best. Who do you like the most?

Full voice!
The same voice actors as in the original drama CD. When all four are on the stage, talking here and there, you are truly in the Hinamisawa atmosphere.

Battle across a network!
Using a network, you can play up to four players. You can easily connect to faraway friends and play! Hone your skills and challenge the world! You can also talk to each other using the chat function.

69000.name: Romancing SaGa
69000.description:
Translated box back:

The three evil gods…
Saluin
Death
Sheraha
They, who once challenged the other gods to battle, were defeated by gods and men fighting as one. The last remaining Saluin was sealed into the destiny stone. But time has passed, and the seal is about to be broken…

An RPG with a "free scenario system"
The player does not travel along the story, but advances the game as they choose. The player chooses the main character. Romancing SaGa is an adventure that you yourself creates.


Apart from the SFC and WSC versions, the game has also been released for several mobile systems and Wii virtual console. in 2009***
